jobs.title: Software Engineer - Data & Semantic - AI team
jobs.content:
What will you be doing?


We are looking for a software engineer with big data experience to join our data & semantic team. You will be working on developing our market-leading products, in the collaborative and growing AI team based in our central London office. The future of our product is focused around utilising AI solutions to revolutionise how we diagnose, treat and prevent diseases; your effort will contribute heavily to the services that the data science and NLP teams are building within the Artificial Intelligence team.


You will help us build and support great products across Babylon, as well as shaping our vision of an intelligent virtual assistant for the medical domain, in order to make health care affordable and accessible for everyone.


You will be working with the rest of the AI team, identifying solutions that can enhance their services through data integration, planning how required data can be sourced, provided and utilized to have the greatest impact. This will include working with the output of our information extraction pipeline and feeding it into our large medical domain knowledge base and graph database. This will be done via transforming existing data sources as well as a crawl-and-extract pipeline to form new ones. You will be involved with setting up a reproducible, automatic process across different data sets, and making sure that our knowledge base is up to date when an update is published for a data set that was loaded in the past.


As a member of our artificial intelligence team there will be opportunities to learn about ontologies, data science, natural language processing and information extraction. Our company is a fast growing, dynamic environment where your tasks will constantly evolve and you will have the opportunity to learn something new every day.


We have a team of the best people you’d ever want to meet, working on some of the most futuristic projects. We like people who are smart, funny, innovative and tenacious, who can adapt and work together.

jobs.title: Core Backend Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Core Backend Developer (m/f) to support our Data Engineering Team. You will be responsible for providing high level PHP code as well as analyse an refactor our existing code base. As an expert for clean code and design patterns, you will help your colleagues to further build a modern software architecture. You will work in a friendly team atmosphere, use agile methods and have the chance to develop yourself professionally and personally.


Your responsibilities:



  • PHP development on a very high level

  • Build and maintain our next-generation background jobs framework “Orchestra” using technologies like PHP7, Docker, Mesos, RabbitMQ, Redis

  • Help clean up and refactor our legacy code base and move it to a modern architecture centered around composer, containers and microservices

  • Understand and solve performance issues and faults from a low-level perspective

  • Support our Devops team in moving forward towards a true continuous deployment process

  • Mentor other team members in topics like: clean code, design patterns, development standards

jobs.title: Front-end / Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
Front-end development is volwassen geworden de afgelopen jaren. En daarnaast ook nog eens zeer dynamisch. Regelmatig zijn er nieuwe frameworks die de wijze waarop we oplossingen bouwen veranderen. Aan Quintor de uitdaging om continu te bepalen hoe we het beste betrouwbare oplossingen hiermee kunnen realiseren. We zoeken daarom developers die de ontwikkelingen op de voet volgen en software development zien als hun ambacht. 




Dus heb jij net als wij passie voor innovatieve technologie? Zit samenwerken in je bloed en leg jij de lat telkens iets hoger dan jouw collega’s? Wil jij tot de besten in het vak behoren? Wellicht is deze vacature voor jou dan de ideale volgende stap!



Als Front-end Developer bij Quintor werk je mee in één van onze Agile teams. In deze functie ben je verantwoordelijk voor webapplicaties, variërend van zeer grote tot kleine projecten.

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
Quintor heeft een uitdagende vacature voor een java developer. Heb jij net als wij passie voor Java technologie, zit samenwerken in jouw bloed, leg jij de lat telkens iets hoger dan jouw collega’s en wil jij tot de besten in het vak behoren? Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging in jouw carrière als Java Software Developer? Wellicht is deze vacature voor jou de ideale volgende stap!




Als Java developer werk je mee in een van onze Agile teams. Wij maken hierbij gebruik van een professionele ontwikkelstraat gebaseerd op Atlassian tooling. We werken met frameworks zoals Spring, RESTful, JSON, JPA/Hibernate, Akka en Angular JS.


Wil jij samen met ons voorop lopen in de Java technologie? Geloof jij ook in Agile? Wil je werken in Scrum teams en meewerken aan innovatieve projecten met state of the art technieken? Is dat vier keer een Ja, dan is Quintor voor jou de ideale volgende stap in jouw loopbaan.

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Quintor heeft een uitdagende vacature voor een .NET developer. Werken als .NET Developer bij Quintor Amersfoort betekent werken aan complexe en uitdagende projecten. Werken met nieuwe technologieën en frameworks. Werken in een team met professionele collega’s en werken aan jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.


Quintor heeft veel ervaring in het succesvol uitvoeren van software ontwikkelprojecten. We richten ons hierbij primair op maatwerk waarmee we inmiddels een groot aantal omvangrijke systemen hebben ontwikkeld. Onze specialisten realiseren bij onze klanten, in-house of op locatie, duurzame IT- systemen die naadloos aansluiten bij de wensen van de business.


Als .NET developer werk je mee in één van onze Agile teams. Je richt je zowel op de front-end op basis van Client-Side Javascripting of mobiele technologie als op de back-end. De systemen die Quintor ontwikkelt, kenmerken zich door high performance, high load, transactionaliteit en de focus op beheerbaarheid en kwaliteit.

jobs.title: Team Lead Web Development
jobs.content:
As a Team Lead Web Developer at Coolblue you will support your team define the shopping experience of hundreds of thousands of people daily.

What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like Yoda. ‘Code size matters not. Judge it by it's size you should not. For my ally is The Code. And a powerful ally it is.'"

What you will really be doing
  • You will work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master.
  • You will act as the technical conscience of the teams, keeping a bird eye view on the state of our codebase and initiating projects to keep it up to date and in tip-top shape.
  • You will help Product Owners in aligning the functional with the technical needs.
  • You will support team members defining their goals and the strategy to achieve them.
How will you be doing this?
  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members, you will make them “a little bit better every day”.
  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your teams in collaboration with our IT recruitment department and some more HR related tasks.
  • Taking part in team meetings to provide your knowledge and insights where needed.
  • Reviewing code, evangelising best practices and sustaining a culture of pragmatism as well as craftsmanship.
  • Keeping up to date with the latest in Web development, improving our tools and processes where needed.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice.
What a day in the office might look like
You arrive in the office in the morning, just in time for a coffee before the daily stand up with your team. You discover Marco is working on a story which is becoming more and more complex, so you help him keeping things simple and at the same time aligned better with the business case. After the stand up you sit beside Rafael who is having troubles working on a Google Analytics API client. You try to understand what is exactly the problem and with your help, Rafael come up with a new approach on how to solve the problem.

You meet a candidate over lunch. You aren’t looking at skills yet, you just want to get to know her. How would her personality match with the rest of the herd? Can she communicate ideas clearly and concisely? Can she talk fluently about the technologies Coolblue deploys? It’s your shot at filtering out candidates that don’t fit the mould. Not bad, not bad at all. She passes. For now. Of course, your senior team members will pick her apart technically later.

In the afternoon, you have a face to face sync with Rafael. You ask if the new approach for the API client is working. Then you talk about what he will be focusing on the upcoming months. He has no clear idea about that and so you ask him questions about which epic motivates him the most and which task he prefers. Rafael has a clearer idea now about his focus and he will think how to keep attention in this. 
Since you have no more meetings in the day, you propose a table tennis tournament with the whole team. The team loves that and even if you lose all of the matches, you have a great time.

Team
You'll work with one or two cross functional teams formed by Back-end and Front-end Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master. They have different levels of experience and you will support them towards becoming even more amazing than they already are. Your teams, together with other teams in the same family, are responsible for a particular domain of our software architecture.

Required experience & skills
  • (Applied) university-level degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering or Mathematics.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a developer. 
  • Experience in web development is required: our backend technologies are mostly PHP and NodeJS, so having prior background in writing high performance code in these languages is beneficial, but not required (one of our team leads has a background in Ruby).
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving the skills of your colleagues both technical and professional wise.
  • You know how to automate your deployment and quality assurance.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.
If you're interested in this position, feel free to apply. We really appreciate if you include the following in your cover letter: why you want to work at Coolblue, what team (work) experience you have and we're curious about your experience/ideas when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.

jobs.title: I'm a roadie for Coolblue! Creating stability behind the scenes!
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.

What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no – I will not fix your computer."

What you will really be doing
  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.
  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.
  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.
  • Working in teams, consisting of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers. 
How will you be doing this?
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.
  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.
  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: PHP Architect
jobs.content:
As a PHP Architect at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are architecturally sound and provide our customer the best experience ever.

What you tell your friends you do
"I architect web shops. And no – I will not fix your computer."

What you will really be doing
  • Coming up with solutions about how to improve the performance of all our web shops.
  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.
  • Working in teams, consisting of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers.
How will you be doing this?
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You prioritize the work together with your team and Product Owner.
  • You will have a lot of opportunities to experiment, learning directly from the immediate feedback you will receive from end users.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • You will measure performance and reliability of all the new features you will introduce and you will be ready to fix something that goes wrong.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice.
What a day in the office might look like.
You receive a Pull Request on Github from Erik, a junior backend developer who is working at extending the microservice responsible for order information. You noticed he over complicated his solution, so you sit beside him and you ask why he decided to implement his solution on that way. At your question “Don’t you think this method is too big?”, Erik decides to refactor the code a little bit and together with you he creates a more SOLID solution.

It’s already lunch time, and since there is a beautiful sun outside, you decide to have a sandwich with Erik in  the Central Station square just in front of the office. During lunch, Erik shows his interest on TDD, a practise he knows but he has small experience with. So you decide to work with him at the next story in the sprint with a pair programming session. He is pretty enthusiast and you are amazed how he could work in a TDD way with very few hints from your side. The first task of the story is done and Erik and you ask Kevin to review the related Pull Request. Kevin thinks your test class is too messy, so he joins you and Erik behind the same computer. You recognise you should have mocked up your dependencies better and Erik starts doing that with Kevin’s support.

Team
You will be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization (backend and frontend developers, UX designers). Your team will work together to a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. Your team is part of a family, formed by teams responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re a positive team player over a brilliant jerk.
  • Minimum of seven years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • Clean Architecture is on your DNA.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You know how to write clean, readable and extendable PHP code.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Create smiles by writing awesome code
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.

What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no – I will not fix your computer."

What you will really be doing
  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.
  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.
  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.
  • Working in teams, consisting of 5 (+/- 2) developers and designers. 
How will you be doing this?
  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.
  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.
  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.
  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.
  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.
  • By actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members. 
What we have worked on last quarter
  • Second chance. Giving returned products a second chance by offering them on the website with a discount.
  • High performance authentication system. Customers can now login on the website through a fast NodeJS microservice. 
What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...

Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

Required experience & skills
  • You’re smart and have some way to prove it.
  • Minimum of five years experience as a PHP developer.
  • You're experienced when it comes to improving your colleagues craftsmanship and technical skills.
  • You're able to solve problems using accepted best practices and principles like SOLID and design patterns.
  • You care about code quality.
  • You know how to automate recurring development steps and implement them in continuous integration and deployment systems.
  • Scrum/Agile way of working is almost your second nature.
  • You understand and investigate what a user wants and feels.
  • Experience in working with large codebases and custom frameworks is a plus.
  • Knowledge of Clean (Onion) architecture and PaaS is a plus.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
We offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Machine Learning Engineer you use the data of millions of visitors to enable Coolblue to act smarter.

What you tell your friends you do
"I am the fortune teller of Coolblue. After investigating and analysing different data sources, I understand the past and I predict the future."

What you will really be doing
  • Performing complex in-depth analyses by using statistical models.
  • Create new insights, design procedures and smart solutions for the future of the business.
  • Integrating analyses, data and business processes by incorporating the data solutions in our systems.
  • Collaborate with the IT Development team to ensure the correct implementation of algorithms, the creation of new features and the launch of real-time model experiments
  • Proposing improvement initiatives that enable constant improvements at Coolblue.
  • Coaching junior Data Scientists.
  • Advising your team members and colleagues.
How will you be doing this?
  • You are fully aware of the fact that you first need quality data in order to perform optimal analysis, and you know just how to obtain this from various data sources.
  • Provide technical expertise and solutions to Data technologies with a focus on Business Analytics / Business Intelligence.
  • You use this data for analyses and implement this autonomously in the many software systems that Coolblue has at its disposal.
  • Implement machine learning techniques firstly as prototype, to later on implement it in a production environment.
  • You will use the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you.
  • You experiment with new technologies and ideas and put them to work on your own.
  • You work in multidisciplinary teams and you can easily navigate a quickly expanding organisation.
What we have worked on last quarter
  • We have implemented an online product alternatives done with PySpark. 
  • We have increased the precision and performance of our forecasting procedures by using a Stochastic Gradient Boosting method.
  • Preparing an approach for a daily price-elasticity estimation by product.
  • Internal challenge to predict the user gender using the information generated in a session. 
What a day in the office might look like
This day you’ll have the challenge to improve our weekly sales forecasting models. Of course you make a plan on how to achieve this. You would like to have more knowledge about the current situation. Therefore you need to gather the necessary data from our systems and plot it in such a way that you see the situation in terms of precision. In the afternoon you’ll have a talk with the colleagues who have worked on this problem earlier, but you would like to prepare yourself well for the meeting. You gained a nice idea from the meeting and work this out. Now you can make a prototype to improve the forecast working with only a small sample of the time series, in this case you decide to create a script written in R with your new approach. Nice! You increased the precision of the forecast by 2% in average.  It only pays off when the algorithm is implemented, so therefore you make plans how you are going to do this in the upcoming weeks..

Required experience and skills
  • Preferably university-level degree, MSc. or PhD. in Mathematics, Computer science or Statistics.
  • At least 4 years of relevant business experience in a similar environment (experience only in academia is not enough)
  • Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensional data from varying sources.
  • You have extensive experience in writing scripts in Python and/or R.
  • You have experience with Data mining, SQL, BigQuery, and NoSQL.
  • You have a sound experience in applying Machine Learning techniques like GBM, Random Forest, Elastic-Net, Deep learning and demonstrable experience in applying those techniques (or similar) successfully in a corporate setting.
  • Previous experience with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra is highly desirable.
  • It is a big plus to have knowledge in at least one of the following languages: Scala, Java, .NET, Delphi, Perl or PHP.
  • Willing to relocate to Rotterdam (or to reasonable daily travel distance).
Other
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize in an agile team.
  • Analytical thinker, flexible problem solver and team player.
  • Must be an individual with high integrity and strong work ethic
Offer
  • Money.
  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.
  • Room for you to do things your way.
  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish..
  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.
  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.
  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties.

jobs.title: Developer with passion for data
jobs.content:
You will bring your functional programming skills and passion to make sense of all kinds of data to our business intelligence teams.

If your friends ask what you do, you’ll say
"If it needs doing more than once, I automate it. If the data has value, I make it useable."

What we have worked on last quarter
  • Automated a ton of ETL process and deployment pipelines
  • Lots of BigQuery
  • Sent a ton of deprecated systems to the eternal dustbin somewhere
  • Made new logistic and commercial data actionable
Your team
In a few words, we - ask why a lot, automate everything, make data actionable, are willing to help, have a great team, use everything from SQL to Puppet to Python to BigQuery, enjoy our responsibilities. 

When you check the mirror before leaving home, is this you?
  • You ask why and then why and again why before tackling a problem.
  • You know how to get your development machine up and running - we love Darwin and Linux - we hope you do too :).
  • You have plenty experience with functional programming - we love Python.
  • You know how to chat up any database and get what you want - we flirt with SQL Server and BigQuery.
  • Before you asked, you checked Google and Stackoverflow.
  • Whether it’s Vim or Emacs knock yourself out we love to Bash zsh.
  • Spaces not tabs unless it’s Go - not the Pokemon variant.
  • The cloud is just someone else’s computer, it’s great when they manage stuff for us, and otherwise it’s just another place to have your container settle down and replicate.
  • Data, data, data and not the pale android.
  • You know how to get your code to production - continuously within in every sprint - some words that describe us: Git, TeamCity, Puppet, RESTful, API, you get the gist...
  • You are not scared to deploy awesome features on Friday, and know when you sleep in on Saturday all is well.
  • Bonus points if you have Untappd, like eating Chinese food Friday lunchtime and you want to work opposite the coolest and shiniest kapsalonbakje in Holland.
  • Kudos if you can beat us at the pooltable.
What we bring to the table
  • A chair, a macbook and some pretty cool colleagues.
  • Lots to learn, conferences and trainings.
  • Time to recharge.
  • Flexible work times - as long as you make the stand-up.
  • An amazing office in the heart of Rotterdam.
  • Industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables, great lunch, team activities and awesome parties and a pool table.

jobs.title: 软件工程师 (Javascript)
jobs.content:
作为 Formidable 软件工程师，您将使用现代前端技术堆栈，为全球最大型、最成功的公司开发全新的应用程序、功能和工具 。您将深入到客户团队中，在那里，我们的工程师被视为技术领袖。您也将有机会在以社区为主导的开源项目中工作。与其他 Formidable 团队，可确保您时刻处于行业趋势和工具的领先位置，还能不断培养您的专业技能。

您将负责使用最新的前端技术，兼容标准和下一代 CSS 语法，建立可快速响应的用户界面。您还将编写具有一致性、可发现的 API 服务，以及在前端和后端编写单元和集成测试的过程中解锁成就。

您需要拥有以下技能：

  • 高度熟练使用 JavaScript，并了解其优良和不足部分的相关知识。
  • 具备 Git 知识以及团队协同开发经验。
  • 可展现的快速学习能力。

丰富的现代网页应用程序堆栈相关经验：

  • 前端框架，例如包含 Flux 的 React，或者 Backbone
  • Node.js 框架，例如 Express 或 Hapi
  • 持久层，例如 MongoDB 或 PostgreSQL

精通前端标记和样式：

  • CSS 与其预处理器，以及 CSS3
  • 前端模板化

  • HTML5

  • 熟悉设计模式、 数据结构和算法。

额外加分项：

  • 拥有 iOS 或 React Native 相关经验
  • 拥有领导团队的经验。

我们是谁 Formidable 是一家私人持有、自负盈亏的公司，总部位于华盛顿州西雅图市弗里蒙特近郊。不论客户是初创公司或财富 500 强企业，我们都能根据其需求量身定制产品，包括开发完整网页应用，为客户团队入驻专家，以及提供行业领先、专注技术的培训。同时，我们正在通过推动开源软件的使用和教学，以及追求行业机遇和成长，不断推进现代互联网的前沿发展。

Formidable 致力于聘用适合此工作职位的最优秀人才，不分种族、宗教、国籍、性别、性取向、年龄、婚姻状况、兵役状况或残疾状况。 根据联邦法律的规定，所有被聘用的人员都将被要求验证在美国工作的身份和资格，并在聘用时完成所需的就业资格验证文档。

此职位位于中国。我们正在中国大陆寻找应聘者，目前我们有计划与最优秀的应聘者启动远程合作。 当我们拥有足够规模的团队后，我们将在上海、北京开设办事处，并还将根据我们大多数开发者居住的城市选取另一办事处地址。

jobs.title: Faculty Position in Product Design
jobs.content:
School of Art, Design and Media
Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

Faculty Position in Product Design
Young and research-intensive, Nanyang Technological University (NTU Singapore) is ranked 13th globally. It is also placed 1st amongst the world’s best young universities. The School of Art, Design and Media (ADM) at NTU Singapore invites qualified academics to apply for a faculty position as either Assistant Professor or Associate Professor (tenure track).

Candidates with expertise in one or more of the following are encouraged to apply:
1) 3D Form and Conceptual Design
Include topics such as: Semantics of form, shape, geometry, colour and texture in design, visualisation and design thinking.

2) User Centred Design
Include topics such as: Experience design, sustainability in design, design for special needs, responsible design.

3) Product Design in South East Asia
Include topics such as: Ethnic design, cultural influences, Asia design history, crafts based design, etc.

4) New Technologies
Include topics such as: Innovation and new product development, virtual product design and rapid prototyping, design for emerging technologies and hybrid physical ubiquitous computing, embedded systems, mobile media, interaction design, etc.

The School of Art, Design and Media (ADM) is the first comprehensive art school in Singapore. It offers a studio-based professional education in a comprehensive university setting, providing students the knowledge and skills needed to develop and produce groundbreaking artworks and related scholarly activity. ADM also promotes Singapore’s creative culture and identity, and is positioned to play a central role in the transformation of Singapore into a regional centre of media and creativity. Currently, ADM offers a four-year BFA program with six concentrations – Digital Animation, Digital Filmmaking, Digital Photography, Visual Communication, Interactive Media, and Product Design. It is developing a BA in Art History and has started a PhD in Art, Design and Media. ADM's programmes embrace imagination, innovation, and critical thinking within a strongly multicultural and global context, and they foster individual authorship as well as collaboration and cooperation among diverse fields and constituencies. NTU provides excellent opportunities for funded faculty research, and excellent facilities for creative production.

The BFA in Product Design is a four year program. The objective of the program is to produce designers who will emerge as leaders in the design of products: from “everyday” objects to complex industrial products. The program embraces the principles of sustainable design and seeks to be relevant to the region in which it is situated as well as to uphold the highest of international standards.

Applicants should possess a strong background in professional product design as well as teaching on the undergraduate and post-graduate university levels, including mentoring of Final Year Projects and post-graduate theses. A strong research/creative profile is required. A terminal MFA or PhD degree is expected.

International applicants with a background in transdisciplinary and multicultural practice and research are encouraged. The successful candidate is expected to maintain an active research/creative production profile, as well as a commitment to teaching and to service in the form of administration and committee participation. An open, collaborative approach and willingness to work across areas and departments of the school and university is a priority. The school has excellent facilities, and there are many opportunities for funded research.

Emoluments and General Terms and Conditions of Service
Salary will be competitive and will commensurate with qualifications and experience. The University offers a comprehensive fringe benefit package. Information on emoluments and general terms and conditions of service is available at http://www.ntu.edu.sg/NSS/NSSHumanResources/Pages/General-Terms-for-Faculty-Positions.aspx

Further information about the University and the School can be viewed at the following websites:
NTU: www.ntu.edu.sg
ADM: www.ntu.edu.sg/adm

Application Procedure
To apply, please refer to the Guidelines for submitting an Application for Faculty Appointment (http://www.ntu.edu.sg/ohr/career/submit-an-application/Pages/Faculty-Positions.aspx) and send your application package [consisting of cover letter, curriculum vitae, personal particulars form, names and addresses of three references (do not send letters of recommendation or placement files), and evidence of work in the field. The evidence may be in the form of DVDs, CDs, websites, and photocopies (text)] to:

The Search Committee
School of Art, Design and Media
Nanyang Technological University
81 Nanyang Drive, Level 3,
Singapore 637458
Email: ADMHR@ntu.edu.sg

Applications must be clearly marked “Assistant Professor Position: Product Design, School of Art, Design and Media” or “Associate Professor Position: Product Design, School of Art, Design and Media”. Electronic submission of application is encouraged.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Closing date for applications: 18 November 2016.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Amperity, a stealth-mode enterprise software company, is looking for a Principal full-stack software engineer to join our initial team as we build the next great billion-dollar Seattle company! Using the cloud, scale-out automation, data science, and a pinch of machine learning, we're taking siloed enterprise data and turning it into integrated, actionable datasets!


Amperity is backed by some of the most notable names in tech -- including Madrona Venture Group, Liquid 2 Ventures, Hyde Park Ventures, and top executives and founders from multi-billion dollar companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Concur, and Isilon Systems. Amperity is well capitalized, having raised $9M in its seed round in February. Full press release


If you thrive on solving hard problems, have a desire to push yourself to the limits, and want to have fun in the process, then we would love to talk with you about joining our team.


Interesting problems:



  • Our system involves ingestion of terabytes of data per day, blending batch processing with real-time events

  • We automatically combine data together across disparate systems, and improve this process in generalized ways

  • We allow users to perform complex, real-time queries across aggregated datasets


Technologies we use:



  • Open Source tools, such as Accumulo, Spark, and Kafka

  • Cloud-first automation, including Apache Aurora and SaltStack

  • Neural nets, random forests, logistic regression, and probabilistic databases

  • Emacs AND vi!


About you:



  • You have at least 10 years of software development experience

  • You have experience leading complex distributed systems

  • You think about scalable architectures and great customer end to end experience

  • You improve things by 10x, not just 10%

  • You have worked in a DevOps environment, and drive sustainability such that DevOps is more Dev than Ops

  • You have built JVM oriented production systems

  • Your ears perk up when somebody says “graph traversal”

  • You are open-minded, inclusive, and motivated to make good decisions

  • You bring something new and rare to the party!

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas freely.



Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive environment.


With 'Share with Creatubbles', any company, organization or individual can very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and creative!) ways.




  •        Main site: www.creatubbles.com

  •        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com

  •        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com




About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 18 people, covering 11 nationalities and operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $16MM from private and strategic corporate investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.



About our development Team and Technologies



  • Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO, 1 front-end developer, 4 full-stack developers and one test engineer.

  • We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly Sprints.

  • Github, Codeship, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the many friends we rely on every single day.

  • ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members are located on the other side of the world.

  • Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the decision-making process.

  • We love Ruby on Rails but have switched our web app over to Ember.js in the past year, building up a lot of Ember.js experience.

  • With our apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques.

  • Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

  • The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

  • Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to review our security strategy.




About you




  • You have experience working with Rails and one of the Javascript frameworks.

  • You know your way with databases and APIs but what you are really passionate about is javascript, html and css.

  • You insist on clean code that leads to beautiful user-interfaces.

  • You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc

  • You have experience troubleshooting cross-browser compatibility issues

  • You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

  • You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a big plus).

  • You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

  • You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for our users.

  • You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity



What we offer



  • A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

  • We love remote work but relocation to Tokyo can also be arranged.

  • Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone to work when they are the most productive.

  • A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Lynx Analytics is seeking a Senior R&D Software Engineer in Budapest, Hungary.



  • Join us on an ambitious product development project! Besides programming, the work involves challenging mathematical, algorithmic and graph-theoretic problems.

  • Our very flat engineering organization needs lighthouses who can understand business goals and make technical decisions to support them.

  • Work with our fast growing team (currently around 10 people) on the design and implementation of the software. The team is a diverse mix including industry veterans (e.g. ex-Googlers) and recent graduates. Work with research professors from Columbia and Berkeley on the theoretical challenges.

  • Work in Budapest, visit the US and Southeast Asia. On your trips you would lay the foundations of grand new projects, solve problems that nobody else can, and generally impress clients and coworkers.

  • Build on modern technologies that will influence the future of computing.


    • Our primary language of development is Scala, a fantastic and apparently successful experiment at fusing functional and object-oriented programming.

    • Our software is designed from the start for cluster computing and linear scaling. We use the Apache Spark distributed computing framework, which is on track to becoming the de facto industry standard.

    • We use Docker for everything that makes sense. (And more!)


  • Help guide projects within the monumental business world of giant telecommunications corporations, banks, Smart Cities, UN Regional Groups and more. (The total reach of all Lynx Analytics clients is close to half a billion people.)

  • A flexible work schedule, a cheerful team, and great salary await you! (1,000,000 – 1,300,000 HUF / month gross.)

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - Product Engineer

TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.

Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking for a number of Product Engineers to join our Tallinn office. As a Full Stack Product Engineer you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. There are a number of teams that we are currently looking for awesome developers to join in Tallinn, you will be applying for all and throughout your journey with us you will get to find out about them all!



As part of the a Product-Engineering team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.



Product engineers only

Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production.

We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results. We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world. They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.
