jobs.title: Caseworker - Conversational Spanish
jobs.content: Job Classification: Caseworker Schedule: 2 Reports To: Program Supervisor FLSA Status: Non-Exempt Approved alternative job titles: Counselor, Medical Caseworker, Social Services Caseworker. Summary: This position provides a broad range of basic casework services within guidelines established by the Organization and specific programs. Populations served will vary by program but may include: children; adults; families; immigrants; refugees; and individuals with mental illness, HIV/AIDS and/or substance use issues. Individual accountabilities and work volume will be established through the development of annual Success Objectives, within the framework outlined below. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Provides basic advocacy, assessment, and case work services to individuals, families and groups. Conducts outreach and intake as assigned. Participates as assigned in the implementation of counseling, education or activity groups. Supervises program participants individually or in groups. Helps program participant to modify attitudes and patterns of behavior by increasing understanding of self, personal problems, and program participant’s part in creating them. Provides financial assistance and support to program participants, in accord with Organizational policies and procedures. Provides assistance to program participants in accord with Organization policies and procedures and in conjunction with total service plans. Performs community contact work on basic aspects of programs or cases and assists in providing services to program participants. Develops and maintains resource files and assigned professional relationships with social service, government and other community organizations to enhance service delivery. Completes accurately and in a timely manner all necessary forms, case records and statistical reports. Submits such documentation to the supervisor/manager within the designated time lines. Participates and contributes actively in regular supervisory and team/unit meeting, in house training sessions, conferences, seminars and independent study. Adheres to professional standards as outlined by governmental bodies, NASW (and/or other appropriate professional associations), private funding sources, Organization plans/policies and program guidelines. Participates in periodic evaluative reviews and/or in-house and external staff training to ensure that he/she understands and continues to adhere to such standards. Initiates requests for assistance from Supervisor to address new issues or complex concepts affecting adherence to professional standards. Other duties may be assigned. Additional Duties and Responsibilities: Transportation of program participants and/or Organizational property may be required. In residential programs, household maintenance responsibilities may be assigned. Other duties may be assigned. Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience: High school diploma or equivalent and minimum of three years experience in case work, human services or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Language Skills: Fluency in a second language may be required. Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. Other Qualifications: A valid driver’s license may be required. Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee may be required to remain on Organization premises during breaks and/or meal periods and may be required to stay on Organization premises until their replacement arrives. May be required to visit clients in their homes or in institutions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Heartland Alliance makes all hiring and employment decisions, and operates all programs, services, and functions without regard to race, receipt of an order of protection, creed, color, age, gender, gender identity, marital or parental status, religion, ancestry, national origin, amnesty, physical or mental disability, protected veterans status, genetic information, sexual orientation, immigrant status, political affiliation or belief, use of FMLA, VESSA, military, and family military rights, ex-offender status (depending on the offense and position to be filled), unfavorable military discharge, membership in an organization whose primary purpose is the protection of civil rights or improvement of living conditions and human relations, height, weight, or HIV infection, in accord with the organization’s AIDS Policy Statement of September 1987.

jobs.title: Residential Instructor
jobs.content: Residential Instructor Summary: This position develops and implements curricula and provides classroom instruction in accord with program guidelines and contractual obligations. While engaging in academic, recreational and physical education activities, the Residential Instructor monitors and supervises program participants and ensures a safe and secure environment both on site and during off-site activities. Individual accountabilities and work volume will be established through the development of annual Success Objectives, within the framework outlined below. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Develops and implements lesson plans and curricula in accord with program guidelines and ensures appropriate documentation and record-keeping. Provides culturally competent classroom instruction to students in grades K-12 in various subject areas, including but not limited to ESL, math, science and health. Engages in physical education activities and instruction, including but not limited to swimming, basketball and soccer. Monitors and supervises program participants individually and in groups. Ensures a safe and secure environment for program participants and staff on-site and during off-site activities. Helps program participant to modify attitudes and patterns of behavior by increasing understanding of self, personal problems, and program participant's part in creating them. Provides transportation of program participants, as assigned. Other duties may be assigned. Additional Duties and Responsibilities: Household maintenance duties such as meals, laundry and hygiene instruction may occasionally be assigned. Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience: Bachelors Degree and two years teaching experience or related teaching experience, such as tutoring, mentoring, coaching, classroom facilitation, etc. Other Qualifications: A valid driver's license required. Must successfully pass a background check. Preferred Qualifications: Experience teaching English as a Second Language (ESL) preferred. Expertise in a particular subject area may be required. Language Skills: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Fluency in a second language may be required. Mathematical Skills: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee may be required to remain on Organization premises during breaks and/or meal periods and may be required to stay on Organization premises until their replacement arrives. Heartland Alliance makes all hiring and employment decisions, and operates all programs, services, and functions without regard to race, receipt of an order of protection, creed, color, age, gender, gender identity, marital or parental status, religion, ancestry, national origin, amnesty, physical or mental disability, protected veterans status, genetic information, sexual orientation, immigrant status, political affiliation or belief, use of FMLA, VESSA, military, and family military rights, ex-offender status (depending on the offense and position to be filled), unfavorable military discharge, membership in an organization whose primary purpose is the protection of civil rights or improvement of living conditions and human relations, height, weight, or HIV infection, in accord with the organization's AIDS Policy Statement of September 1987

jobs.title: Junior/Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world.


As a member of our experienced IT team you will be exposed to a modern technology stack and a very professional and agile project management setup. We have developed a highly refined product in the last years and now massively scale up the company on a global level. Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!



About the job




  • Developing the HelloFresh web presences in 6 countries

  • Development and implementation of new features 

  • Close cooperation with Backend Developers and Designers 

  • Creating a smooth and pleasant end user experience

  • A-B testing to optimize our website

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
We are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable and challenging experience at a rapidly growing startup. Responsibility is given from day one to use your initiative and creativity to help us grow our business. We are fast-paced and love the food world.


About the job


As a Big Data Engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop distributed services that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain distributed, service-oriented and message-oriented data platform components 

  • Design, build, and maintain data ingestion, ETLs and infrastructure for batch and near real time processing.

  • Build and maintain Business Intelligence and reporting solutions.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.content:
• Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team

  • Build and take operational responsibility for the HelloFresh platform

  • Architect, design, develop, deploy and operate microservices that serve millions of users, using DevOps practices and tools

  • Monitor and improve the usage of the services you build

  • Close cooperation with Frontend, Devops and Business Intelligence teams

  • Creating a smooth and pleasant end user experience, for both our customers and our internal users

jobs.title: Cloud Systems Developer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about transforming IT infrastructure to be more efficient, more scalable, and more cost effective?


Cloudreach is an idea that started out in a London pub that is now a global cloud enabler and one of the world’s largest AWS partners. We have hubs in North America and Europe, with more certified technical staff than anyone else in the world. Cloudreach works on challenging technical projects such as data center migrations, data analytics, and managing digital estates. This is not your average company; we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the cloud.


An exciting new opportunity has risen within the Engineering team of Cloudreach. We’re looking to bring on systems developers/engineers to implement innovative technical solutions for major clients who are moving to cloud solutions, built principally within Amazon Web Services (and Microsoft Azure).


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?



  • Adventures in developing cloud-native distributed systems, container orchestration platforms, microservice and serverless architectures, and immutable infrastructure delivery.

  • Orchestration and automation of build and deployment processes, continuous integration and application configuration management.

  • Exciting ventures using automation and configuration management tooling to ensure compliance and ongoing operation of large estates.

  • Enthralling migrations of legacy workloads to transform and shape them into dynamic, resilient and scalable platforms -- helping clients to make the most of the cloud.

  • Working with reputable clients and stakeholders to identify requirements and take these from design through to build and beyond.


What do we look for?



  • Passion and enthusiasm for technology and its adoption.

  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject, or have equivalent experience.

  • Software development experience and/or automation in Python, Ruby, or Go -- but talk to us if you love to hack in any language.

  • Experience with cloud ecosystems, from requirements analysis all the way to operationsYou automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn’t update each one manually, right?

  • Systems administration skills -- you’ll probably prefer a command line to a GUI.


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor and your choice of smartphone

  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture where we work hard and play hard

  • Uncapped holidays.....seriously!

  • Spot bonus based on your and the company’s performance

  • We provide world-class technical training and career development opportunities through our own Cloudy Uni such as Professional AWS Accreditations, Microsoft Accreditations etc .

  • Centrally-located offices

  • Fully stocked in-office kitchen and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday.There are also cool office amenities like a pool table, and Xbox on the big screen TV.

  • Working with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere else

  • Quarterly parties around Europe and an annual kick off event in a cool destination. Last year it was in Spain!


Salary: Competitive


Closing date: 30 September 2016

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
Role Responsibility


We are looking for a number of seasoned Senior Developers to ensure that Soho House's digital offerings are designed and implemented to the highest standards, these are hands on roles so expect to get your hands dirty.  We are embarking on a long term re-architecture project and we need a number of people to fill out the new openings in the team, who will bring extra experience to the conversation with the existing senior developers.


This is a chance to have a real impact on applications that will be used by a worldwide audience and will support the global business going into the future.


The Environment


We currently have a number of services which back our membership, subscription, event booking, content and general member requirements. We have approximately 40 public websites varying in size and traffic and a number of API driven and administration systems which are coming to the end of their working life. We are initiating a large scale rebuild which will service the requirements across all sections of the business for the foreseeable future in some sort of SOA arrangement (TBD...).


We're still a small team so we have all the benefits of being a tight, agile unit while also receiving the benefits of being nested inside a larger business giving us a secure forward thinking environment. We work out of Soho Works, Soho House’s co-working space in the Tea Building, Shoreditch.
 
As a senior developer:
 - At least 8 years experience in software engineering, software design or/and architecture
 - Architectural Patterns (System decomposition, Microservices etc)
 - Good working knowledge of AWS and devops deployment
 - Provide tech leadership and mentoring within the team
 - Have a wide and deep knowledge of software engineering and core web technologies
 - Detailed knowledge of Ruby (and ideally Javascript)
 - TDD approach
 - Agile approach
 - Ideally a working knowledge of modern front end development techniques
 - Code review, process review and improvement
 - Take into account all aspects of requirements - including data quality, customer experience, architecture, security & operations
 - Share & document technical and domain knowledge to improve support and eliminate single points of failure


The new project will encompass the following:
 - Build RESTful web services
 - Integrate with a large number of third party API's
 - Build resilience into the architecture
 - Always consider performance impacts this will be servicing a number of high profile applications both mobile and desktop
 - The services should be scalable to service the business going forward


In return we provide the following benefits:
 - Above market rate salaries
 - Global membership to our clubs
 - Large discounts at our restaurants, spas, stores and other services
 - Clothing allowance (yes....that's correct)
 - Reasonably flexible working hours and locations (although this is very much an on site position)
 - Great working location (The heart of Shoreditch)
 - Conference budget
 - Education budget
 - Technical library budget
 - Personal development time


Company Description


Founded in London in 1995 as a private members’ club for people in the creative industries, Soho House & Co has since opened 17 clubs worldwide including Shoreditch House and Soho House in London, and Soho Houses in New York, Berlin, LA, Istanbul. We also operate a number of other public offerings including the Dirty Burger and Chicken Shop restaurant chains; the Cowshed and Neville brands and also a number of hotels.

jobs.title: Technology Architect
jobs.content:
Technology Consultants in Cognizant’s Global Technology Office (GTO)


We are seeking Technology Consultants across grades to join our Global Technology Office (GTO) ideally with previous consulting background within technology solution development. 


GTO provides technology leadership, transformation and innovation services to Cognizant clients. The business unit includes a number of advanced technology laboratories which enable clients to create first of a kind solutions which use emerging technologies. It also has a technology transformation delivery capability. 


In this role you will represent the Cognizant Global Technology Office (GTO) on client engagements and you will take responsibility for shaping, leading and delivering added-value through technology consultancy and through guiding delivery engagements.


You will have proven capability in providing technical leadership, delivering high quality technology advice, creativity and insight; ensuring project success through timely and accurate production of agreed deliverables; with a strong stakeholder management focus and to the benefit of the reputation of GTO.


You will be able to relate business problems to the technology domain and communicate how technology provides business solutions. You should be confident of your ability to perform in complex client engagements when support can be limited. You will be enthusiastic to join an expanding and ambitious team of similarly high calibre, successful technology consultants, and to contribute to our worldwide growth. 


We offer fantastic opportunities to work with cutting-edge technologies with some of the fastest moving, well recognised brands in the world, across all industries.


Person specification: 



  • A passion for technology and how it can deliver business solutions

  • Ability to interact with clients and stakeholders at all levels

  • Good interpersonal and communication skill - both oral and written

  • A strong teamwork ethic with a proven ability to work collaboratively

  • A track record of developing creative solutions

  • Highly developed critical thinking, interpretative and analytical skills

  • A willingness to learn, grow and stretch in new roles and different industries

  • Positive, determined, confident and resourceful in the face of challenges

  • Flexibility to travel to client sites across the UK and occasionally internationally.

jobs.title: MS Dynamics Business Analyst
jobs.content:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our customers get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


We now have an opportunity for a lead Business Analyst to join the practice.


You will be  responsible for leading analysis and functional specification for  Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


Key Accountabilities:



  • The primary duties of the role is business analysis and functional specification for MS CRM implementation,   undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team

  • Lead relationship with customer SME and business users to capture functional and non-functional requirements  through techniques including workshops

  • Functional design and specification documentation

  • Undertake configuration of  MS CRM 2011  to 2016 solutions

  • Lead testing, data migration and training workstreams

  • Share responsibility with project  workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets   customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost



  • Business development



    • Supporting the MS CRM UK Competency Lead and Offshore Centre of Excellence Lead in defining vertical and   horizontal MS CRM offerings

    • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers

    • consulting with and reviewing offers with vertical teams

    • supporting pre-sales activity to close new business.

    • supporting  proposal efforts

jobs.title: MS Dynamics Solution Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant was one of the first integrators to establish a dedicated support practice for Microsoft Dynamics CRM. We are now a Gold Certified Partner with one of the largest teams in the world. Gartner recently acknowledged us by positioning Cognizant in the "Leaders" quadrant of CRM service providers.


We help our clients get the most out of Dynamics, both as a traditional on premise software or through the cloud. Our services include consulting, roadmap development, testing, maintenance and migration.


As a Solution Architect in the Microsoft Dynamics CRM UK Practice you are responsible for leading architecture and design activities as well as guiding the development of Dynamics CRM projects for UK&I customers in target verticals such as Insurance, Financial Services, Public Sector, Retail and Utilities. 


 Responsibilities:


The primary duties of the role is solution architecture and technical design authority responsible for MS CRM implementation, undertaken by combined Cognizant onsite/ offshore delivery team



  • Architect high quality solution to meet customers functional, non- functional and regulatory requirements

  • Overall technical design authority with responsibility for signing off technical deliverables

  • Share responsibility with project workstream leads for the delivery of  high quality implementation that meets customer and Cognizant expectations of quality, time and cost


Business development:



  • Supporting the MS CRM UK Competency Lead and Offshore Centre of Excellence Lead in defining vertical and horizontal MS CRM offerings

  • working with the offshore centre of excellence to develop these offers

  • consulting with and reviewing offers with vertical teams

  • supporting pre-sales activity to close new business.

  • supporting  proposal efforts

jobs.title: Business Process Consultant
jobs.content:
Centre Operations to join the Business Process Services Consulting practice within Cognizant for one of the major Healthcare Clients in the UK.


Cognizant Business Process Services help enterprises step-change faster without massive organizational upheaval—by simultaneously being more innovative and efficient. We help accelerate the evolution of a business, without the need for revolution by delving deeply into customer experience, business process design and operating model change. The business unit helps organizations move from 'doing' digital to 'being’ digital more effectively.


In this role you will support the objectives of one of our Health Care Clients which aims at centralizing all its back office operations into a shared services CoE. A successful candidate will be expected to provide conceptual solutions after analysing and assessing the as-is state and the associated business problems/needs, with consideration of associated risks, cost and timescales, becoming a subject-matter expert of the Health Care Contact Centre operations business processes and its functional/non-functional requirements.  


You will work closely with the Client teams in advisory and consulting capacity responsible for process diagnostics, management and governance. You will elaborate market-led requirements into clear and complete User Stories, ensuring clear communication of those findings to the Client stakeholders and enabling the kick-off of solution design phase.

jobs.title: Temenos Product Specialist
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s Banking and Financial Services practice encompasses consumer lending, commercial finance, leasing insurance, cards, payments, banking, investment banking, wealth management and transaction processing. It is the company’s largest industry segment, serving leading financial institutions in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. These include 9 of the top 10 European banks and 16 of the top 20 North American financial institutions. The practice leverages its deep domain and consulting expertise to provide solutions across the entire financial services spectrum, and enables our clients to manage business transformation challenges, drive revenue and cost optimisation, create new capabilities, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, capitalize on new business opportunities, and drive efficiency, effectiveness, innovation and virtualisation.


Our global partnership with TEMENOS showcases the expertise and experience of two of the strongest players in banking technology. By integrating Cognizant’s implementation and systems integration services with TEMENOS market leading core banking software, customers of both companies can gain a strong competitive advantage and improved banking processes. Working as a product consultant on Temenos you will be providing solutions.

jobs.title: UI Architect
jobs.content:
Today’s organizations need to think, act and be digital at scale to serve customers in the unprecedented ways they expect. 


Digital has to become nothing more and nothing less than the way our clients do business throughout their business. We’re past the days when a successful center of excellence or initiative impressed customers and partners, when dabbling in digital was enough.


It’s time to go beyond doing pilot projects to being digital.


To take an enterprise-wide approach to digital technology that unlocks the full capabilities of your organization and improves experiences for all your employees and customers dramatically. That doesn’t mean rejecting existing infrastructure wholesale in search of the latest trend, but helping our clients evolve into a more powerful, progressive version of the great company their already are.


Job Summary:


The User Interface Architect is responsible for working with clients in our digital practice to create great, compelling interfaces that optimise digital whilst delivering great user experience. 


The day to day role will  provide exposure to analyse various web frameworks, UI architecture and provide suitable UI solutions. 


Hands on development opportunity in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript & Various JavaScript frameworks.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Web Architect role doing hands on in Web technologies in HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JavaScript, & various JavaScript frameworks. 



  • Will be providing inputs at web application Architecture level. 



  • Will assess different web frameworks, compare them and provide appropriate suggestions for best fit.

  • Will research in latest web UI technologies in market and focus oriented to provide best solutions in the area.



  •  Will provide web framework solutions and guide team members on the same.

jobs.title: Environment Automation Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s Infrastructure Services Practice provides end-to-end solutions covering architecture, design, implementation, management and on-going support across the entire enterprise technology infrastructure.


Our services include a spectrum of management, consulting and systems integration services to help our clients maximize value in their infrastructure resources, while optimizing infrastructure performance and cost.


The Environment Automation Architect will undertake and own software automation development & deployment for key accounts within the UK/I Infrastructure Services Practice


 Key Responsibilities:



  • Extensive development and deployment with Python, Chef, Puppet, Java, C++, HTMP5, Linux, TCP, Storage, Compute

  • Manage the large scale software development & deployment 

  • Handle end to end  project management, team management & client  management delivery

  • Participate in development, transition and technical documentation

  • Handle various teams and facilitate cross-functional requirements

  • Take responsibility for communication and documentation

  • Mentor the managers & team members from Cognizant to ensure that they are delivering a professional, high quality, high value & responsive service experience to the client

jobs.title: PEGA Lead Systems Architect
jobs.content:
Cognizant’s PEGA Lead System Architects are responsible for mentoring development teams and delivering world-class platforms for our customers on PEGA.   In this role they bring certification and deep expertise using PRPC maximizing the use of OOTB functionality to deliver solutions that have minimal coding and ensuring high performance delivery.


Responsibilities:



  • Participate in architecture and design discussions and review

  • Monitor the daily activities of the team referring to the project plan

  • Resolve technical issues at offshore and resolve issues and ad hoc requests

  • Report weekly project status to Project Manager and provide input for management status review meetings

  • Participate in the Architecture sessions to provide inputs on system Architecture from Pega perspective

  • Ensure compliance with Pega implementation guard rails

  • Own and deliver High Level Design document

  • Define Reuse Scope and Path

  • Establish Development & Deployment Best Practices

  • Mentor Pega Technical Resources

  • Offshore co-ordination and provide inputs to the Offshore team to prepare Low Level Design and build the application

  • Gather and  analyze interface details and provide it to offshore for interface design

  • Conduct code review and provide feedback to build team

  • Participate in QA and UAT Defect Triage

  • Provide QA and UAT Support

  • Participate in Design and code Review with the customer Architects

  • Provide Implementation support in different environments

  • Provide resolution on technical issues

  • Co-ordinate between Onsite and offshore teams

jobs.title: Test Data Manager
jobs.content:
With the growth of smart phones, tablets and new operating systems requiring constant updates daily, testing and QA are more critical than ever before.


Our Quality Engineering & Assurance group partners with you to bolster development initiatives, providing reliable support across a range of hardware and software, testing infrastructure, and testing products that ensure test coverage and drive product quality.

Summary of Department Focus:


Cognizant BFS testing practice is a 4500-member unit that has skills varying from core application testing, Test programme Management to test consulting. Cognizant is the preferred testing partner for top 3 of the UK Banks. The selected candidate will be part of fast growing and dynamic BFS testing team in UK.

Summary of Job Purpose:


Cognizant's Banking and Financial Services testing practice are looking to recruit a Test Data Manager based in Skelmersdale, Manchester.

The Test Data Manager is accountable for planning delivery of test data to meet test data requirements; leading the team tasked with sourcing the data


Defining the strategy for the management of test data across multiple environments; formalising and documenting the process for loading; updating, and maintaining data across systems; leading on resolution of defects relating to test data.

Defining test data management strategy for large, complex programmes

Defining Enterprise Test Data Strategy/Policy covering Data Archival, Data Refresh, Data source database identification, Data Sub-setting, Data Generation, Data Masking etc.


Providing process expertise and support through quick resolution of issues related to test data

Liaising with test and deployment leads to ensure delivery of data is factored into plans

Defining requirements acceptance criteria and Handover checklists for Test Data Delivery

Defining roles and responsibilities for creation of requirements and delivery of data to meet them
Lead a team of test data analysts from across different technology


Mentor and guide test data team and bring ideas to implement industry leading practices on test data management

Defining E2E process & workflow from data requests to provisioning for the client


Role focus on leading a central test data management team for the client within their test environment practice


Strong relationship with Application Development & Maintenance, Testing, Environment, Infrastructure and Service Management teams


Responsible for managing the data from Source to Target test regions through the complete Test Data lifecycle

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack
jobs.content:
Are you a Polyglot Technologist? As software engineers and architects, we solve problems. We don’t just write code. The problems we solve are to improve the product that we offer our users.


“In this internet based economy every Software Engineer is a polyglot by necessity. We’re required to switch technologies efficiently, relying on our fundamental engineering skill-set to progress. That’s not to say we should all be generalists, specialists are also needed, but the core and fundamental skills of a specialist can be applied in many technologies.”  Skyscanner Senior Architect & Tribe Lead


Skyscanner is the world’s travel search engine with ambitions to be everybody’s personal travel assistant. As a full stack engineer, we want to employ your problem solving capabilities. Solving complex scalability challenges, proposing new design and systems solutions and all the while, instigating and promoting best engineering practices. To be really useful to us, you should have across the board experience – a bit of database, a bit of back end as well as some UX familiarity into the bargain – after all, if you don’t know what can go wrong, you won’t know how to fix it. We’re looking for exceptional engineers who can make difficult decisions and take ownership of a problem from end to end.


If you hate doing what you’ve always done but love finding new and better solutions, make our technical challenges part of your new engineering problems – apply today!


You can offer us:


A hunger to lead in a continuous learning culture, a desire to solve complex technical challenges, a passion for technology and tech leadership and ultimately a commitment to applying engineering best practices in order to produce top quality solutions.


We can offer you:



  • An excellent career move

  • The chance to work with great developers, in fact, great people across the board

  • The space to be trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter

  • The potential to tackle big stuff, not small stuff

  • You do best and to make decisions that matter

jobs.title: Senior Distributed Systems Engineers - Freedom & Scale
jobs.content:
Data is the oxygen that drives success at Skyscanner. Distributed Systems Engineering is core to our growth strategy.

Every decision in Skyscanner is driven by complete, timely and accurate data delivering real-time value to our business, our partners and millions of users worldwide.


The challenges our Engineers face are vast in scale, complex and huge in impact.  There is a real variety of exciting opportunities across areas including Personalization Services, Partner Services, Real time accuracy, Automation and Delivery at Scale to name a few

We continually gather billions of travel-related data events every day and that is why we use leading edge large-scale distributed data systems. To complement this, we use a wide range of analytical and data processing tools to operate an end-to-end data platform.


We are looking for engineers with proven success working in data processing at scale in a Distributed Systems Environment with Terabytes, and even Petabytes, of continuous data.


We can offer you:



  • Huge potential to impact across our business, people, partners and millions of users

  • Ownership – the freedom and space to be trusted to do what you do best and to make decisions that matter

  • A real opportunity to explore & experiment – developing new & improving current features & systems

  • An excellent career move – complexity, challenge and real variety

jobs.title: Senior Distributed Systems Engineers - Freedom, Impact & Scale
jobs.content:
Data is the oxygen that drives success at Skyscanner. Distributed Systems Engineering is core to our growth strategy.

Every decision in Skyscanner is driven by complete, timely and accurate data delivering real-time value to our business, our partners and millions of users worldwide.

jobs.title: Lead UI Artist
jobs.content:
Our goals for this role



  • Your goal is to help DIGIT continue the growth of our hit title Kings of the Realm

  • You will bring our title to the next level, helping DIGIT to truly push the boundaries of UI design in the game

  • As Lead UI Artist, you will be hands on, as well as leading a small experienced team of games UI designers.


Here's what you will be doing



  • Provide art direction and own the UI for the game

  • Rapidly deliver intuitive and rewarding user interfaces to millions of players for all new game features

  • Design fully responsive user interfaces, that work seamlessly across multiple mobile devices

  • Concept, create and validate UI designs for the game (from user flows through to release)

  • Assist in rapid iterations and testing ideas (using wireframes and sketches, in-engine mockups etc.)

  • Create clean and easy to implement UI assets, which can seamlessly move straight over to the development team and into games production

  • Own the UI pipeline - create and define style guides and monitor consistency and quality across your team

  • Lead and technically manage a small skilled team of UI designers - review work daily, act as technical mentor and guide, set goals etc.

  • Guide the UI vision and art direction across the team (explorations, colour, composition, iconography etc.)

  • Innovate and try new things - always push the quality bar on every single topic.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.content:
Simplesurance, a now expanding startup in the middle of Berlin, is waiting for your application! As a Technical Product Manager (f/m) with a very good understanding of code, you obviously have a passion for continuously growing and improving products and launch new features and services. You are not afraid of taking responsibility for expanding product portfolios, keeping a tight schedule and have the necessary drive to manage all stakeholders involved. You already gained first experiences and now want to develop yourself further. Then this is the perfect place for you.


If you have a strong desire to set new benchmarks instead of maintaining the status quo, read on…


About the job:



  • You analyze and scope product and process requirements requested by internal and external stakeholders

  • You identify potential improvements of our products and services to develop them further

  • You will structuralize and prioritize the creation of new features for our products

  • You help define, develop and deliver product roadmaps

  • You’ll be involved in the full product lifecycle

jobs.title: Conversion Optimization Specialist
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about improving conversion rates and able to work your magic across our web properties? You love to analyze website traffic for trends, use patterns to identify and quantify customer behavior, and make intelligent modifications to improve user experience and maximize conversion rates?


Your chance to become part of the professional and rapidly growing startup scene of Berlin is now just one “Klick” away!
Simplesurance, a now expanding startup in the center of Berlin, is waiting for your application!


If you are a visionary – you see the possibility of both small and big changes - and have the data and statistical background to provide proof that your ideas work, keep reading….

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Simplesurance, a now expanding startup in the middle of Berlin, is waiting for your application! 


We offer the position Technical Project Manager (f/m) which combines project management skills with technical experiences. So you can bring in and develop your full potential.


You have a passion for both, programming and project management? Then this is probably the right job for you.


Read on and check the job description:

jobs.title: Problem solving Ruby & Javascript developers wanted - Southampton & London
jobs.content:
Working at Alliants


At Alliants we love to solve business problems; sometimes with technology and sometimes without. We are always looking for creative and enthusiastic people who share that spirit to join our team. All of our work comes from recommendation and the fact we take great pride in the work that we do means that we continue to get recommended.


Our aim is to work in self-sufficient and collaborative cross-functional teams. We develop iteratively, responding to feedback and change, while taking a pragmatic approach to delivery. Communication is a key part of how we function.


We are committed to providing an atmosphere where everyone’s opinions and ideas are respected, work-life balance is valued and all our colleagues have opportunities to learn and grow. We hire people rather than functions and take great care to ensure that the people we hire share our values.


Who Are You?


You care about providing value to the client and want to engage with them to understand their needs. You think about the bigger picture rather than just your current task and are prepared to turn your hand to whatever needs to be done to help the team.


You are keen to share your well considered opinions while also welcoming ideas of others and healthy debate. You are good at what you do, more than that you are so passionate about it that that passion is contagious.


Roles


As a Software Developer you understand and have experience of robust development frameworks including source control, unit testing and daily builds. You see the value in TDD and pair programming but also understand when they are valuable and when other methods are more beneficial. Our current preferred technology stack is Ruby on Rails with Angular or React for web and native iOS and Android apps for mobile. You should be able to demonstrate excellence in one of these. Open source projects which can demonstrate your skills will be highly regarded.


Why Join Us?


Great things we provide to all employees:



  • Investment time to explore new ideas, and work with the wider community

  • An annual training budget to enable you to learn and develop

  • Sponsorship to represent us at conferences and local hack days

  • A budget to spend on hardware of your choice (we’re typically a MacBook crowd)

  • Awesome Fridays with breakfast, lunch and drinks fridge

  • Popular benefits including pension, healthcare, bonuses, child care vouchers and cycle to work.


If you value collaboration, technical excellence and continuous improvement then get in touch and tell us about yourself.


Alliants is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

jobs.title: Development Team Lead, 80-100%
jobs.content:
You will be the top tech person in our company, responsible for the development team and its output. As the interface between your team and the rest of the company, you’ll be translating business needs into architectural decisions and manageable features. Because our CEO was previously the CTO, you will get lots of understanding and appreciation for the work of your team. Besides your managing duties, we also expect you to get your hands dirty in code on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:



  • Manage our team of software developers, which currently consists of five people

  • Take decisions on our architecture from backend to frontend, which currently consists of a Python REST API hosted on AWS and AngularJS as well as native iOS and Android apps on the client side

  • Lead by example by writing well-tested, concise code across our stack

  • Choose the right tools and institute good development practices

  • Be the interface between the development team and the rest of the company

  • Manage the hiring process for your team


In addition to senior candidates with management experience, we are also considering ambitious juniors who want to take the next step in their career.

jobs.title: Lead Developer for a new venture of smava
jobs.content:
In the last 12 months we have built a new product (www.scorekompass.de) in-house which we want to take to the next level as an independent new venture. You will be a part of an experienced team of highly motivated and talented people and report directly to a management team of seasoned entrepreneurs. With your deep experience in software development, architecture and entrepreneurial drive you will not only help us to extend our conversion relevant applications but also lead the way towards smart applications and a micro service driven architecture.


What we would like you to do:




  • You will define the technical roadmap of www.scorekompass.de




  • You will take care of the whole application including Web and Mobile (iOS, Android)




  • You will translate business requirements into future ready architecture and applications




  • You will define clear technical requirements for your team and ensure an in-time delivery of your projects




  • You will handle technical communication in between the venture, internal smava teams,  Management as well as with external contractors




  • You will do code reviews and ensure a good code quality and structure




  • You will review existing technologies and chose the most suitable ones for new features




  • You will support the recruiting process




  • You are willing to get your hands dirty

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Developer
jobs.content:
Our IT-Team takes care of the concept and realization of our web application. We continuously develop our online loan marketplace and implement new product features. We decided to ramp up a team fully focuses on innovations. The team will be led by an experienced Product Manager with deep technical understanding and intention to implement state-of-the-art features in the FinTech world.


Currently we are looking for a really experienced Fullstack professional, who (1) wants to take engineering responsibility and who (2) choses and uses the best technologies for our business.


Team insights


https://www.smava.de/jobs/project/it/


https://www.smava.de/Bilder/development_infographic.png


Tech Stack you need to handle



  • Java Spring (DI, Security, Scheduling, Tx)

  • PostgreSQL

  • JUnit

  • Maven

  • ActiveMQ

  • Apache CXF

  • HTML5

  • CSS (Sass, Less)

  • backbone.js

  • Jira

  • Confluence


What we would like you to do



  • Take engineering responsibility (Backend/Frontend) for new financial product innovations with perspective for a Teamlead position

  • Pick up requirements from your Product Manager and Architects and turn them into execution plan

  • Integrate 3rd party systems into new product innovations

  • Implement representation layer and visualization of data

  • Code review of future team members

  • Deliver high quality code to Release Management team

  • Participate in internal and external Stakeholder Meetings and Tech Talks

  • Nothing more nothing less


How we would like you to do it



  • Implement REST endpoints to query, manipulate and persist data

  • Implement Spring based services that handle business logic

  • Adjust database to store required information

  • Control access rights using Spring Security

  • Make sure that frequently accessed information is cached in ehcache

  • Work in Confluence with our architects on concept implementation

  • Split epics and user stories in JIRA into specific tickets with precise estimation

  • Generate SOAP service stubs and Data Types from WSDL using Apache CXF

  • Implement secure communication with 3rd parties

  • Make sure that our system is not overloaded and is distributed using ActiveMQ

  • Ensure data consistency by controlling transactions scope

  • Submit your code to your feature branch in our Git repository

  • Manage Jenkins jobs to deliver your code to the QA team

  • Manage dependencies of multi-module Maven project to build in fail-safe and timely fashion

  • Implement Backbone.js based Views and Models, define user flow using routers

  • Render representation of interface using Handlebars.js

  • Control loading and utilization of modules using require.js

  • Customized display using Sass


Mission to accomplish



  • Full digitalization of loan application process

jobs.title: Firmware Engineer
jobs.content:

Responsibilities include:



  • Hands-on cutting robust, maintainable and scalable code with tests.

  • Embedded software design and development in C and C++.

  • Unit testing using Googletest and Googlemock.

  • Automated integration and robustness testing with trip simulation.

  • Code inspection and peer review using GitFlow.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world through the power of software and we are looking for a technical wizard to help Synchrony's development team. Synchrony is the engine behind Confluence's co-editing feature. 


As a Senior Developer, you’ll be crafting and implementing with the team a data synchronisation service for tree data structures using operational transformation on a large scale. All the hard problem of OT with nested tree data, n-squared complexity issue, support of key-value maps and many other challenges are solved in Synchrony. 


We are supported by robust deployment systems, mature algorithmic solutions, and an experienced team with a strong desire to build the best synchronisation technology out there. Think Nasa launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting children born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. You'll need a strong technical prowess with incredible coding ability across a diverse set of languages and technologies. 


What you do 

  • Solve challenging problem with simple, elegant solutions

  • Deep dive into operational transformation algorithms

  • Possess authority in performance, scalability and service system architecture

  • Work on a leading technology to enable more real-time collaboration across different types of applications


 Basic Qualifications 



  • 5+ years of functional programming experience (Clojure, Haskell, Scala, ...)

jobs.title: Senior Corporate Counsel
jobs.content:
Job Description

Atlassian is seeking an attorney who is pragmatic, business-minded and a great teammate to join our extraordinary legal team in San Francisco. The Senior Corporate Counsel will be an integral member of the legal team, reporting to the Deputy General Counsel – Corporate, and will have responsibility for the company’s corporate and securities matters, M&A activities, employment law matters and corporate governance support. Join us and be surrounded by a great team in a fun, vibrant, rapidly growing and collegial technology company.

What you will do

  • Ensure compliance with SEC, NASDAQ and UK rules and requirements, including supporting the company’s SEC reporting function, UK and other international securities filings

  • Support M&A and other corporate development transactions

  • Support and partner on legal aspects of employment–related matters

  • Provide corporate governance advice and support, including preparation of Board and Committee meeting materials and minutes

  • Oversee the administration of all global corporate subsidiaries

  • Support stock plan administration activities

  • Partner with investor relations, public relations and internal communications, including reviewing earnings scripts, press releases, investor presentations, websites, employee communications and other materials

  • Provide legal advice and guidance to various cross-functional teams, including corporate development, treasury, HR, accounting and tax

  • Handle preparation of the materials related to the Company’s annual meeting of stockholders

  • Manage the company’s insider trading policy and trading window

  • Support corporate compliance programs

While that is the bulk of the role, we’re sure other responsibilities will arise – we’re growing fast, and new and exciting stuff comes up every day!

More about you

To succeed in this role, you’ll need to bring with you:

  • A J.D. degree and a state bar member in good standing

  • 4-6+ years of experience in general corporate work, including at least 2 years of experience at a top law firm - in-house experience is a plus

  • Experience with public-company reporting requirements, including preparation of securities filings

  • Experience with M&A transactions, including preparation of term sheets, drafting and negotiating transaction documentation, and coordinating the due diligence process

  • Employment law experience a plus

  • Flexibility and willingness to work on a broad variety of legal matters

  • Strong drafting, negotiation and communication skills

  • Excellent business judgment and critical thinking and ability to assess and tolerate legal risk

  • Pragmatic focus on getting the things that matter right and letting go of things that don’t

  • Hardworking, well organized, able to handle a varied and demanding workload, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously

  • Ability to collaborate and function well in a team environment and comfortable interacting with colleagues across departments and job levels

  • Detail-oriented and willing to get your hands dirty

  • Ability to work effectively with and manage outside counsel

  • High integrity, diplomacy, and tact in interactions

  • Last but not least, a great sense of humor and the ability to not to take yourself too seriously

More about the team

Members of the legal team at Atlassian advise upon legal matters arising within a dynamic and competitive business context, providing excellent opportunities to learn the many aspects of the business and a great opportunity to work on a breadth of interesting, intellectually stimulating and challenging matters, at a fun, dynamic and fast-paced company. The legal team practices a collaborative, creative, team-focused approach with an incessant focus on the long-term scaling of both the legal department and the broader business.


Atlassian. Powered by You.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Atlassian, Inc., will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art.49.

jobs.content:
Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer (DevOps) with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  


This role will be based in Cake's global HQ in Houldsworth Mill, Manchester.


The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer - Leading digital agency
jobs.content:
Have a passion for digital media? For bringing creative concepts to live online? Want to design in the browser, working closely with the best UX and Art Directors? Then you are the one we are looking for!


Creuna is the largest strategic digital agency in the Nordics. Our clients are big brands, that choose us, because they want creative digital solutions with a real impact on their business and a partner with the technical strength to build things right. From strategy and concept to development and continuous optimization.


Our Frontend Developers are talented. They code for usability, conversion and search engines optimization - and challenge their colleagues and our clients to break free of old habits and benefit from breakthroughs in web technologies.


Think like us?
We believe the best solutions surface when we bring together multidisciplinary teams of ambitious experts, focused on creating value for our clients and their customers. We embrace Design Thinking, like to bring in data and learn fast - and we are not afraid to change our minds based on new insights.


We are fast-learning tool agnostics, always looking to improve our processes and efficiency. Therefore, you will also be an influence on our “weapons of choice”.


Your profile
You are a talented, passionate front-end developer with the skills and the drive to build and maintain websites for some of the biggest Nordic brands.


You will work with top talents including strategists, analysts, UX and graphic designers and other developers in a fun, fast-paced environment.  Each day, you will create, code and optimize websites and customer experiences in an agency where you can see the impact of your ideas. This gives you the opportunity to innovate and make meaningful decisions while you continue to develop your skills.


We would love to see examples of your work, so please be sure to include a portfolio link, code samples, or whatever represents your competencies best.

  • You will build libraries and tools for our microservices ecosystem.

  • You will create value through automation throughout the entire application lifecycle.



Your profile - your readiness to go fast:

  • You have already designed distributed systems or you have worked on microservices architectures?

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
About Helpling


We at Helpling love helping people to find the cleaner they want. On our website or app, you can outsource the time-consuming housework within a couple of clicks. For cleaners, our technology platform makes it easier than ever to access new clients and to manage when and where they want to work. For our vision to digitize the world of home services, we have raised more than 56 million Euros from renowned internet pioneers such as Lakestar (Airbnb, Facebook, Spotify) and Mangrove Capital (Skype). Today, we are already a team of 300 and two thirds of us are based at our headquarters in the vibrant heart of Berlin. If you want to make a difference and help changing a whole industry, then Helpling is the right place for you.


Currently, we are looking for a Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer (m/f) to enhance the technical architecture behind the scenes.


How we work


Our application is build on top of Ruby on Rails framework using PostgreSQL database. We use Redis and Memcache as well, and Sidekiq as a queue system. We have integration with Stripe, Adyen, Nexmo and Twilio.


We have a strong agile culture, where some of the teams uses Scrum or Kanban.


We believe that testing should be part of the implementation and not something to (rarely) do later. We do TDD with Rspec for Unit and Integration test and we use Capybara for feature tests.


We develop on a fully reproducible environment using Vagrant and provisioned by SaltStack that we can completely create from the scratch in less than 10 minutes.


We deploy several times a day to Heroku and AWS through a continuous Integration pipeline with Snap-ci and Jenkins.

jobs.title: Prototype Model Maker
jobs.content:
Are you a highly skilled Model Maker looking for a dynamic company to join? Designcraft is searching for passionate professional Model Makers who thrive on the challenges and rewards that come with building amazingly realistic appearance models and prototypes to help further product development.

Many of our employees are Industrial Design versed Model Makers who want to do hands on custom artistic work by creating creating ultra-high quality solid visual models using traditional model making practices including fabricating, sanding, polishing, painting, texturing, silk-screening, color mixing and assembly.

The individuals will be required to be highly proficient in physically creating working prototypes and concept models to meet our Industrial Design, Marketing and Engineering customer requirements.

A self-starter attitude that can work independently as well as in a team environment and be able to effectively and professionally communicate with designers, clients and Team Members is required. Every individual must also be able to conform to the time requirements of a fast-paced schedule for producing products.

Designcraft is a dynamic, fast-paced work environment with highly creative individuals that thrive on conquering unique prototyping challenges. With over 35 years of prototyping experience, we focus on and are committed to select groups of clients who value precise models, knowledgeable customer service, and fast market response for their product development needs.

Industries ranging from consumer electronics, automotive, home goods, military, aerospace, telecommunications, medical and others repeatedly use our services and expertise to expand their positions in the marketplace.

We offer competitive wages, overtime after 40 hours, medical, dental, vision, LTD, STD, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation and a retirement plan with a match.

Due to the nature of the work being done all applicants must be U.S. Citizens.
Solid verbal and written English language communication skills are required.
Designcraft is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Senior Back End Developer - Big Data
jobs.content:
At INFARE, we are not happy if we simply achieve our goals, we want to blow them out of the water! We want to get ahead of the scaling curve, so we can deliver even better solutions, with minimal technical debt and continue to be the leading competitive airfare intelligence provider. To achieve these goals, we will be hiring a number of experienced Backend Developers, who will join our development team based in Copenhagen or Vilnius.


As our company is going through an exponential growth, we decided to transform our beckend to use all the newest and coolest tech that is out there. You will be working on scalable applications in BigData (Hadoop/Spark/NoSql/Sql) as well as Java/Scala services and C#.Net/SqlServer applications.

jobs.title: Analytics Master - Use your skills to feed starving children!
jobs.content:
We're looking for a person with the skills, experience and drive to become the 'master' of all our data and analytics. You'll be working directly for our decision makers, proactively bringing them the data that they need to make data-driven decisions.


You'll become very knowledgeable about all of our internal data schemas (in both MongoDB and MySQL), as well as the way that our partners and customers interact with us through URLs and APIs. You'll work with people throughout our company, learning their needs, and creating awesome Tableau dashboards to support their work.


You'll be proactive with our data, watching the dashboards you create and following up with teams when you identify new opportunities for data-driven decisions. You'll be in charge of curating our data sets and making new data sets available in Tableau. This will include some light programming duties in Java and/or Linux shell, as well as work with MongoDB and MySQL, to make new data sets available.


And through this work you'll be helping us feed starving children and saving lives!

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
An excellent opportunity for an experienced Support Engineer to join our innovative team. The successful Support Engineer will lead on delivering high-quality professional service to our customers, represent Marmalade through our support channels to assisting customers to resolve technical issues whilst fostering positive customer relationships.


You will be expected to solve complex technical tasks and proactively work to prevent new issues from developing. The role is a mixture of troubleshooting complex technical issues and delivering first class customer service in a fast paced environment.


  Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities



  • Take ownership of cases from the incoming queue of support issues. 

  • Show technical understanding of the Marmalade Platform from a customer point of view with regards to architecture and user experience.

  • Identify root causes of technical issues and actively participate in the development of the solution.

  • Identifying weak or unintuitive parts of the documentation and actively contribute to the improvement of quality.

  • Follow troubleshooting scenarios provided by the Marmalade documentation to identify issues present in the product.

  • Coach customers on how to efficiently use Marmalade and work with the community manager to help shape blogs, tutorials and forum activities.

  • Actively track problem areas of the product and report them back to the Technical Marketing Manager.

  • Increasing test coverage and provide documentation updates.


Qualifications/Experience and Skills Required



  • 2+ years of engineering experience, preferably in the mobile games industry.

  • Understanding and experience of modern software development principles such as test driven development, continuous integration and continuous delivery.

  • Experience dealing with end-users in a support role.

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills and confident when customer facing.

  • Excellent problem solving skills and ability to consider the user experience in the bigger picture.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience of contributing to technical documentation in a clear and user focused manner including tutorials.

  • Outstanding team player with an ambition to really make an impact by working closely with professionals of a variety of disciplines and skillsets.

  • C++ 11 skills and familiar with the SOLID principles for object oriented design principles.


 Preferred skills



  • General game development experience.

  • Good understanding of mobile devices and their specific mobile OS features.


 Useful skills



  • Understanding of content creation tools and pipelines.

  • A sociable and motivated team player.

  • Experienced in technical presentations or webinars.


 Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Benefits include an employer-contributory pension scheme and share options

  • Opportunity to grow within a talented team working on the cutting edge of gaming technology in the heart of London

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
The Marmalade Platform solves complex problems for our customers in innovative ways thanks to our highly skilled software engineering teams. The Engineering Manager is responsible for these teams and their delivery to make the Marmalade Platform commercially successful.



 Responsibilities




  • Own the software development life cycle (SDLC), including the required tools and systems




  • Be responsible for the planning, development, testing, release and support of the Marmalade Platform




  • Communicate across functions to drive technical initiatives, both internal and external, from inception to delivery




  • Be responsible for the end-to-end availability and performance of mission critical internal and external systems and services




  • Be an effective people manager that can lead, mentor, develop, challenge, hire and retain engineers




  • Foster a culture of continuous improvement and innovation of the product and the associated systems and processes




  • Ensure the teams adhere to established engineering processes and best practice





About you 


Essential:




  • Experience of each stage of the SDLC, ideally from a mobile-focused environment




  • Ability to design and adopt methodologies, tools and processes, and to implement and roll these out out across the organisation




  • Successfully work with remote teams on a daily basis




  • Capable of technical deep-dives into architecture, code and test reviews, but also contribute effectively in strategic decisions with the executive team




  • Good communicator that is able to understand different viewpoints, can negotiate, resolve, plan and prioritise highly complex technical tasks




  • Understanding of mobile application development tools, mobile systems and their ecosystems





Desirable:




  • Development experience with at least one mobile device platform (e.g. iOS/Android/Windows, ...)




  • Experience Working with Agile/SCRUM, DevOps, continuous integration and continuous delivery models




  • Experience with system automation, particularly in software testing




  • Comfortable working on Linux-based systems




  • Game Development experience





Personal




  • Shares knowledge and learning with team members, seek to improve processes.





 Benefits




  • Competitive salary




  • Benefits include an employer-contributory pension scheme and share options




  • Opportunity to grow within a talented team working on the cutting edge of gaming technology in the heart of London

jobs.title: Senior Devops Engineer
jobs.content:
Our booking engine infrastructure consists of multiple Linux servers. The stack runs on Debian, Nginx, PHP and Percona MySQL. We do provisioning with Puppet and deploy with Jenkins. We have a MySQL ring replication, are using Memcache, load balancing, NFS and Elasticsearch. Currently we are working on scaling and high availability, to serve our booking engine to the fast growing market. We also have internal web based tools, which are used by thousands of people. The administrator team works and sits directly together with the development team, there is no strict separation.


The company is growing very fast, so there will be opportunities to grow. You will start out with a big share of hands-on work and some product management. As the company and the team grows, the share of managerial tasks will also grow.


So, for our Berlin office we are looking for a senior devops engineer (f/m)


What we offer:



  • Experience a fast growing startup with incredible offline value (You have probably already seen our green buses on the streets, right?)

  • Join a diverse, experienced team to exchange your ideas and contribution

  • Office at Alex

  • Competitive salary

  • Soft working hours

  • Conference visits

  • Room to grow

  • Help with your relocation to Berlin


You can expect:



  • to be a fully-qualified member of a passionate team with a flat hierarchy

  • flexibility in working hours - we have fun working together, but home office is always a possibility

  • professional training and continuing education


Here is a video from our head of software architecture about why it is interesting to work for us: 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

jobs.title: SOFTWARE ARCHITECT M/F
jobs.content:
Who we are


FlixBus is a European long distance mobility provider with headquarters in Munich, Berlin, Milan, Paris and Zagreb. Since 2013, FlixBuses have offered a new, convenient and green way to travel which suits every budget. Thanks to a smart business model and an innovative technology, the former startup has established Europe's largest intercity bus network in less than four years.

To support our team we are currently looking for Software Architect (m/f) based in Munich and Berlin.


Your tasks


Facilitate Architecture: Instead of enforcing architectural solutions, you facilitate creation and evolution of the architecture collaboratively.
Requirements engineering: You work closely with the Product Owner and the business stakeholders to validate business ideas and their feasibility.
Communication: You communicate decisions whenever necessary but understand that documentation is a living process.
Coaching: Teach teams new architectural patterns and practices to help them grow as engineers.
Evaluation: You evaluate and introduce new technologies and tools that can accelerate feature delivery.
Culture: You foster and establish a culture of Software Craftmanship. You value maintainable, readable and testable code and constantly promote these values within the team.
Hands-On: You work hands-on with the team (pairing, mob programming, prototyping) to validate your own design ideas early.


Our offer


The possibility to work flexibly, goal oriented, and independently in an experienced and professional team.
Come work on a product with incredible non-digital value: We offer the chance for you to change how millions of people commute, spend their weekends, and discover the world.
The chance to develop and implement your own ideas.
