jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist Lead - new role, create and build a team
jobs.content:
About the role 


This is a brand new role to join Abcam as a Senior Data Scientist Lead to help us build and expand our Big Data capability.  The role encompasses orchestrating how the company uses both internal and external large/semi-structured/unstructured data to predict future R&D opportunities as well as real-time algorithms to deliver personalised marketing and web experiences.


You will have the ability to make this role your own and influence the decision making and direction of Abcam’s future strategy with your guidance. You will be working on key projects for our organisation and creating your vision of how we can best support our customers while becoming the best-loved brand in life sciences.


About Consumer Insights & Analytics at Abcam


The Consumer Insights & Analytics team, based in Cambridge (UK), is a rapidly developing department.  We have already made a real impact on the business and interact regularly with the decision makers within the organisation influencing our future direction.  Our aim is to empower other teams with insights to advance consumer understanding and drive the company mission.  We do this by gathering and analysing relevant information on the wider market context, on life scientists generally and on Abcam customers, and communicating insights to the appropriate audience.  


Roles & responsibilities:



  • Show and mentor the organisation how to leverage ‘big data’ to answer complex questions

  • Innovate and implement machine learning, text analytics, and large-scale data mining techniques and technologies that discover actionable patterns or informs hypotheses and insights

  • Work in an Agile way to orchestrate cross-functional projects for designing and testing new algorithms and models

  • In some cases (particularly in the early days), be hands-on in building the prototype

  • Perform rigorous statistical evaluation of the predictive accuracy

  • Collaborate with marketers, other data analysts, engineers and software developers to build scalable solutions as needed


About Us


Ever since 1998, when our founder, Jonathan Milner, started selling antibodies from the back of his bike, Abcam has aimed to help scientific researchers make breakthroughs faster.  We now have offices and labs in the UK, the US, China and Japan, and as we continue to grow, we remain ambitious, driven by our customers’ success and their research needs.


It’s our goal to provide a world-standard in protein research tools, technical support and delivery. When you join Abcam, you’ll join a global business with the passion and the vision to become the most influential company, and, best-loved brand in life sciences.


Our culture is our key differentiator. We believe in empowering individuals, with responsibility given at an early stage. The working environment is fun and fast-paced, collaborative and outcome focused, with a strong customer focus. In addition to competitive salaries, we can offer an attractive flexible benefits package which includes share options, a culture focussed on wellbeing and opportunities for growth and development.

jobs.title: Ruby Developer Contractor

Ruby Developer Contractor


Are you an experienced Ruby developer interested in putting your skills to the test? Fuga is looking for a contractor with strong backend development experience to join our full-stack Ruby team as soon as possible.


Tasks and responsibilities:



  • Maintaining and extending our royalty accounting SaaS platform written in Ruby 2, Rails 4, Reddis, RabbitMQ

  • The main task will be productizing, stabilizing and introducing scalability to the multi-tenant background job platform.

  • Help expand our continuous integration and continuous deployment systems using Chef, Capistrano, Jenkins and Docker.

  • Currently located in the Netherlands and preferably directly available

 About Fuga:


FUGA is a music company that operates at the heart of the music industry with an impressive clientele: Spinnin' Records, Armada Music, Epitaph, Domino Recording Company and more. FUGA connects these record labels, artists and distributers with digital service providers like Spotify, iTunes, Beatport and more. By doing so FUGA enables it's clients to optimize their business processes and successfully execute their strategy. FUGA's products & services provide a complete ecosystem for the digital product cycle. Clients manage, distribute and promote their music and collect on their revenue.


Interested in this position? Please send your resume and a short cover letter to jobs@fuga.com

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Java, React - Data Analytics
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced, enthusiastic and personable Software Engineer to work on our market leading Data Analytics product.


(Sorry, no agency applications please).


This is an opportunity to work on a great variety of projects including frontend or backend, (dependent on your background). Typical responsibilities might include:



  • Developing new microservices for our flagship analytics product

  • Automating deployments to our AWS cloud servers

  • Supporting our complex ETL and data processing pipeline

  • Creating stunning new data visualisations with the React, D3 and other charting libraries


We use a mixture of technologies including Java 8, Python 3 and React-JS. We don’t expect you to know all of these, of course, but be confident enough to learn on the job.


We have a strong engineering culture and a “20% off-plan” policy (where everyone works one day a week on pet projects, ideas and other non core tasks). This has produced some of the most popular user features in our software and allowed us to adopt new technologies.


We use agile methodology, have regular learning lunches, flexible working hours, decent coffee, iMacs for all and we’re a friendly team.


This is an amazing chance to work with cutting edge technologies like Docker, AWS, React, and ElasticSearch, collaborate with experienced engineers, and work on an interesting variety of projects.

jobs.title: Product Manager - AI Enabled Product
jobs.content:
Baidu Research, headquartered in Silicon Valley, is looking for an experienced product manager with strong background in consumer or enterprise facing software products and services such as web and mobile apps. Our team's mission is to develop hard AI technologies that enable us to impact hundreds of millions of users. As a product manager at Baidu, you will lead the exploration and definition of new products that leverage the most advanced AI technologies to transform user experience. You will be working with a small team of highly talented designers, developers, researchers, and product managers. You will have the opportunity to develop creative new products that will directly impact hundreds of millions of users.

Our research teams are creating the next generation of deep learning systems and algorithms. Our focus is pursuing the most promising product ideas that maximize the value of the advanced AI technologies the team is developing. As a product manager, you will be responsible for bridging the technology and business needs to develop creative product ideas, formulate product vision, quickly transform ideas into product prototypes, and build and ship new products and services.

Here's what you will do:

  • Take sizable ownership of new products. Creatively explore new product possibilities enabled by advanced AI technologies.

  • Carry out user studies and market research to understand user pain points and the current market landscape. Define new products that will meet market needs.

  • Provide technical, functional, and business expertise with responsibility for product strategy and roadmap.

  • Perform product owner tasks in an agile scrum development process: collaborate with research and back-end teams, guide initiatives through the development life cycle, and bring high quality software product and services to market.

  • Carry out efficient idea exploration and build functional prototypes quickly.

  • Execute sustainable product development phase that needs development and maintenance of usable, robust, and delightful products.

Here's what we'd like to see in you:

Very strong product skills:

  • Strong experience in consumer or enterprise facing products: strong product sense on which features to build for the users and which designs make for a better product.

  • Strong technical and project management skills: solid understanding of the full software application development life cycle; understanding of the implementation complexity of the product; ability to manage project schedules.

  • Strong strategic skills: ability to decide which business areas a product needs to grow in and why; ability to conducting quantitative market research, conduct user studies and other experiments to develop and validate strategic hypotheses.

  • Track record of defining and delivering successful web and/or mobile applications.

  • Strong communication skills; experienced in cross-organization collaboration.

Culture fit:

  • Mission alignment: If you want to use AI to dramatically improve people's lives, we will give you the best platform to accomplish this mission.

  • Self-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

  • Hungry to learn: We are eager to learn new things at work, but learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

  • Team orientation: We work in small, fast-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other, and go after big goals together--as a team.

We are based in Silicon Valley, in Sunnyvale, California.

jobs.title: School Psychologist - Middle School
jobs.content:
Our Middle School Psychologists work collaboratively with school leadership, students, parents, teachers, and school support staff to help our students achieve the highest degree of academic, emotional, and behavioral success. Your job is to hold all students to high expectations, support the needs of a diverse student population, and determine appropriate strategies and interventions that will allow students to academically excel. Engaged in our mission to re-imagine public education, you will develop as a professional faster and more intensely than ever before. This will be a compelling intellectual and educational adventure that will transform you as a person and while doing so you will impact hundreds of students’ lives.

At Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 41 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 14,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.

In all grades, pre-K through 12, our exploration-driven curriculum focuses on the whole child and includes chess, art, and other specialized subjects that bring excitement to the school day and foster a lifelong love of learning. To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, brightest, and most highly motivated adults we can find. We value excellence, celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.

As a Middle School Psychologist, you will:

- Serve as a leader in the school, building strong relationships with students and their families to support students’ academic success
- Conduct psychoeducational evaluations, including cognitive and academic achievement testing
- Provide high-quality counseling sessions for scholars with IEPs and at-risk scholars
- Create, implement, and track behavior intervention plans for students with behavioral needs
- Lead crisis management for scholars in need of this support
- Engage in school-based support team and provide consultation to teachers to ensure student progress through the right supports and interventions

To be considered as a Middle School Psychologist, you must:

- Have a valid NY State psychologist certification
- Have experience with a variety of psycho-educational and behavioral assessment tools
- Have a background in counseling and crisis management
- Be a person of high moral character
- Be passionate about learning

To join our team, please upload a cover letter and resume that outlines your candidacy. Your cover letter should explain in detail your qualifications for the position. Resumes without cover letters will not be reviewed.
 
Success Academy Charter Schools is an equal opportunity employer and actively encourages applications from people of all backgrounds. Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Success Academy offers a full benefits program and opportunities for professional growth.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.





You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

jobs.title: Producer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at manjuri.sinha@zalando.de

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
• Advance knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 as well as a good understanding responsive web development
  • Advance knowledge of Javascript including experience with at least two of the following: React, Bootstrap, AngularJS or Ember

Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

  • Experience with continuous integration/deployment using git and Jenkins or similar
  • Ability to make decisions about which technologies to choose for a certain problem, as well as explaining her/his choice

YOU BENEFIT FROM



Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.

jobs.title: Data Warehouse Engineer
jobs.content:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
The opportunity


The testing team assists development teams to identify, execute, maintain and enhance testing tasks. We are internal consultants who help product teams to be more productive by giving them testing tools, processes and frameworks. You will get to know different aspects of the Zalando platform by working with all kinds of different teams.


What we are looking for



  • You have an above average degree in IT or related technical field

  • You have very good analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to details

  • Excellent coding skills in Java. Knowledge of another language (Scala, Python, Javascript) is a plus.

  • You are a confident user Linux/Unix based systems

  • The usual tools of the complete software lifecycle are known to you (e.g. Jira, Jenkins, JUnit, WebDriver)

  • You have experience with the latest test tools such as Jenkins, JIRA, Sonar, Testlink, Cucumber, Selenium (Webdriver)

  • You have experience with Continuous Delivery and End-to-End Testing

  • You have worked with database management systems (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL) before

  • You will ideally have experience of SOAP web services and REST-API and related technology

  • Modern software architecture (Microservices, loose-coupling, asynchronicity) does not scare you

  • Experience with Docker is a plus

  • Your are able to work independently and self organized in an agile environment

  • Communicating and documenting in English is an easy task for you


Your responsibilities



  • Enable our software development teams to build world-class software by building advanced testing frameworks and tool

  • Be a go-to person on software quality, instruct and consult other software engineers

  • Close working relationship with autonomous development teams to consult them on optimizing testing, e.g. by reviewing the test methodologies or test tools

  • Develop tests and testing-infrastructure as part of a team of engineers

  • You will be responsible for evaluating and developing new technologies and tools based on feedback from other teams

  • Co-Work with Test Infrastructure to optimize test environments


What you can expect from us



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to professional networking

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with micro services, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Krista Vanhala at krista.johanna.maria.vanhala@zalando.de

jobs.title: Experienced Ruby Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Los Angeles & New York, United States
URL: http://citrusbyte.com

Citrusbyte is a software development company which believes in using simple tools to solve all types of problems. We work closely with designers, engineers and our clients to create and improve products of great quality. We have considerable experience building custom systems for both startups and enterprises - check out our portfolio for more information about our clients.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.

Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.

We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.

We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

Skills & Requirements:
  • Smart, gets things done.
  • Passionate about software development.
  • Excellent communication / consulting experience.
  • Open minded and always learning
  • Experience working in a distributed company
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Architect and build web applications.
  • Work with product designers and clients to clarify requirements.
  • Plan and prioritize work in a collaborative remote team.

To apply: You can apply directly via our careers page: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Software-Developer

jobs.title: Customer Service Representative
jobs.content:
Redfin is a well-funded technology startup that's revolutionizing the $60 billion real estate industry in consumers' favor. At Redfin, you'll be able to unleash your brilliance to improve the end-to-end real estate experience and make one of the most important decisions of a person's life faster, easier, and more efficient. You'll be diving headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps and be a part of solving unique and challenging business problems in a customer-friendly way. If you've got fire in your belly to do work that matters, we want to hear from you.

As a Redfin Customer Service Representative, you will be in constant contact with our customers via phone, and our email ticketing system. We are looking for someone with a serious passion for helping people; someone willing to put the customer first in any situation. We need team members who will see issues through to the very end, ensuring a world-class customer service experience.

Please apply if you love technology and customer service because you'll be on a team that is in direct contact with the developers who are planning, building, and maintaining the online tools that drive Redfin.

Real estate license not required, however industry exposure is desired.


The schedule for this position is Thursday-Monday, 8am-5pm PST.

WHO YOU ARE

  • 1-2 years of experience in Customer Service and/or Tech Support.
  • Ability to work independently, as well in a group, and can handle multiple tasks, and changing priorities.
  • Commitment to the customer, no matter the issue. Don't just help them -delight them.
  • Fun, caring, and humble. It's important we have a good time, look out for each other, and pitch in when needed.
  • 4 year degree preferred.


TECHNOLOGIES WE USE AND TEACH

  • Zendesk ticketing system
  • Cisco phone system


WE OFFER

  • Small teams with great exposure to all levels of the company
  • Great locations (downtown Seattle and downtown San Francisco)
  • Competitive compensation and 3-weeks paid vacation annually
  • Generous benefits
  • Support and resources to continue learning
  • Amazingly smart and fun teammates, and a management team invested in your growth and success
  • Seattle's #1 best place to work in 2014 by Seattle Business Magazine
  • Redfin is an equal opportunity employer.


IND123

jobs.title: Back end Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Maxwell, we are inspired by the opportunity to make a difference in society by helping people make better health, wellness and financial decisions. We build web and mobile applications that support a rich set of interactions among consumers, employers, brokers and product vendors. Our domain requires us to consider usability, design, business workflow, self-service and process scalability. We view ourselves as the stewards of change for a very complex industry.


About Our Team



  • We passionately solve problems.

  • We think critically and systemically.

  • We commit to quality as the leading design principle.

  • We are agile practitioners.

  • We are building a culture of automation.

  • We scale ourselves through small, self-empowered and self-organizing teams.

  • We focus on learning, at an organizational and personal level.

  • We value a diverse team with a variety of educational backgrounds.


Buzzwords we use a lot: event sourcing, domain driven design, functional programming, devOps, TDD, agile, docker, automation.


About You


You are joining us to teach us something new and to learn a few tricks from us too. You care deeply about engineering high quality and resilient features. You are excited to work with a team that strives to delight customers no matter what it takes. You are an idealist at heart, and our mission resonates with you.


What you will do



  • Work on a new project to improve Maxwell Health's integration with enterprise partners

  • Use functional programming to design our new public REST API and integrate with our partners' APIs

  • Take full ownership of the platform, from definition, to development and testing, to deployment and monitoring

  • Practice TDD and BDD on a day-to-day basis within agile teams.

  • Invest in constant personal development and learning


Benefits



  • All benefits covered 100%

  • Flexible working hours

  • Healthy snacks

  • Open vacation, personal, and sick day policy

  • Gym reimbursement

  • Generous 401(k)

  • Transit benefits

  • Located right next to the subway

jobs.title: Senior Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
iRobot, one of the world’s leaders in the design and development of AI technologies and consumer robots, is seeking an amazing Senior Industrial Designer to join our Industrial Design/User Experience (ID/UX) team in Greater Boston.

Who we are…
With iRobot’s sharpened focus on home robots and connectivity, the ID/UX team is central to delivering on the Brand promise of “Empowering people to do more” – with designs that embrace simplicity, approachability and seamless usability as a means of humanizing robotic technology.

The relatively new ID/UX team at iRobot is a group of skilled designers and researchers who bring vast experience and the hunger to build a world class internal design competency.

Who you are…
HARD SKILLS
• You aren’t afraid to delve into technical challenges – actually you relish technical matters as part of the challenge in creating great, meaningful design
• You have enviable sketching skills to quickly capture ideas and you are expert in helping teams explore what technical decisions mean for the physical design and usability of a product
• You are well-versed in manufacturing methods and use this knowledge as a creative asset rather than limitation
• You can sweat over details (& design specs) because you know getting that last detail through to production is part of the journey
• You’re adept at CAD and visualization tools, and expertly use this to gain alignment with engineering and product stakeholders

SOFT SKILLS
• You have a keen grasp of how Industrial Design form and details can reinforce a brand position and create a lasting impression on users
• Your sense of product form and detail development inspires
• Your design approach is inspired by the user, and you can work closely with User Research to inform and validate design work
• You are able to bring engineering and marketing along on your quest for the coolest design - by integrating with the team and knowing when to push and when to compromise
• You can discuss with credibility why your design advances the ‘big picture’
• You excel in asking smart questions and look for boundaries so you can also offer perspectives beyond what is being asked

In Short:
We are looking for a designer who helps set the standard for our group - your credibility makes you a sought out voice whenever there is a critical product decision that impacts what the customer sees and experiences. If the above descriptions ‘tick your boxes’ – we’d like to hear from you!

Please provide link to portfolio with your resume.

jobs.title: Safety and Quality Expert for Linux Automotive Software
jobs.content:
OME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Safety and Quality Expert for Linux Automotive Software (m/f)
Job reference: 106403


We are offering you an interesting position in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. Autonomous driving is a key component in order to meet challenges of future mobility. We are looking for people to join us on this journey by designing and developing software solutions for autonomous driving and driver assistance systems. As a Safety and Quality expert (m/f) for Linux embedded software you will work together with distributed software development teams in order to define and implement a safety concept of a future autonomous driving platform. Your tasks will include the analysis and assessment of possible safety threats. Together with internal and external partners you will contribute to solutions/concepts in this area. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by bringing in your fresh ideas.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Algorithm Developer for Autonomous Driving (m/f)
Job reference: 105395


We are offering you an interesting position at the BMW Group to work as a Senior Algorithm Developer (m/f) in the field of Autonomous Driving. Your tasks will include the development of algorithms and software solutions for the environmental and driver model. In close cooperation with the specialist departments, you will develop the architecture of highly networked, innovative software. Here, you will be involved in the entire development chain, from requirements analysis, algorithm design, implementation and validation of the software, through to integration of the software on the control devices. In your position, you will write and optimize complex algorithms, such as for the recognition, classification and fusing (high and low level) of objects and open spaces fit for driving and of situation interpretation, and you will provide support in implementing the algorithms into efficient embedded software. Your thrilling range of activities will be rounded off by the testing and validation of the developed algorithms, as well as testing and functionality throughout the overall vehicle.

EVEN IN ELECTRONICS, YOU CAN GO AGAINST THE CURRENT.

More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Java Lead Engineer (m/w)

We are offering you an interesting position in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. We are looking for an experienced Java/Java EE engineer (m/f) to help us to establish a company-wide continuous integration (CI) service based on Jenkins. You will be part of an international team of highly talented software engineers at our site in Ulm, Germany. Together you will drive innovation and improvements in BMW"s software engineering practices. You will discuss and guide architectural issues within the development team. Additionally, you work closely with customers to find the best possible CI process. You are also responsible for analyzing and improving performance and scalability of the CI system.

jobs.title: Senior Architect for Functional Safety
jobs.content:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.


If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We're ready too, so our team in Munich is currently seeking a:


Senior Architect for Functional Safety (m/f)
Job reference: 105398


The BMW Group is taking the lead in highly automated and fully automated driving.


We are offering an exciting opportunity as a Senior Architect (m/f) for Functional Safety (FuSi) in the area of autonomous driving. Your activities will range from the design of interdepartmental safety concepts to FuSi-compliant partitioning of the electric/electronic (E/E) architecture and validation concepts across process chains.In close collaboration with specialist departments, you will develop future-oriented E/E architecture concepts for fulfilling Automotive Safety Integrity Level (ASIL) requirements for functions that constitute the cutting edge of autonomous driving at the BMW Group. Your tasks will include the analysis of the optimum ASIL utilisation of available hardware platforms and strategically orientating future integration platforms for quick integration of automated driving functions. A further responsibility will be to assess technical safety concepts of suppliers together with the internal FuSi specialist departments. Your range of tasks will be rounded off by the coordination and implementation of FuSi-relevant aspects in terms of deadlines and maturity levels, the monitoring of project progress and reporting on project status.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at http://www.bmwgroup.jobs.

jobs.title: Technical Lead
jobs.content:
Technical Lead - Derby – Circa 50K

The Technical lead must have a proven track record of project and product delivery together with outstanding technical and programming knowledge.


Benefits in return, we will offer the successful Technical Lead:

jobs.title: DevOps
jobs.content:
Syllabs recrute un(e) ingénieur(e) DevOps afin de prendre en main son architecture et faciliter les déploiements. 


Votre rôle


Au sein de Syllabs, vous serez principalement en charge de la maintenance et l'amélioration de l'infrastructure actuelle, comprenant l'intégration continue, le déploiement de services REST et l'orchestration. Le contexte vous amènera à être force de proposition sur des projets spécifiques comme sur l'architecture générale de Syllabs, en cherchant à améliorer la chaîne de développement et en accompagnant l'équipe de développement. Ponctuellement, vous serez vous-même amené à participer aux développements projets.


 L’environnement technique


Vous serez en contact direct avec une équipe technique en plein essor composée d'ingénieurs R&D. La stack technique de Syllabs inclut : Jenkins, Nagios, Munin, Salt, Flask, BitBucket, Python, Conda, PyPy, Nginx, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Slack. Côté méthodologie de travail, nous utilisons Scrum avec des stand-ups quotidiens.

jobs.title: NRC Program Manager
jobs.content:
Ionetix Corporation (Ionetix) is a growing company with offices in San Francisco, Indianapolis and Lansing, Michigan. The company has developed a compact system based on proprietary cyclotron technology that produces a diagnostic drug for cardiac imaging. Ionetix is commercializing the system for sale to hospitals and clinics.

Ionetix is seeking a full-time NRC Program Manager. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a top-notch team dedicated to saving lives across the nation. The chosen candidate will be responsible for overseeing the Ionetix radiation-related regulatory program.

Responsibilities will include developing and implementing a corporate-wide radiation safety program, obtaining required state and federal licenses for each production site, developing and managing the associated regulatory compliance program, and performing radiation-related calculations to support site development and licensing activities.

Ideals candidates will possess:
• Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Physics
• Familiar with MCNP or similar Monte Carol Transport Code
• Familiar with radiation safety concepts
• Familiar with radiation detection instrumentation (gamma/neutron)
• Experience with one or more programming languages (e.g. C, C++)
• Demonstrated success in managing and coaching employees

Compensation
This position receives a competitive wage (commensurate with experience) and an attractive benefit package including health, dental, vision and time off benefits.

Application Instructions
If you're interested in joining a new, growing organization, please click the Apply Now button below. No phone calls, please. We welcome applications from veterans of the U.S. Armed Forces. Ionetix is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Infrastructure developer/DevOps Engineer for Artificial Intelligence
jobs.content:
As an infrastructure developer (aka “DevOps engineer”) your tasks are to administrate and operate our AWS infrastructure, which runs our complete development environment (including CI/CD processes) as well as the production environment for our AI services. We use AWS to achieve the greatest possible degree of flexibility and stability. On top of AWS we complete our infrastructure with proven (and sometimes very promising) open source components. We even contribute to their development. In your role, as a member of a holistic and agile DevOps team, you will



  • monitor, automate and further develop the existing infrastructure, and

  • test, select and implement the latest and best tools for operations.

jobs.title: Visual/UX Designer for learning games
jobs.content:
PlayMada Games is looking for a versatile, super talented, high functioning Visual/UX Designer to be an integral part of the development of our web and mobile learning games for high school students. The ideal candidate will have a keen visual eye, an intuitive approach to user experience, a rock solid design process, and the technical skills to carry it all through. This key role reports to the Executive Creative Director. This is a full-time position based out of our New York City office.

Responsibilities:
• Learn scientific concepts and embrace learning goals as a first step towards solving complex visual and interaction design challenges found at the intersection of games and learning
• Merge content knowledge with superior design skills to help conceptualize and then design new interactive learning environments, starting with wireframes and ending in fully functioning, visually engaging spaces
• Identify areas for improvement in our current product iterations and come up with elegant design solutions to turn good user experiences into a great one's
• Create functional, intuitive layouts and navigation that work across web and mobile devices
• Design and prepare art assets for delivery to the development team
• Work with the development team on art implementation needs or issues that may arise
• Occasionally assist with the design and execution of company collateral, printed materials, conference booth displays and any other outward facing materials
• Help with design updates and support the development of our company and product web interfaces

Required skills and experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design or equivalent relevant degree/training
• 5+ years professional experience as a graphic, visual, and/or interaction/UX designer - educational media/apps preferred but not required
• Proven experience working on multiple projects from concept to launch
• Ability to juggle multiple tasks at once and prioritize tasks appropriately to seamlessly meet deadlines
• Excellent communication skills and a preference towards working in a highly collaborative environment
• Expert level Flash, Illustrator, and Photoshop CC skills
• UI/UX design experience for web and mobile (touch)
• Strong attention to detail and highly organized by nature
• Ability to closely adhere to style guides and help create new ones
• Strong interest in Chemistry and/or other fields of science
• Strong interest with a willingness and ability to learn high school level chemistry
• Passion for education
• A love of playing games

Nice to have:
• Experience creating assets for Unity 2D for use in cross-platform applications
• Web design/development experience

Please send cover letter, resume, portfolio site, and any relevant links to: jobs@playmadagames.com with the subject heading “Visual/UX Designer”

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

jobs.title: Ervaren PHP Developer - Samen de wereld veroveren!
jobs.content:
Studenten en editors genereren 50.000 pageviews per dag op de back-end. Jij zorgt er samen met het development-team voor dat de processen in de back-end efficiënter worden en er twee-wekelijks nieuwe features worden released.


De vacature


SCRiBBR is een online scriptienakijkplatform waar 350 freelance taalkundigen bij zijn aangesloten.


We helpen jaarlijks duizenden studenten en onze server verwerkt duizenden pageviews per dag.


De beste ideeën komen voort uit problemen waar de studenten en editors tegenaan lopen. Werken voor SCRiBBR betekent dat we problemen samen oplossen, en dat we jou dus ook bij alle processen betrekken. Van de ontwerp- en ideefase tot aan de realisatie van een oplossing. Geen week is hetzelfde!


Waar zijn we naar op zoek


De ideale kandidaat is een PHP back-end developer die minimaal 4 jaar ervaring heeft. Ervaring met Symfony is een pre.


Wat doe je nu écht?



  • Dagelijks navigeer je door de Symfony codebase om de werking van het framework tot in de puntjes te begrijpen. Een junior-developer uit het developmentteam leg je uit waarom de keuze voor een specifiek design pattern binnen onze applicatie zo belangrijk is.

  • Van een use-case maak jij een technisch ontwerp, na afstemming met het team bepalen we wie de feature zal gaan implementeren.

  • Omdat jij je weg door de applicatie geblinddoekt weet te vinden, kun je zeer optimaal nieuwe features ontwikkelen. Je ontwikkelt nieuwe services binnen onze back-end applicatie en zorgt dat de functionaliteiten door middel van test-cases gedekt zijn.

  • Voor de applicatie liggen altijd nieuwe ideeën op de plank. Je stelt voor om een feature van de backlog te verschuiven naar de actieve milestone omdat een andere developer met dezelfde component een andere feature aan het ontwikkelen is.

  • Je voert in de huidige codebase deprecations door waardoor onze semantic versioning en daarmee major release van later dit jaar op schema blijft.

  • Ook de Symfony component waarmee je een feature geïmplementeerd hebt, zou gebruik kunnen maken van jouw verbetering, dus je stelt op Github een PR op voor de LTS-versie en vraagt het Symfony coreteam voor een review.


Met wie werk ik samen?


SCRiBBR bestaat uit een jong, internationaal en enthousiast team. Samen zorgen wij ervoor dat studenten met volle tevredenheid van onze diensten gebruik maken.


Het developmentteam bestaat momenteel uit 3 personen.


Hoe ziet een werkdag eruit?



  • 09:00 – Voordat je je dev-machine boot, verstuur je in de lift vanaf je mobiel een packet zodat het koffiezetapparaat aan je Chai Tea Latte begint. Eenmaal opgestart lees je in Slack de git history door van de commits die je collega’s gisterenavond nog gepushed hebben.

  • 11:00 – Onze Spaanse growth-hacker staat aan je bureau omdat haar experiment tot een kritische bug heeft geleid. Met de co-founder stem je af dat er een hotfix-release gedaan zal moeten worden.

  • 12:30 – Bug solved, live-update uitgerold. Tijd voor de dagelijks variërende lunch met alle andere start-ups binnen TQ.

  • 13:15 – Tijd om een use-case voor het optimaliseren van onze financiële processen uit de opkomende milestone uit te werken. De prioriteiten zijn verschoven dus deze feature kan gelijk ontwikkeld worden.

  • 16:00 – De implementatie is af, met co-founder Bas stem je de functionele werking af en hij heeft nog wat feedback. De feature kan echter de translation-release-cycle in zodat deze in 11 talen kan worden uitgerold.

  • Rond 18:00 – Stap je op de fiets en rijd je langs de grachten naar huis… of sluit je aan voor het avondeten op kantoor!


Wat wij de afgelopen 3 maanden hebben bereikt…?



  • Scribbr heeft de Best Entrepreneurial Student Initiative gewonnen en is genomineerd voor de Deloitte Rising Star 2016.

  • We zijn online gegaan in Zweden, Noorwegen, Denemarken en Finland. Nog meer studenten weten ons te vinden.

  • We zijn samenwerkingen aangegaan met Franse, Italiaanse en Spaanse editors en bieden nu ook de Franse, Italiaanse en Spaanse nakijkdienst aan.

  • We hebben een nieuw record van 20.000 unieke bezoekers per dag.

  • We zijn verhuisd van Tilburg naar Amsterdam om sneller te kunnen groeien. Wij zitten nu direct aan de Singel bij TQ.

  • Het team is weer flink gegroeid en het kantoor is alweer te klein. Vanaf 17 oktober hebben we 18 werkplekken :-)

jobs.title: Professor of Graphic Design
jobs.content:
The core of graphic design at SCAD is design thinking. This fundamentally creative process — thinking by doing — encourages students to see differently, shift focus, look from multiple perspectives and realize how perception influences meaning. Help guide talented students through this learning process as a professor in graphic design with an interactive focus.

SCAD has a large, vibrant graphic design department aligned with leading trends in emerging media. The position offers numerous opportunities to collaborate with other SCAD departments that are at the forefront of diverse fields. The graphic design professor will develop and extend current interactive choices within the undergraduate and graduate curriculums, meeting critical standards and expectations for the discipline and the industry.

Candidates will be asked to articulate their vision of a graphic design education in the 21st century that will produce designers with research abilities, social responsibilities and pragmatic skill sets who are able to deliver content over any type of system.

Requirements:
• Terminal degree or its equivalent in graphic design or a related field
• Demonstrated knowledge of interactive theory, interaction design, technologies, platforms and delivery systems as they relate to current practices in graphic and communication design
• Comfort teaching in cross-disciplinary teams focused on experiential projects
• Professional experience as a working graphic designer at a variety of levels
• College-level teaching experience preferred

jobs.title: Chair of Industrial Design
jobs.content:
SCAD seeks a multidisciplinary designer who understands the human user, business context and effective application of technology to chair the industrial design department.

This award-winning program cultivates highly motivated, visionary students who consider business challenges while creating and communicating innovative solutions that improve people’s lives. As the full-time chair of the department at SCAD Savannah, you will advance these objectives and prepare the next generation of creative leaders.

SCAD professors have the opportunity to teach in cross-disciplinary classroom environments. The chair of the department is also responsible for shaping the program and defining strategies for success.

The successful candidate is an enthusiastic educator who possesses passion for design and a strong desire to share knowledge through experience and persistence. This is your chance to work with a team of talented students within the historic district of Savannah, Georgia, a walkable, bikeable coastal city providing a living laboratory for the study of art and design.

Requirements:
• Terminal degree or its equivalent in industrial design or a related field
• Minimum five years of industrial design experience including design, concept-to-market, manufacturing and design strategy
• A demonstrated record of holding design leadership positions and project management
• Record of innovative and clever product development
• Desire to mentor exceptional students
• Keen eye to the development of impactful product aesthetics
• Mastery of design process to generate memorable solutions
• Proven creation of products that became marketplace disruptors
• Possess great communication skills and be able to motivate students and faculty to think creatively and critically
• Ability to efficiently manage administrative duties
• Ability to apply high-level theoretical and practical models to the field of industrial design in order to prepare students for rapidly evolving design careers
• Knowledge of Rhino or SolidWorks software preferred
• College level administration and teaching experience preferred

jobs.title: Professor of Animation
jobs.content:
SCAD has been named among the world’s top animation schools and among the “Ivy League of Animation” by 3D World magazine. Join the team that makes this happen as a full-time professor in the animation department at SCAD Savannah.

The successful candidate will develop and extend students’ awareness of story, design, audience and collaboration in production. Therefore, a keen understanding of commercial or independent filmmaking would be a major asset to the position. Apply your industry experience and expert technical proficiency in the classroom teaching a unique curriculum that explores animation styles ranging from stop-motion to 3-D animation and includes digital modeling, rigging, lighting and look development.

This is your chance to work with talented students within the historic district of Savannah, Georgia, a walkable, bikeable coastal city that provides a living laboratory for the study of art and design.

Requirements:
• Terminal degree or its equivalent in animation or a related field
• Strong portfolio of work that reflects a high degree of knowledge in animation
• Strong understanding of gesture drawing for animation
• Strong understanding of the animation production pipeline
• Ability to demonstrate, by providing an online demo reel, expertise in character animation (multiple mediums preferred: 2-D, 3-D, stop-motion, hybrid)
• College-level teaching experience, proven leadership skills and ability to work with students of diverse backgrounds preferred
• Experience with 3-D animation preferred

jobs.title: Chair of Visual Effects
jobs.content:
The SCAD visual effects program offers undergraduate and graduate degrees and provides a unique combination of professional instruction built upon a traditional fine arts foundation, with opportunities to work individually and collaboratively within a framework of cooperative activity that reflects the real-world experience of film and digital entertainment production.

Join SCAD Savannah as the full-time chair of visual effects and provide students the fluency to express their ideas and develop their personal vision. This is your chance to work with talented students within the historic district of Savannah, Georgia, a walkable, bikeable coastal city providing a living laboratory for the study of art and design.

We are looking for someone with significant professional experience in visual effects producing, as well as experience as supervisor, facility manager or lead member of a visual effects production team in at least one of the principal areas of visual effects production, such as digital effects animation, technical direction, lighting, compositing, effects programming or creation of virtual 2-D and 3-D environments. Candidates must be familiar with current trends and technological developments in visual effects image gathering.

Responsibilities:
• Day-to-day administration of the academic department
• Direct, coordinate and evaluate the visual effects department
• Develop curriculum
• Foster inter-departmental collaboration and continue to enhance the reputation of the SCAD visual effects department in academic and professional circles
• Oversee departmental budget, including its development and implementation
• Work with the admission department to recruit talented undergraduate and graduate students to SCAD and to the department
• Teach classes annually, as assigned
• Evaluate professors within the department through class observations, a review of student evaluations, a review of service and professional development and a review of contributions to the department’s goals
• Work with the dean to provide professional development opportunities for professors
• Develop, in consultation with the dean and department members, a strategic plan for the department that is consistent with School of Digital Media goals and the overall SCAD strategic plan

Requirements:
• Terminal degree or its equivalent in visual effects or a related field
• Strong communication skills
• Proven leadership skills
• Ability to motivate students and faculty to think creatively and critically
• Ability to work with students and faculty of diverse backgrounds
• Well versed in the history/critical theory of the discipline

Preferred:
• University-level administration
• At least four years’ teaching experience
• On-set and location experience in a supervisory capacity
• Familiarity with the planning and execution of photographic elements for visual effects, including script breakdown and detailed shot planning, essential camera operation, scene data collection, CG integration, miniature and forced-perspective photography, blue- and green-screen photography, use of motion control technology, set protocol and the planning and construction of special effects rigs for visual effects
• Candidates must be familiar with current trends and technological developments in visual effects image gathering, creation and execution
• Familiar with AR/VR applications of visual effects and other emergent technologies
• Passionate about leading curriculum development and professors to propel visual effects students toward their careers of the future.

jobs.title: Web Applications Developer
jobs.content:
Building apps in the world’s leading cloud technology, that is our idea of fun! Every company in the world is in the app business.


We don’t want to worry about managing hardware, software upgrades, backups or security. The Salesforce App Cloud is a platform that allows our developers to focus on innovation and let their creativity run free.


Our team consists of both young potentials and senior development experts that share the same passion. They build trusted cloud applications that are rock solid, secure, and scalable. We combine our programming skills to deliver the best results for our customers. Collaboration and teamwork is key in what we do. Together we’re not just delivering software, but we inspire our clients and tackle all kinds of business challenges.


Our developers use the newest web technologies such as Javascript frameworks (AngularJS), web services (REST), Apex, Visualforce, Heroku and Lightning.


Experience with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and Java/.NET allows any developer to become a Salesforce Development expert! Through customized training and guidance by senior developers, we provide you with the tools necessary to become a successful developer.




  • As Web Applications Developer you will develop applications using cloud technology, after an initial training period introducing you into the cloud development world.

  • You will work closely with our consultants to develop customized large-scale cloud solutions for our clients.

  • You will develop these applications to a high standard of usability and quality for the end-users, based on requirements you receive from your project team members.

  • Functional analysis, writing technical documentation, test scenarios and the execution of tests are additional parts of your responsibilities.

  • Teamwork is a core value of the way we work.Close communication with other project team members about project status, technical challenges, etc. is key to our success.

jobs.title: Linux Systems Administrator / DevOps
jobs.content:
Do you love making Linux systems run like clockwork? Do you dream about scripting manual administration tasks out of existence? Would you enjoy the challenge of making it a five minute process to spin up a new pre-configured box? Would you like to do all this whilst working for an internet-focused organisation that exists to improve the lives of others around the world? If so, you should think about joining us at mySociety.

About Us

We’re a UK registered charity and social enterprise. We aim to invent and popularise digital tools that empower citizens in their interactions with institutions and decision makers.

In the UK, we’ve built well used and useful, democratic open source tools that make a difference, like FixMyStreet.com, WhatDoTheyKnow.com and TheyWorkForYou.com. Our focus is now much more international, and our main goal over the next few years is to help other organisations around the world to set up, run and grow citizen empowerment websites and apps based on our tools, whilst measuring the impact of this work through our research programme. We also take on commercial projects, both to generate income and to provide further positive social impacts.

Why you should work with us

There are plenty of reasons!

We are a friendly, user-focused software development team, and we get to work on stuff that matters. Our projects help people to get important things done - better government, citizen empowerment, fighting corruption. As well as our UK sites we’ve got strong working relationships with groups in Kenya, Chile, Uruguay, Taiwan, Malaysia, Australia and many other places.

mySociety is a flexible, understanding employer. Most mySociety staff work remotely whilst still seeing each other face to face as often as we can. We work from home, co-working spaces, or small offices. Proposals for part time and flexible working are always welcome, and we have generous allowances for leave (both paid and unpaid) and conference or training days.

Our project management style aims to minimise pain and distraction, and leave people to get on with doing great work, normally in small teams. We welcome people who are committed to making a difference, but we take work life balance very seriously and we celebrate the idea of quality, not quantity of working hours: out-of-hours work is occasionally required for this position, but always compensated with time off in lieu.

What this role involves

Responsibilities will include:

  • Initiating and managing infrastructure-wide projects such as OS upgrades
  • Taking charge of the security and integrity of our servers and data
  • Maintaining and testing our backups infrastructure
  • Improving the documentation of our server, development and deployment infrastructure
  • Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks in application stacks based on Apache, Varnish, various dynamic programming languages and PostgreSQL/MySQL, including incoming and outgoing email
  • Helping developers build high performance applications
  • Keeping monitoring systems working and in good order
  • Updating our deployment process to make setting up new production servers and new development environments as close to a one-click configuration as possible
  • Speccing and procuring new hardware and/or virtual machines
  • Contributing to the development of our internal systems and processes

We think this position would suit you best if you have some or all of the following:

  • At least five years' experience of Linux server administration
  • At least two years' experience of scripting in Python, Perl, bash or similar
  • Experience of working with Puppet and Nagios
  • Good knowledge of networking fundamentals
  • Working knowledge of server hardware
  • Clear written English
  • Previous responsibility for maintaining the security and integrity of key Linux systems
  • Managing high-profile, multi-machine and public-facing systems

These would be a bonus:

  • Debian/Ubuntu sysadmin experience
  • Familiarity with new development or deployment processes, and an ability to evaluate and recommend them to the development team when appropriate
  • Good knowledge of virtualisation technologies and services, e.g KVM, AWS (EC2)
  • Familiarity with the use of configuration management and system automation technology
  • Experience of modern programming languages, e.g. Python or Ruby

And we’d love to hear from you if you are:

  • Communicative and collaborative in your working style
  • Self-disciplined and able to work autonomously to bring projects to completion
  • Friendly, and get on with others well
  • Able to balance between technical pragmatism and technical purism

Location

The majority of our staff work from home. We have small clusters of people around Oxford, Bristol and London and would particularly like to hear from people based near those cities, but will accept applicants from anywhere in the United Kingdom. We only ask that you are willing to travel to other parts of the country to see your colleagues perhaps half a dozen times a year.

We expect you to be based in the UK and you need to have the right to work in this country (sorry, but we can’t offer help with visas or relocation expenses).

Salary & Benefits

£45-50,000 plus pension (3% employer contribution, 5% employee). We’re happy to consider part time working, pro rata. You will be a full PAYE employee.

Deadlines and Dates

The application deadline is 10am on Friday 30th September and interviews will take place during the week commencing 10th October. We will aim to notify applicants of whether or not they will be invited to interview on Tuesday 4th October.

Application instructions

Please ensure that your covering letter includes your thoughts on what makes an excellent sysadmin, and what makes one who's not quite good enough.

No recruiters or agencies, please.

You will be developing new product offerings, improve existing ones, roll out products to production and ensure all works well in our DTAP. Key to success is automation.
