  • Health and Dental insurance (100% coverage)
  • Lots of PTO and unlimited personal days
  • Fun and casual work environment
  • Fully stocked fridge

jobs.title: Systems Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
At Canonical it is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We believe the best way to fuel innovation is to give the innovators the technology they need.  As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) for the Information Services (IS) team you'll play a key role in driving this mission and helping to define the future of free software.


Why this job is important


IS supports and maintains all of Canonical’s production services and IS team members use real-life operational experiences to contribute to product improvements.  The IS team at Canonical runs the services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.  As an SRE you’ll be in a unique position that will allow you to provide critical feedback to developers by writing code, submitting bugs, and working with others within the company to ensure that Canonical products are as good as they can be.  You will also be able to develop and submit fixes and enhancements directly.


What you will learn at this job


SREs work closely with development teams to build and maintain the extraordinary infrastructure required to run all of Canonical and Ubuntu’s systems and services.  The scope of our responsibility combined with the overall size of our environment means that our SREs face new challenges every day.  You can expect to gain hands-on experience in the following areas:



  • Software development in Python and Go in order to automate repetitive tasks

  • Continuous integration and continuous deployment using a combination of open source and Canonical developed tools

  • Operating clouds at scale using OpenStack, Ceph, MAAS and Juju

  • Deploying, troubleshooting, and optimising services running on both private and public clouds using open source software like Ubuntu, Apache, HAProxy, PostgreSQL, and Squid.


Canonical’s IS team embraces autonomy and to that end has instituted Self Directed (SD) time. A portion of your work week is set aside to allow you to work on what you think will most benefit the IS team specifically and Canonical in general.


Key Responsibilities


SREs rotate through three roles:



  1. Maintaining all core services, networks, and infrastructure (including public and private clouds).  The ability to work under pressure and demonstrate sound problem solving skills in a fast-paced and complex environment are key here.

  2. Working directly with a variety of development teams within Canonical in a devops role to test, deploy, monitor and maintain services running on our production clouds. This will require an overlap of development and administration skills, as you help write and review code you will then use to deploy and maintain services using Canonical's cloud products.

  3. Larger project work, currently focused on large scale cloud deployments and overall process improvements.  This role gives SREs the ability to utilize development and architecting skills in a focused manner that is unique to Canonical.

jobs.title: Senior Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced systems engineer to help us scale our infrastructure for Postmark, Beanstalk, and DeployBot. It's a big role to fill and requires broad knowledge of software and infrastructure. You'll have direct impact on how we define and build our systems. We consider performance and service availability a primary feature of every product we offer. Your work will ensure that tens of thousands of developers can successfully build on top of our services with confidence and peace of mind. 


Your role on the team


We run a fully managed environment of bare metal hardware and virtualized servers hosted in one of the most advanced data centers in the midwest (with ServerCentral). Our infrastructure is made up of a variety of server configurations (mostly Supermicro and Juniper), including all SSD storage and 10GbE networking.


You will help design and maintain the infrastructure for our products. This includes capacity planning of hardware and network as well as building the infrastructure to bring up new services. This might range from designing faster ways to provision servers to improving shared services like monitoring, logging, DNS, and IPAM. 


Our application developers are heavily involved in running and understanding the systems that our products are built upon. You will work directly with the team to help automate, provision, and scale the services that support our customers. 


For example, we are currently expanding to new data centers. You would help define how we automate provisioning across each data center while keeping network, security, monitoring and services consistent. This expansion is critical to lowering latency and increasing availability for our customers.

jobs.title: Full Stack - NodeJS + React
jobs.content:
So we're not Twitter. We get that. We're also not GreenPeace.  We get that as well.  What we are, though, is trying to do our part to better the industry that we know best: Online Video.  And if we do our jobs right then we will become greater then Twitter and (maybe) GreenPeace!


We're creating a break through platform using NodeJS + React that will transform how online video is traded and exchanged globally.  Everything from your favourite music videos to breaking news will be discovered, exchanged and reported on our platform.  


We're just at the beginning of our journey so we need the ground floor crew - people who lean into problems and have great initiative and talent.   People who take calculated risks and push boundaries.  And yes, you've heard this song and dance before, but this is the real deal.  If we can get this right then the sky is the limited.


The ideal you will be:



  • A rockstar in NodeJS and React;

  • Have envious experience in transaction based architecture;

  • Be able to work remotely and as part of a virtual team;

  • Bonus marks if you've worked with online video before (we have!)

jobs.title: Javascript engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced front-end coder to join our growing team here at We Got POP in East London.  The friendly tech team values well-engineered solutions, and is part of a dynamic startup where you will have the opportunity to impact our users and the productions using our platform.


POP is a great place to work, and we care about our team and about creating high quality software that we can be proud of.


The newer parts of the existing codebase are well done in React with Redux.  Some of the older parts are written using older technologies, and it's on our roadmap to move everything to React.


Some of the things we'll be working on over the next months include a complex search page, interactive real-time tables of data, and the messaging and secure document management parts of our mobile app.

jobs.title: Front-End JS/React/CSS Web Developer
jobs.content:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced front-end web developer to join the team full time in our Edinburgh office working on some very novel web and mobile projects we have been quietly prototyping.


The essence of our work is in creating original approaches to explore and interact with information that reveal new insights and experiences of value.


You should should be a creative front-end developer who is as comfortable working on the visual implementation as the code behind it. You should have 4+ years of experience, an eye for design and enjoy spending most of your development time sculpting CSS and Javascript in a way that pushes forwards the interactive and aesthetic boundaries in the browser.

jobs.title: Senior BI / MicroStrategy Consultant
jobs.content:
We’re calling on you to join VPT as a Senior BI MicroStrategy Consultant. We are a long-standing innovative Big Data consultancy, MicroStrategy partner and provider of multi-terabyte Analytics-as-a-Service solutions. We are in the UK and based in Chiswick, West London and you will be working with some of the most experienced MicroStrategy consultants in the world, so expect to combine strong client interaction and technical skills with demands to ‘think outside of the box’.


Working with the full MicroStrategy stack, your work can involve everything from front-end, back-end, SDK, data modelling, data engineering, mobile and integration work. Finally, we coach and mentor our clients in the rapidly evolving area of ‘Agile BI’.


As a Senior BI MicroStrategy Consultant your role will cover everything from technical consultancy and delivery through to pre-sales. You will be responsible for driving best adoption and practice with MicroStrategy; ensuring all engagements and work produced are of top quality. This is a pivotal role that will see you work with and lead experienced teams within challenging environments whilst embracing new technology and approaches.


Travel across UK and Europe will be required.

jobs.title: QA and Test Manager
jobs.content:
Saent is looking for a hands-on and experienced QA manager. You not only understand the discipline of testing, but are also able to design, manage and implement a testing process (and keep improving on it). Ideally, you also have experience recruiting and building a test team and help us grow our QA efforts.

At Saent, weâre helping people live fulfilling lives by coaching them toward better and healthier work habits, something we call âmindful productivity.â We do this through a combination of software and hardware products, built by a completely distributed team of people all around the world (currently in Los Angeles, Providence, Berlin, Ho Chi-Minh, Beijing, Shenzhen) for customers who are also all around the globe (60+ countries).

In this role, you will be responsible for testing all our productsâ features, which includes our software and hardware products. You will be working closely together with our software and hardware development teams, as well as customer support, and our early release user groups. In the near future, you will help us build a QA team, so this role mixes hands-on tasks with managerial responsibility.

This role is not for you if youâre looking for structure and someone holding your hand all the time. We are still a very young company and the team and our processes are still being built; donât expect to arrive in a typical managerial role where your responsibilities are very narrowly defined and clear.
Saent is set for fast growth in the months and years ahead, and weâre building a solution that eventually will benefit all the worldâs 640 million knowledge workers. You will have a chance to help build the company and team, and shape our QA efforts and structure for the years and decades ahead.
In addition, we offer you the opportunity to work from anywhere you want: Saent is a fully remote team and we donât mind if youâre in San Francisco, Bangalore, or a remote island in the Pacific. A solid internet connection is the only requirement.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Build a team of QA professionals and implement appropriate testing processes throughout the organization.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our products and vision.
  • Keep testing tools and ticket tracking up to date.
  • Test all new features of both our software and hardware products.
  • Work closely together with customer support and our development team on bug tracking and resolution.
  • Coordinate early (beta) releases with our test groups.
  • Responsibility for quality of all our software and hardware releases.
  • Ensure content and structure of all testing documents / artifacts are documented and maintained.
  • Document, implement, monitor, and enforce all processes for testing as per standards defined by you and executive team.
  • Provide updates and reports on overall quality for other teams in the organization.
  • Ensure the timely delivery of testing milestones.

REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS

  • Being hands-on and not afraid to âget your hands dirty,â especially early on without any other testers on the team.
  • Experience in QA and testing of software and hardware, ideally with experience building and managing a QA team.
  • Experience in project management.
  • Excellent communication skills in English in both a written and verbal form.
  • Extremely organized with a great eye for detail.
  • Remote working experience desirable.
  • Passionate about productivity and work-life balance.
  • Computer Science or Engineering degree or equivalent work experience a strong plus.
  • Demonstrable passion for and experience with both Windows and OS X software / apps, as well as with wearables, IoT, or connected devices.
  • Experience managing and interfacing with (outsourced) teams in Asia (currently China and Vietnam), where English may be a second language.

What we offer you
  • A market-rate salary.
  • The ability to work from anywhere at anytime.
  • Unlimited vacation days.
  • A Kindle with an âall you can readâ buffet on us.

Recruitment process

Round 1: send us your CV on jobs@saent.com, including a cover letter with answers to the following five questions:

  1. What makes a great test manager in your opinion?
  2. Looking at Saent from the outside, what's something you would do differently if you were in charge?
  3. Whatâs the biggest challenge youâve ever faced and how did you overcome it?
  4. Whatâs the one reason why we should hire you (and not someone else) for this role?
  5. Whatâs the most fascinating book youâve read recently?

Round 2: follow-up questions by email.

Round 3: asynchronous interview over Slack spread out over a week with one or more Saent team members.

Round 4: Skype interview.

Round 5: paid test assignment. 

To apply: Send us your CV on jobs@saent.com, including a cover letter with answers to the following five questions:1. What makes a great test manager in your opinion?2. Looking at Saent from the outside, what's something you would do differently if you were in charge?3. Whatâs the biggest challenge youâve ever faced and how did you overcome it?4. Whatâs the one reason why we should hire you (and not someone else) for this role?5. Whatâs the most fascinating book youâve read recently?

jobs.title: Drupal Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Raleigh, NC
URL: http://www.bluespark.com/sales-executive

Bluespark is a digital agency. We love solving tough problems—from user experience to design to code. We build enterprise web-based software for a range of clients that include Red Hat, TripAdvisor, Sport Obermeyer, Sticker Giant, UCLA, Indiana University, and the Cleveland Public Library. 

We are looking for talented Front End Web Developers who understand Drupal. We are looking for people that relish challenges and who are more interested in the right solution rather than the most innovative. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working on a multi-disciplinary team.

Where will you work?
Bluespark is a distributed company. That’s just a fancy way of saying that you can work from anywhere. The only requirement is that you be available for our standard working hours of 9 AM - 12 PM Central U.S. Time; your remaining hours are flex time. Most people work from home—wherever that may be—occasionally traveling to client sites, conferences, or trainings. The majority of our clients are based in the U.S.

Who should apply?
People who want to make a difference. People who want to be part of a community of partners. People who are interested in building a company that’s bigger than the four walls of a building—a company that spans the globe and believes that its people are at the core of the value we add to the world. People who embody curiosity, awareness, resoluteness, and empathy—who are flexible, proactive, and driven.

If this excites you, keep reading.

Accountabilities

  • Collaborating with developers and creatives.
  • Creating user interfaces that our clients and their customers love.
  • Research. Technical Planning. Prototyping.
  • Contributing to open source projects.
  • Testing and developing cross-browser and cross-device compatible UIs.​
  • Squashing bugs.
  • Providing technical insight to strategists and designers in the early stages of the project.
  • Advising clients and others on technical implementation details of a project.
  • Working with other developers to create project estimates.

Competencies  

  • Grit
  • Perpetually curious
  • Excellent communication habits
  • Superior client service skills
  • Professional and disciplined remote collaboration
  • An excellent sense of humor
  • BONUS: Interest in writing blog posts and books; interest in speaking at conferences

Desired Experience

  • Drupal 7. Ideally Drupal 8. Both site building and theme layers.
  • Responsive design and development
  • Visual design principles
  • Front end development best practices
  • Front end web performance optimization
  • JavaScript and frameworks (jQuery, Angular, etc)
  • HTML and template languages (PHPtemplate & Twig)
  • Advanced CSS and post/preprocessors (SASS, Autoprefixer, Webfonts, etc)
  • Software and UI design
  • Understanding of modern SEO techniques
  • BONUS: iOS and Android application / UI development

We are primarily a Drupal-based development shop. Experience with Drupal is virtually a necessity, and knowledge of the Drupal 7 and 8 theme layer is highly desired. However, if you lack Drupal experience, but bring other talents to the table, please apply anyway.

Compensation & Benefits

Health Insurance. We cover 100% of your health insurance and 25% of your family’s insurance.

25 Days PTO. The time does not transfer from year-to-year because we want you to take ALL of it every year. We believe that happy, well-rested people are the best people to work with.

Winter Holiday Shutdown. Bluespark completely shuts down the last week of December. It’s the end of the year, we should enjoy ourselves a bit.

Sick time as needed—does not count against your PTO.

Parental Leave. 12 weeks of maternity, paternity, and adoption leave for new parents broken up as follows: 8 weeks of 100% paid parental leave within 12 months after the birth of the child. You can extend this period with PTO. The last four weeks are a transition period where you work half-time and are paid 50% of your salary. Eligibility begins after 1 year of employment, limited to once per year.

Work from anywhere. Travel around the world or work from the comfort of your home. You just need a stable Internet connection.

Flexible schedule. Our schedules are pretty flexible. Need to run an errand in the middle of the day? Totally cool. We have people who put in their eight hours in a single shot. Others who break it up throughout the day.

Reasonable schedules. It’s sad that we even need to list this as a benefit. But we don’t expect more than 40 hours of work in a week. We don’t do “crunch times” during projects.

Autonomy. A big part of working at Bluespark is being part of a community of expert practitioners. People who actually enjoy what they're doing. Because of that, we actively nurture a culture of connected autonomy—that is, you are the expert and we trust your expertise. We have systems, methods, processes, and best practices, but these are there to help you do your job better—not be yoke that hold you back from doing great work. As such, break the rules, go off script—and tell us what you learned and what we, as a company, can do to improve.

Salary commensurate with location, role, and experience.

To apply: Apply here: http://www.bluespark.com/front-end-web-developer-application

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Who we are and what weâre looking for:
Bergamotte is an online flower delivery company based in Paris. We launched in 2015, and after several successful rounds of fundraising and thousands of bouquets delivered, we have lots of exciting new projects in bloom. This means weâre looking for a creative, adventurous Senior Ruby on Rails developer to come along for the ride.

You will join a team of 4 developers and 1 U/X designer to help us fine-tune our existing app, as well as to build new features. You can either work from our spacious office in downtown Paris or from the comfort of your own home - itâs up to you. Weâre looking for a developer with extensive Ruby experience, an eye for detail and an ability to put themselves in the end-userâs shoes.

Our stack :
  • Back-end: Ruby on Rails (Rails 4.X)
  • Front-end: HAML, SASS, Coffee Script, HTML5, JQuery, etc.
  • Database: PostgreSQL
  • Source control: Git + github.com
  • Code review: Code Climate
  • Monitoring: Newrelic

Requirements :
  • At least 3 years of experience working on e-commerce apps or similar projects (primarily built with Ruby)
  • Great written and spoken English skills
  • Able to work full-time
  • The ability to enter into an employment contract or to bill clients in France

To apply: If this sounds like a good fit for you, the first (and most important) step of the application process is a code test. You can access it here : https://github.com/bergamotte/rails-coding-test

jobs.title: .Net Web Developer
jobs.content:
To be a key member of the Web Development Team by assisting in designing, implementing and supporting core web applications across the groups’ various brands and websites.


Key Objectives



  • Liaise with business owners and project managers, in an agile environment, to ensure functionality requirements are fully understood

  • Provide accurate estimates on development work

  • Take business requirements and deliver well designed, high quality, maintainable and reusable web applications that are well documented

  • Support the production websites

  • Liaise with third party suppliers to achieve development goals and support the production environments

  • Assist with out of hours support when necessary


Develop web applications


Take business requirements and deliver well designed, documented, built and tested web applications to the live web environment.


Support the live Monarch group web sites and environment


Investigate reported website issues, work with the team to develop solutions and release in a timely manner to reduce impact to the business.


Ensure technical standards are adhered to and maintained along with the Web Team Leader and team members


Code reviews of peers, documentation of standards and best practices.


Keep up-to-date with current industry developments and new technologies


Ensure personal knowledge and skill levels are maintained and current. Look to implement these skills into the working environment

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
About you

To be part of our team you must be:



  • Passionate about technology. Technology never stops and neither do we. In a competitive market, we need to keep our edge, constantly evaluating the right technologies that help us deliver for our customers. You must be comfortable doing what no-one else has done before.

  • Customer-focused. You will help us build and evolve quality products that are loved by users worldwide. And you will be comfortable talking to non-technical users to help understand their needs and deliver software to make them more productive.

  • A polyglot developer. No technology is the right fit for everything, so you must be comfortable with learning and applying technology across the full stack.

  • Pro-active and driven. Everyone makes a difference to the company. You care about the team, and continual improvement in yourself and others.


What will you do?



  • Deliver technically challenging projects.

  • Help shape the future of our products and our company.

  • Mentor other developers to give them a chance to shine.

jobs.title: Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
Internet.org is a global initiative dedicated to making affordable Internet access available to the two thirds of the world not yet connected. Making the Internet available to every person on earth is a goal too large and too important for any one company, group, or government to solve alone. Internet.org’s partners have come together to meet this challenge because they believe in the power of a connected world. This role is an opportunity to be part of this initiative by working with Network Infrastructure Companies and Internet Service Providers, delivering affordable Internet service to the unconnected in rural areas. As a Partner Engineer you will handle the technical relationship with Internet Service Providers based in rural areas worldwide, and work closely with the Facebook account managers to draft the partnership roadmap to provide affordable and reliable Internet access. This position is full time and is based in London.


Responsibilities





  • Deeply understand the various Facebook platforms and underlying implementation


  • Be a technical expert on integrating Wi-Fi network solutions, Facebook software and internet.org core features with ISPs’ infrastructure


  • Help our partners to launch the internet.org service in their networks


  • Manage the technical relationship with the ISP partners, provide technical support and handle service outages


  • Drive partner requirements, bugs and feature requests with Product and Engineering


  • Write documentation, samples, and other materials to share with the broader Facebook developer community

jobs.title: Production Engineer
jobs.content:
Production Engineers at Facebook are hybrid software/systems engineers who ensure that Facebook's services run smoothly and have the capacity for future growth. They are embedded in every one of Facebook's product and infrastructure teams, and are core participants in every significant engineering effort underway in the company. Our team is comprised of varying levels of experience and backgrounds, from new grads to industry veterans. Relevant industry experience is important, but ultimately less so than your demonstrated abilities and attitude. We sail into uncharted waters every day at Facebook in Production Engineering, and we are always learning. This position is full-time and located in our Dublin, International Headquarters office.



Responsibilities





  • Own back-end services like our Hadoop data warehouses, front-end services like Chat and Newsfeed, infrastructure components like our Memcache infrastructure, and everything in between


  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world


  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation


  • Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by millions of users all around the world

jobs.title: Data Engineer, Analytics
jobs.content:
Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to influence product decisions for products being used by over half a billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. Our data warehouse team works very closely with Product Managers, Product Analysts and Internet Marketers to figure out ways to acquire new users, retain existing users and optimize user experience - all of this using massive amounts of data. In this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. In this role, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll get an opportunity to solve some of the most challenging business problems on the web and mobile Internet, at a scale that few companies can match.


Responsibilities



  • Manage data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products.

  • Interface with engineers, product managers and product analysts to understand data needs.

  • Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership.

  • Design, build and launch new data models in production.

  • Design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production.

  • Support existing processes running in production.

  • Define and manage SLA for all data sets in allocated areas of ownership.

  • Work with data infrastructure to triage infra issues and drive to resolution.

jobs.title: Director, Software Engineering
jobs.content:
We want the most creative and experienced engineering leaders to join us in making the world more open and connected. We embrace entrepreneurs as well as those who come from more established organizations. We’re looking for Software Engineering Managers with progressive technical experience, a demonstrated progression of management scope, sharp coding skills, and a passion for managing outstanding engineers in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities



  • Be a highly technical, hands-on coder and an effective people manager

  • Communicate across functions and drive engineering initiatives

  • Participate in technical design

  • Be a subject matter expert in a product domain

  • Define and influence product strategy

jobs.title: Manager, Software Engineering
jobs.content:
We want the most creative and experienced engineering leaders to join us in making the world more open and connected. We embrace entrepreneurs as well as those who come from more established organizations. We’re looking for Software Engineering Managers with progressive technical experience, a demonstrated progression of management scope, sharp coding skills, and a passion for managing outstanding engineers in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities



  • Be a highly technical, hands-on coder and an effective people manager

  • Communicate across functions and drive engineering initiatives

  • Participate in technical design

  • Be a subject matter expert in a product domain

  • Define and influence product strategy

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Products
jobs.content:
Want to create products that more than 1 billion people around the world use? Want to build and ship new products or improve existing products like Facebook At Work, Ads, Photos, Videos, Places and Mobile? Want to solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems? Facebook is seeking an experienced software engineer to join our products teams in London. This position is full-time and is based in our London office. Facebook is staffing some of its most important engineering initiatives related to our long-term revenue out of London, and it's a huge opportunity for senior engineers to play a strong leadership role in these initiatives.


Responsibilities



  • Create applications using PHP, Java, Javascript, C++, React, Python

  • Build end-to-end products for web, mobile

  • Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications

  • Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale back-end services

  • Build report interfaces and data feeds

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
jobs.content:
Our Tel Aviv Engineering team is developing products across all of Facebook stack. As an engineer in our team you will work on products that affect the lives of billions using variety of technologies including large scale systems, big data problems and complex networking technologies. We are looking for a 'full stack' engineer who is able to move quickly between iOS, Android, low level networking, backend, kernel development, and much more. If you're experienced with various technologies, a fast learner and have a “get things done” mentality, we'd love to hear from you!


Responsibilities



  • Identify issues and implement solutions to complex problems in large scale backend infrastructure and mobile platforms

  • Analyze & solve difficult problems across the stack

  • Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build high scale backend services

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Systems
jobs.content:
A person in this role will build the systems that allow us to ingest, sanitise, and normalise diverse datasets into meaningful structured data and connections within the social graph. If you're excited by the idea of building out a richly connected knowledge graph and augmenting it with services that allow us to create great product experiences built on top of data, you might be the person we're looking for.


Responsibilities



  • Build infrastructure that enables us to scale our knowledge graph and quickly expand into new domains

  • Work with product teams to deliver great experiences built on top of data

  • Monitor and reduce duplicate entities across the graph (and web)

  • Increase the amount of metadata we have about each entities and the connections between them

  • Improve graph quality by building systems that select and surface the best available data

  • Build tools that allow us to understand and track the quality of the graph over time

jobs.title: Frontend Javascript-Developer
jobs.content:
Are you interested in politics? And a Frontend Developer (m/f) who is in love with the modern technology stack like ES6, React and Webpack? You seek for a position with responsibility and impact?! Do you want to work in a fast growing successful company with flat hierarchies and customised working environment that fits your needs? Use your skills for democracy in real time and apply!


Your Work


You develop, test, document and maintain our JS driven web application. You ensure quality code with reviews and alignment with strong engineering principles and standards. You cooperate with backend developers to develop high-quality products with a focus on scalability. You also collaborate directly with product management, marketing, design and our other developers


Your Benefits


We combine a precise business model with the desire to advance society. We value fairness, transparency and constructive criticism. You can expect a steep learning curve and the possibility to advance your career. We offer full-time work in a dynamic and friendly environment, a fair salary and family-friendly work hours


Skills & Requirements


You have strong JavaScript skills using newest coding, testing, debugging, and automation techniques and are up to date with the latest topics in frontend programming. You have at least 2 years of experience working as a developer and can provide good insights on the tradeoffs between frontend JS frameworks like Angular, React, Knockout, etc. Developing highly functional, data-rich web applications with dynamic, JS-driven interfaces is no problem for you. You are familiar with Jenkins or other automated build tool.

jobs.title: Web Designer (UI/UX)
jobs.content: Movement Mortgage is hiring a Web Designer (UI/UX) in Fort Mill, SC

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Hornet is the fastest growing gay social network in the world. We are a mobile location-based discovery app with social features unseen in the competition. We connect 15 Million users worldwide and are growing rapidly. 

We pride ourselves in having a reliable tech platform for guys to discover each other and connect, 24/7/365. We're looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to help us uphold this reputation into the future as we build out new product enhancements and features. A unique opportunity to engineer large scale systems that power an app people use every day.

What you'll do:

  • Develop tools, processes and provision environments to enable backend engineers to deploy and monitor their own systems.
  • Build and battle-test high availability infrastructure with a particular focus on Mean Time To Repair (MTTR)
  • Be involved with the software design process to provide insight and expertise for building reliable and scalable software infrastructure from the ground up.
  • Partake in an on-call rotation alongside the engineers who build our production backends.

What you'll need to have:

  • Comfort with large scale production systems and technologies, for example load balancing, monitoring, distributed systems, and configuration management.
  • A track record of designing and executing medium to large scale systems automation projects with strong autonomy.
  • Strong coding skills in at least one programming language, and a desire to pick up more. We work primarily in Ruby, with smatterings of Go and Node.js

Deep knowledge of the following platforms/tech highly preferred: 

  • Amazon Web Services (especially EC2, S3, etc.)
  • PostgreSQL
  • Cassandra
  • Linux (Red Hat / CentOS)

To apply: Send us a brief resume/CV at careers@gethornet.com, along with a brief introduction and why you think you'd be a great fit for this position.

jobs.title: PHP backend developer / full-stack developer
jobs.content:
Our Software as a Service (SaaS) solution is a framework which empowers companies of all lines of business to sell their services and products online.
This includes, but is not limited to searching, publishing, paying, real-time communication and collaboration in addition to analytical monitoring and tracking. We are funded by Deutsche Telekom (T-Ventures) and IBB as well as select individual investors and were incorporated in 2012. Our main focus is to build customized B2B solutions based on our framework mainly in the banking, insurance, e-Learning and tele-medicine/healthcare sectors.


Since our Sales-Team is more and more recognized as the gods of acquiring new projects, we are currently seeking to hire a PHP backend developer (f/m) for our team.


We are working in a very modern office in the heart of Berlin with a perfect infrastructure (hub:raum, Deutsche Telekom AG) and have built an inspiring but challenging environment with creative, dynamic and multi-cultural colleagues. Take your chance to shape a truly innovative software as a service solution and to get insights in a large variety of businesses as well as the challenging task to build a digital communication channel to support different business-models.


Your responsibilities that directly impacts the future of the company:


As a member of our growing team you will have a mandate to take part in all stages of the development life cycle. Your key daily tasks include:



  • Develop, implement and maintain our code with PHP, MySQL

  • Develop a continues integration process and environment for our increasing number of projects

  • Develop a smart, uniform testing environment that automatically tests our projects and helps us reducing the workload of Quality Assurance

  • Improve the quality of our current modules and help us staying a provider of cutting edge communication solutions


Perform code verification and help to create a code-review process that is driven not by controlling but by the desire to learn from each other and that is open to innovation

jobs.title: Software Engineer for 3D Mapping & Visualisation
jobs.content:
Can you help us to collect and visualise terabytes of Geo data using cloud technology? Are you looking for an attractive career in an international company? Then Fugro is looking for you.


Fugro operates worldwide to perform measurements with advanced sensors to map the earth’s surface and subsurface. Day in, day out we collect terabytes of data. We do this to provide geo-intelligence and asset integrity solutions to our clients. Our software engineers help in the development of these sensors and write software to process and analyse the data. They also take care of the presentation of the data in our web based 3D virtual world. 


Within our team, software engineers have a varied set of responsibilities. You will analyse the specifications for new development and you will research how these can be implemented within Fugro’s software. You will take care of the implementation, using open source libraries and modern platforms such as C#.NET, MVC and WebGL. All our data has a spatial component, so you will be using GIS, CAD and visualisation software as well. We rely heavily on cloud services (AWS) to enable scalable software and high performance computing, so as a software engineer you will be working with these cloud resources extensively.

jobs.title: ScrumMaster
jobs.content:
Key responsibilities


You will manage one or more agile projects, typically to deliver a specific product or transformation via a multi-disciplinary, highly skilled team. You’ll be adept at delivering complex projects, breaking down barriers for your team, and both planning at a higher level and getting into the detail to make things happen when needed. You will be core to decisions that build high performing teams, where people are excited about the work they are undertaking.


The responsibilities of the post are:



  • Deliver projects and products using the appropriate agile project management methodology, learning & iterating frequently

  • Work with the product owners to define the roadmap for any given product and translate this into user stories

  • Organize and/or facilitate all sprint ceremonies

  • Support Product Owners to prioritise the work that needs to be done against the capacity and capability of the team

  • Ensure all products are built to an appropriate level of quality for the stage (alpha/beta/production)

  • Actively participate in the agile / ScrumMaster community. Share and re-apply skills and knowledge and bring in best practices

  • Ensure impediments are removed so that the teams can run efficiently

  • Provide coaching in the team in agile concepts, principles and values. Ultimately lead teams to higher levels of performance and productivity

  • Socialise agile concepts throughout the organization and provide training and coaching in agile frameworks, processes, principles, vales and techniques.

  • Be an agent of change and establish a culture of continuous improvement.

  • Implement a process to measure the capacity of the agile teams

  • Understand the value of metrics and radiating information and measure and provide feedback on sprint velocity and team performance

  • Assist the technical teams with estimation

  • Document the appropriate aspects of design and development processes

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for a world class web store

  • Design, create, own and maintain our high-performance cloud-based eco-system (Java stack)

  • Innovate, design and implement elements like the online store, order management, inventory and warehouse management, transportation planning and many more

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code and application tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: IT Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Operations Team runs external, customer-facing systems as well as our internal IT infrastructure. As an IT Operations Engineer you will be responsible for the setup, installation, monitoring and troubleshooting of our Linux-based infrastructure.


As a DevOps Engineer at InterNations, you will:



  • be responsible for the administration of Linux-based systems (Debian and Ubuntu)

  • run software like nginx, Tomcat, PHP, MySQL/MariaDB, Redis, RabbitMQ in production quality and within a serious SLA

  • manage configuration changes and roll-outs, implement custom solutions

  • actively contribute towards bottleneck diagnosis and performance optimization

  • work closely together with the Engineering teams on performance, scalability and operability

  • run, troubleshoot and extend our Jenkins-based Continuous Delivery Pipeline

  • design and implement monitoring and fault detection strategies


You meet the following requirements:



  • significant previous experience with running Linux systems in a production environment, especially in the context of web applications

  • a very good understanding of networking and networking appliances: routing, switching, load balancers, firewalls

  • significant experience with running a relational database system under significant load (MySQL, PostgreSQL)

  • no trouble picking up a scripting language or two in order to implement custom solutions

  • previous experience in performance analysis and optimization on a Linux stack

  • experience with virtualization, container technology or configuration management is a plus


We offer:



  • top notch MacBook, 27” display, keyboard layout of choice

  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings


Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Hans Bernhard Streit to:jobs@internations.org

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
This is a really exciting opportunity to get into a company at the start, shape the growth and strategy and help create the future for a company leading the next wave of market network technology.


You'll be given the freedom to shape how the product works and to work on new code in line with our business plan.  You will have responsibility for the technology and will provide updates, feedback, suggestions in our weekly team meeting.


The initial 3-6 months, we expect you'll be focused on:


1) Strengthening our existing technology platform


2) Developing our mobile apps - iOS and Android 


3) Creating APIs with other solutions such as google calendar, Sage Pay etc.


The aim is to provide more benefit to our customers, strengthen our technology and ultimately broaden our reach.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
The software development team at Nortech is focused on building a platform to enable a low-carbon next-generation power grid. We are looking for passionate, skilled software developers to join our team and deliver the software solutions that make this a reality. You will be in a position to help shape the future of a platform used by energy utilities across the globe.


We have a broad technology stack, using HTML5, TypeScript to build a rich UI on the frontend, APIs/services written in C# on the backend and MySQL for data storage. We use the best developer tools available including version control (Git), continuous integration (TeamCity), bug tracking (FogBugz) and monitoring (InfluxDB/Grafana). We are looking for developers who are keen to work across the full tech stack.


We have a culture where we promote every team member generating new ideas. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of the features they are adding. We use the right tools for the job and encourage developers to stay open to new technologies.


Requirements:



  • Experience using one or more general purpose programming languages (C#, TypeScript would be ideal)

  • Understanding of software development best practices

  • Interest and ability to learn new technologies as needed

  • Experience working in a team using source control (Git, Mercurial, SVN)


You must be eligible to work in the UK to apply for this position.

jobs.title: Customer Happiness Specialist
jobs.content:
Love making people feel happy? Love connecting with our customers, readers, and fans? Then this could be the job for you.

As our Customer Happiness Specialist, youâre the essence of extraordinary customer service. You go beyond answering emails, beyond responding to comments on Facebook or Twitter, beyond managing customer accounts. You truly touch peopleâs lives. You are the heart of our reputation, and ensure feedback flows to all teams in order to improve and innovate our services and student experience.

If you think you are smart, action-oriented, analytical, love creative ideas, and have a passion for marketing and learning new things, we welcome you to apply!

Responsibilities
  • Provide an amazing, personalized experience to each customer. No copy and paste answers. Only meaningful, personalized replies with love and care injected into each message.
  • Effectively diagnose and solve day-to-day customer concerns and issues through various support channels such as emails, calls, blogs, social media etc.
  • Analyze customer feedback while continuously looking for ways to improve customer experience.
  • Engage the customer community through our forums, social media platforms, and daily interaction.
  • Inspire and motivate our students to work towards their goals and achieve success.
  • Strive to make Lurn nation a community that our students are proud to be a part of
 
Experience and Skills
  • Excellent command of the English language.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Enjoy spending hours communicating with customers.
  • Technology is your good friend.
  • You can communicate technically with NON-technical people.
  • You have an innovative mind and are a self-starter.
  • Proactive in coming up with ideas and solutions that will improve customer experience.

To apply: To apply, please send us a copy of your resume as well as a video cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for this position. Your video cover letter should be no longer than 2 minutes.Please use this link to apply: http://lurn.com/career/customerhappinessspecialist.html

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Your responsibilities



  • Manage, maintain and improve Hybrid cloud environment and the application it hosts

  • Assist Partners in utilizing the platform

  • Provide Technical expertise and architectural know-how

  • Strive to deliver the best possible experience for the units utilizing the platform

  • Assess relevance of new technologies



We offer



  • A dynamic and motivated multilingual working environment strongly focus on teamwork

  • An opportunity to test new technologies, drive PoCs and implement new technologies if they prove relevant

  • A chance to touch a wide variety of up to date technologies, following up to date practices

jobs.title: Unix Systems Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking to recruit an enthusiastic, highly motivated software engineer to work at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will be working in the Software Infrastructure Services team maintaining and improving in-house software systems. Work will include:



  • Maintenance and development of our existing user account management system

  • Maintenance and development of a petabyte-scale file archiving solution

  • Development of new systems infrastructure software tools as required.


Software Infrastructure Services is part of the Systems Infrastructure team, whose responsibilities include HPC, storage, datacentre infrastructure and networking. You will work alongside systems administrators and software engineers providing services to internal and external users.

jobs.title: Backend Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a talented python software engineer to join the the Open Targets Core team. You will be involved in running large-scale biological data analysis and integration and developing the REST API powering the targetvalidation.org platform.

The main responsibilities will involve design and implementation of backend micro-services and data processing pipelines in Python on Unix-based systems, and maintenance of those services in a cloud environment.



In addition the post will involve extensive interaction with web developers and UX team to refine and test the interface to the services.

You will join a startup-like environment, where we use a range of modern technologies and we continuously look for improvement. We work following Agile practices and you are encouraged to take ownership of what you work on.

The Centre for Therapeutic Target Validation (CTTV) is a recently established public-private initiative between EMBL-EBI, GlaxoSmithKline and the Sanger Institute, to generate and integrate evidence on the validity of biological targets for drug development. The core CTTV operations are based at the EMBL-EBI.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Frontend Developer


Do you get excited from front-end development, but getting bored with HTML, CSS and jQuery? Are you able to build client-side apps on the blazing APIs which you have developed with our backenders? Yes? Then you are the person we are looking for!  


your role


As a leading digital agency in the Netherlands, we always thrive to use the best, fastest and most elegant online solutions for our customers. Always challenging our developers to find the most appropriate technologies to achieve the smoothest results.


Our developers work closely together so frontend, backend and design are connected to create a product that excels in quality, speed and scalability. You’ll work in an internationally oriented team in Rotterdam and Amsterdam where you will work in one or more scrum teams with other top notch developers and designers.


If you have the ambition, you are welcome to manage Junior and Medior Developers and make sure quality and knowledge is passed on.


As a Senior you are also expected to help set the application architecture with our architects and API developers. Between projects you optimize our automation tools, build new Angular directives or dig in the latest on technologies.

jobs.title: Android Developer | Location Amsterdam or Rotterdam
jobs.content:
We are seeking a devilish brilliant Android Developer. Someone who considers everything possible, even when others throw in the towel. By using the right technique, you change difficult to use apps into apps that people enjoy using. Are you a developer with several years experience and do you get excited from difficult customer questions? Let's meet!



 You hang up your coat, get a cup of coffee and ...


You start working on one of our great clients; a housing corporation. In their app they want to make it as easy as possible for tenants to terminate their contract. Their proposal: we add the feature prominently in the dashboard so users find it faster. But it creates an illogical flow. You find it a much better solution to place it in the menu. Today, you will try to convince the customer of your idea. In advance they are skeptical, but by strong argumentation they are convince and your advice onboard.


After lunch you will work on site with a large insurance company. In the upcoming weeks you are going to make sure that people can scan and send documents in their app with just one touch of a button. A complex feature and much thinking is involved. Today you are making a start by setting up a plan of attack.  


In the afternoon, there is a live demo on the schedule, where you show your customer what new features have been added. Again, over delivered on the set expectations and the customer is overjoyed! When do you dance on the tables? When the app is finally officially launched after months of hard work. Of course you are so curious after the first user responses. Which are full of praise. You did again, very tasty!

jobs.title: Sr. Mobile iOS and/or Android Developer
jobs.content:
Your role


We are looking forward to welcome an experienced, full-time (40h) mobile developer iOS/Android. You are part of a professional development team. You develop mobile applications within an Agile Scrum-environment. You are (partially) responsible for the look-and-feel and interaction of perfectly functional applications. You make the best judgments on performance and technical implementation of the interaction interface related to budget and costs.

jobs.title: Mid-Level Software Tester
jobs.content:
As a Software Tester at Keylane, you are responsible for the design and execution of test plans. You are also actively involved in the analysis of test results and the reporting thereof. With your clear approach and critical eye you make a difference when it comes to the quality of our software.


Some specific tasks: 



  • Maintain and execute functional, usability and regression tests.

  • Create test cases and test scenarios independently.

  • Execute and monitor testing.

  • Reporting of test results to team members.

  • Taking an active role in creating new test environments and to improve testing methodology and techniques.


The Keylane test teams are growing and developing rapidly, which is why you can take on a dynamic role within the organisation. Brainstorming about innovation and implementing new and improved methods and techniques is what the current business is all about!

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
As an experienced Java engineer within Keylane you’ll manage your own projects and budget. Within a close-knit team of developers, functional designers and testers you’ll carry out the big and complex changes to our software solution. The account teams will manage the specs with the clients and our project support handles administration, so you can focus on your programming.


Specific tasks for a Java engineer:



  • Devising technical and logical program designs.

  • Programming in Java, JSP and HTML/JavaScript/CSS.

  • Designing and implementing database queries using SQL.

  • Optimising the system for performance and capacity.

  • Optimising the functionalities of the database.

  • Implementing unit and system tests.

  • Organising and attending technical design sessions and code reviews.

  • Holding regular meetings with your team, functional designers and the client, respectively.

  • Implementing deployments


Besides working on Java development, we offer a range of courses to work on your own development. We also like to share our knowledge with colleagues, so you can start your own course within the organisation or use your skills to educate junior developers.

jobs.title: Salesforce Developer
jobs.content:
• Analysis of business requirements, entity relationships and converting to Salesforce custom objects, lookup relationships, junction objects, master detail relationships

  • Integration of Salesforce.com instance with proprietary and third party applications

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
Software Engineer, C++
jobs.content:
Company Description

Suitable is redefining face-to-face interaction and building a new market. We’re looking for creative, collaborative, and entrepreneurial talent to join our team. Our product is a disruptive technology that will change the way people communicate. We are a green company and want to find ways to protect our world for our kids. Our product is composed of multiple technologies and there is always something new to learn. Almost every Fortune 500 company on the planet is using Beam technology!

Job Description

We're looking for talented engineers to develop innovative, robust, and solid software for many aspects of our remote presence products. You will focus on turning customer and business needs into product functionality, creating the infrastructure necessary to operate our company, and making the entire engineering team more effective.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Design and build key components of our client apps (Windows, Mac, Chrome, iOS, Android), server software, and networking infrastructure
  • Develop and iterate prototypes of new product concepts and technical solutions
  • Build and improve internal engineering productivity tools

Qualifications

Skills / Job Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science or related technical field (or equivalent)
  • Solid knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Extensive programming experience in C/C++
  • Ability to get things done quickly and of high quality
  • Willingness to take on new challenges and solve unfamiliar problems
  • Experience with pair programming

In addition, we love to see people with personal projects that show an interest in product development and good engineering principles.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Technical Support Specialist
jobs.content:
As Looklet is constantly growing, we are now looking for a competent, driven and service-oriented colleague to join our Technical Support team!


Are you known as the one most tech savvy person among your friends? Are you passionate about helping people? Do you love working in a dynamic environment where you will learn new things every day?


We are a team consisting of wide range of skilled people, all with a passion for high tech state of the art software and hardware creating photo-realistic graphics.
You are the expert in your field and are always willing to help others. Apart from making sure clients succeed, you will have a large set of responsibilities and authority to influence in how we improve our offering.


You are naturally service minded, have a strong urge to give high quality help to clients and have the technical knowledge to do so.



Your days will include



  • Investigate and troubleshoot a world leading high-tech product on a very detailed level in the software and in our cloud servers.

  • Resolve client issues – such as software & hardware issues, network, user assistance

  • Compile bug reports and feature requests for development in Jira, work close with the developers

  • Even further enhance client satisfaction, by being an excellent communicator

  • Develop standard procedures and best practices

  • Foster constant exchange with remote team members in Paris and NY

  • Document knowledge in the form of knowledge base tech notes and articles

  • Customize client settings in our backoffice

  • Monitor our ticketing system and assist clients and colleagues

  • Administer all software licenses and SaaS accounts globally

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
At HTM we manage two hotels in the Niseko resort in Japan.  Our public face revolves around our Guest Booking Portals, our Agent Booking Portal and Owner's Portal.


These online portals need to to be attractive, informative, easy to use and up to date.  Currently they are not.


We are looking for a Web Developer to become a permanent part of our team, to work with us and guide us to make our public presence represent our hotels, resort and business: modern, professional and fun.


We have a great product, and good understanding of what we need to achieve and a solid back-end database.  But we can't write code (much).


If you are an experienced Web Developer keen to work on a fun, fast-moving, ongoing and challenging project, perhaps with an interest in Japan, skiing or a beautiful mountain location then read-on!


This role is available on a full-time employee basis for a Developer based in Niseko, or on a contract basis for a Developer working remotely (an initial 6-8 week period in Niseko would be required).

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
DIAKRIT has always been driven by the desire to revolutionize the way people conduct real estate business - to make the online search easier, more secure and more engaging.


We help people see the potential of their future living space with 3D functions and premium rich media that enables them to plan, furnish and decorate the home of their dreams. Our success has grown from a true entrepreneurial spirit. We constantly strive to challenge industry norms and surpass our customers’ expectations.


Our employees are our greatest assets. Their individual skills, tech-savviness, strong work ethic and service-mindedness are the main driving forces behind our long-lasting customer relationships with several of the biggest real estate players globally. We will continue to revolutionize the real estate market with innovative products and software by utilizing emerging technologies and platforms. Because we see the future and we believe in it – and we are fully convinced that the future looks even better than anyone can imagine.


DIAKRIT currently has customers in the United States, Canada, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Germany, Spain, Thailand, the Philippines, Malaysia, Hong Kong, and Australia, has over 450 employees globally and more than 250 freelance photographers throughout Scandinavia.



We need to strengthen our Development Team in Bangkok, Thailand and are now looking for a Front-end Developer to be part of our team to further develop our web products and systems.
The work tasks include development of existing products as well as managing your own development projects. You will also act as a 2nd line support for all front-end related issues in our Service Desk and you will report to our IT Manager & System Dev. Manager.


To fit into this role, you need to have a genuine interest and experience in working with front-end development. You enjoy working as a part of a team in an international environment and get challenged by developing the impossible. You are used to work toward tight deadlines, can manage several projects in different phases simultaneously.


You have a logical mindset and you see possibilities and solutions where other see problems. You are used to take own initiatives and work to improve things all the times. You will be part of a team of 10 employees as well as part of the entire IT/R&D department of approximately 20 staff.

jobs.title: Delivery Manager
jobs.content:
About the Position:

The role requires planning, initiation, and management of information technology projects of varying complexity.

  • Manage customer and internal stakeholders through all engagement phases (i.e. preparation, execution, and closure).
  • Drive project kickoffs and ensure customers deploy proprietary software applications successfully.
  • Meet with customers, users, prospects, partners, and industry analysts to communicate MuleSoft's vision of the market, product roadmap, and competitive differentiation.
  • Proactively identify and mitigate risks jointly with client.
  • Prepare project and customer reports by collecting and analyzing information.
  • Contribute project artifacts and methodology best practices to the team's knowledge base.
  • Utilize knowledge across of several of the following focus areas: Enterprise Integration technologies like Mule ESB or WebSphere Message Broker or DataPower or API gateway; Java/J2EE technologies; Tomcat or WebSphere Application Server; Service Oriented Architecture including SOAP and RESTful services; Oracle or SQL Server database management systems; and Project Management and Technology Lifecycle tools like JIRA or NetSuite Open Air or ScrumWorks or IBM RTC or MS TFS.
  • Supervise 2 subordinates.

About You:

  • Must have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, Information Systems Management, or closely-related IT field of study.
  • A qualified candidate must have at least 7 years of progressive, full-time experience in software design and/or development working with relevant tools and technologies including Java/J2EE, RESTful or SOAP web services, and DB management systems like Oracle or SQL Server.
  • A qualified candidate must have at least 3 years of experience working on large integration projects for multinational/Fortune 500 companies using Agile type project management tools like JIRA or NetSuite Open Air or IBM RTC or ScrumWorks or MS TFS, and enterprise integration projects involving software systems like Guidewire or WorkDay or SalesForce or related ERP systems (PeopleSoft, Siebel, Oracle, SAP).
  • All experience may be gained concurrently.

About Our Benefits:

  • Pre-IPO equity
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
  • 401(k) and pre-tax health care, dependent care and commuter benefits (FSA)
  • “No policy” vacation policy
  • Commute up the peninsula on the MuleSoft shuttle
  • Gym discounts and on-site yoga classes
  • Mac or PC
  • Fully stocked kitchen, regular catered lunches, weekly happy hours, family nights
  • Annual, all-company weeklong MeetUp trip for collaboration, learning and inspiration

About Us:

MuleSoft is an explosive-growth, well-funded company on a mission to connect the world's applications, data and devices. $593B is spent each year connecting applications, data and devices, and the challenge is growing dramatically with the explosion of cloud, big data, mobile and the Internet of Things.

We're "productizing" integration -- making it as easy to connect systems and companies as it is to connect with friends on Facebook. MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform™ enables companies to unlock the full potential of their applications and data through API-led connectivity, both on-premises and in the cloud, and our growth continues to accelerate. Our platform is used by organizations in over 60 countries, from emerging companies to Global 500 enterprises including Mastercard, Unilever, Tesla, Intuit, BSkyB and Verizon among others.

We're building a great company filled with exceptional people who challenge and inspire each other. MuleSoft is recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company and 2015 Best Place to Work by Glassdoor. If you want to have a big impact on our success, love working in high performing teams and have the track record to prove it, visit us at www.mulesoft.com/careers and check out our openings in San Francisco, New York, Atlanta, Buenos Aires, Sydney, Singapore, London, and more.

To all recruitment agencies: MuleSoft does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to MuleSoft employees or to any other company location. MuleSoft is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the company.

jobs.title: Customer Experience Agent
jobs.content:
At Slack, we consider Customer Experience essential to our success. We have a healthy roster of high-profile companies that rely on Slack for their day-to-day communication, and we want to provide the best service possible. Our Customer Experience team's top priority is to make our customers successful and ensure that their experience using Slack is a pleasant and productive one.

As a Customer Experience Agent for Slack, your task is to make our customers successful. This is a demanding role that requires a broad skillset. Not only will you be directly responsible for keeping Slack's customers happy and productive, but you will also spend time working with the development team to test new features before release. Your job is to ensure that Slack's customers have the best experience possible.

Responsibilities

  • Effectively resolve customer enquiries in a considerate and timely manner.
  • Compose thoughtful, personalized responses for a variety of customer requests.
  • Triage incoming requests and spot trends in customer issues to flag for the rest of the team.
  • Identify, reproduce, and document bugs for the engineering teams.
  • Assist the product development and QA teams by testing new features and bug fixes and surfacing customer feedback.
  • Make active contributions to help achieve team goals and successes.
  • Contribute to the ongoing learning and success of your team, and the company, by sharing knowledge through mentorship, collaboration, and aiding in documentation.

Requirements

  • You care deeply, genuinely and passionately about customer support and about the role it plays in making a customer-centric team successful.
  • You have prior experience in a similar role. You know that every bit of work you do makes a real difference in making a customer happy.
  • You understand the web and how it works. You're not necessarily writing and deploying your own JQuery-based, CSS-heavy responsive sites, but you're also not intimidated by the technology.
  • You know when something is over your head and are not afraid to ask for help. You are skilled at explaining technical problems succinctly and clearly.
  • You have a mastery of English and are a strong, confident, and exacting writer.
  • You exhibit diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through customer issues.
  • You have a post-secondary degree or equivalent professional experience.
  • You can work with us in our brand new Toronto office!

Bonus Points

  • You have experience providing email-centric customer support for a web-based application.
  • You have experience providing customer service in a dynamic startup environment.

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
The Role

Use your extensive knowledge of Objective-C and Swift to improve the Slack iOS app, a complex completely native application relied upon by hundreds of thousands of users every day. You will work with real-time data streams, engineer for performance across devices and delight people by making the best software we can imagine. You will collaborate closely with Product, Design and QA to spec, build, test and deploy new features. This position reports directly to the head of iOS Engineering.

A Typical Week

  • You'll brainstorm with Product Managers and Designers to conceptualize new features
  • You'll collaborate with backend engineers to build new features for our large-and-growing user base
  • You'll learn about new iOS technologies and discuss potential solutions to problems
  • You'll help our skilled support team triage bugs and troubleshoot production issues
  • You'll mentor other engineers and deeply review code

Requirements

  • Experience with Objective-C and Swift
  • Experience with modern iOS technologies
  • Experience building and debugging complex systems in a team environment
  • Expertise in building complex layouts with UIKit
  • Strong UI and design skills
  • Strong communication skills, a positive attitude and empathy
  • Self ­awareness and a desire to improve your skills

Bonus Points

  •  Academic background in computer science (BSc or MSc)
  •  Experience with CocoaPods and other major open source iOS projects
  •  Experience investigating and improving performance
  •  Experience with threading, Core Data, and networking
  •  Experience in small start­up environments
  •  Experience working with a team, especially a distributed team
  •  Professional experience designing applications

jobs.title: Senior Application Engineer
jobs.content:
The Role:

Slack is looking for Senior Application Engineers to build delightful features, design and implement useful API methods, and improve the reliability of our systems as we rapidly scale our product and organization.

We build our app using reliable tools that our team knows and trusts, including PHP, MySQL, and Linux.  Expertise in these areas is a huge plus, but having familiarity with other common web languages (such as Python or Ruby) and other relational databases are fine substitutes. We are looking for engineers that understand that simplicity and reliability are aspects of a system to be carefully calculated with every decision made.  We’re a collaborative team who genuinely enjoys working together to make Slack a better product.

This position is based in San Francisco and reports to one of our engineering managers.

If you were to join Slack, here are the kinds of things you would do over the course of a typical week:

  • Build a new feature, with unit tests, that can support our large-and-growing user base.
  • Whiteboard a fix to a scaling problem -- and then make it happen.
  • Talk with our frontend team to decide how an API method should work.
  • Collaborate with peers to write, review, or provide feedback on a technical design proposal.
  • Help our skilled support team triage and solve bugs.
  • Provide support to our operations staff in troubleshooting and addressing a production issue.
  • Contribute to internal tools that help us improve our development process, manage our users, and scale our systems.

Here are things that we consider critical to being an Senior Application Engineer:

  • You have curiosity about how things work.
  • You’ve been building web applications professionally for 3+ years and can point to things you’ve worked on.
  • You have experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java (used without frameworks).
  • You can lead technical architecture discussions and help drive technical decisions.
  • You can jump into situations with few guardrails and make things better.
  • You write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability.
  • You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you.
  • You enjoy helping onboard new team members, mentoring, and teaching others.
  • You know how the web works. You know HTTP and TCP/IP and what a good API looks like.
  • You possess strong computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, distributed systems, and information retrieval.
  • You also know that the internet is a scary place and understand security concepts deeply and can put them into action to protect us and our users.
  • You know how to build reliable and safe distributed systems and understand the tradeoffs made when engineering a feature.
  • When things break -- and they will -- you are eager and able to help fix things.
  • You are someone that others enjoy working with due to your technical competence and positive attitude.

Bonus Points:

  • Academic background in computer science (BSc or MSc)
  • Experience using PHP without a framework
  • Solid competency with SQL (ideally in a federated database environment; MySQL a plus) and browser technologies
  • Experience with SOLR, Redis, and Java
  • Prior experience with or knowledge of large scale, high volume systems
  • Experience in a startup environment

We are looking to hire the best engineers, whether remote or here in our Seattle office. Please include your location and salary requirements in your cover letter.

jobs.title: Scala, Go, JavaScript Software Engineer
jobs.content:
FoxCommerce is seeking a Scala, Go, and/or JavaScript Engineer with the hunger to be more than just a cog in a giant machine. We are growing FAST and are looking for talent that wants to grow with us. This is the perfect role for a technical leader that cares deeply about their craft. You’ll be a good fit if you want to contribute to a platform by writing excellent code, planning the architecture, collaborating with other engineers, and working to continually improve our approach to software development.

We are looking to hire the best engineers, whether remote or here in our Seattle office. Please include your location and salary requirements in your cover letter.

Writing excellent code on our core platform product Contributing to key architectural decisions Actively pair-programming with teammates when they need help Drive formal and informal code reviews Adopting best-practices in code structure and tool chain within the company

Ideal Characteristics
