Scala Haskell GoLang Node.js JavaScript

-You have an active interest in high-scale distributed systems -You're addicted to building performant applications -You're a team player and are willing to work in the front-end when or if needed -You’re always learning and challenge yourself in new and different ways

About Us

We’re a team of eCommerce junkies who are passionate about user experience. We are actively making eCommerce better for retailers and their customers. Our founders are eCommerce veterans and have built real companies with $200M+ in revenue and more than 400 employees.

We’re a highly technical organization and nearly everyone in the company writes code. We’re a pragmatic, polyglot organization who pairs new technology with battle-tested systems to create modern and reliable applications. Our stack today includes Scala, React.js, PostgreSQL, and Kafka.

jobs.title: Engineer to platform team
jobs.content:
Engineer to join our Platform Team
Do you feel motivated about making complex things simple? Do you want to demonstrate your skills in the most used cloud based accounting platform in Denmark?
If yes, then read on.
e-conomic is growing and we still need talented people to join our exciting journey. This time, we are looking for an Engineer to join our Platform Team.

As a person, we expect you to…



  •       Be self-motivated

  •       Have strong developer skills

  •       Have MS SQL Knowledge

  •       Have a DevOps mind-set

  •       Show willingness to take ownership

  •       Contribute to our good team chemistry

  •       Have strong customer focus


Your responsibilities
You will be part of our Platform Team that is responsible for leading the design and evolution of our platform. That involves both long term planning to take our developer experience to the next level as well as strong urge to automate all things repeated. You will have a high degree of influence on your daily tasks, and you will be expected to take an active part in identifying your own tasks and set an example for how things are done best. If you are not comfortable refactoring legacy code and writing tests this job is not for you.


What can we offer you?



  •       As many challenges as you want

  •       App. 40 developers

  •       Social activities

  •       Strong customer focus

  •       A possibility to make a change

  •       The chance to work for a major player in Nordic countries

  •       Large customer base (100K +)

  •       Highly instrumented platform

  •       A platform that isn't just in maintenance mode

  •       Cloud platform

  •       A prime location in the Copenhagen Harbour


So who are we?
e-conomic resides on Christianshavn in central Copenhagen and is part of Visma. We build and design the cloud based accounting system e-conomic.dk that helps more than 100,000 happy companies run their business. We are 170 employees from 20+ nationalities.


The development department consists of 40+ people, including Product Owners, QA engineers and UX designers, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB.


We serve more than 50 million requests a day, push to production several times a week, love to talk about (and write) code, believe strongly in automation, and are driven by a desire to measure and monitor in order to constantly improve our product.


If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact hiring manager Rasmus Beck on +45 4011 1772 or on rbb@e-conomic.com.

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Hello, future addition to Customer.io! Weâre looking forward to getting to know you better, but you probably want to know what youâre getting yourself into. You can check out our careers page, or read on.

At Customer.io, our mission is to help businesses talk like people. Today, we do this with messaging software that allows businesses with large user-bases to send targeted, more relevant communication at scale. Our customers include Trello, Shutterstock, Handy, and Watsi.

A day in the life of a Technical Support Engineer
A Technical Support Engineer at Customer.io helps new and existing customers get up and running in our product, diagnose tricky situations in the product, and achieve their business goals. Our customers are core to everything we do (itâs in our name!) and a Technical Support Engineer has contact with more customers than anyone else in the company.

While support tickets may take most of your day, youâll also work on internal and external documentation and have regular touch points with our Product and Customer Success teams to discuss feature requests, usability issues and user scenarios. Youâll bring your passion for customers and their problems to advocate for product improvements and provide insight that will help us make sure we build the right thing.

Technical Support Engineers develop deep product, systems and customer knowledge. In the long run there are opportunities to apply this knowledge to automate processes, create internal tools or assist our Customer Success and Sales team when technical needs arise. We have many new features to build and ideas to implement, so there will be plenty of exciting challenges ahead.

Tools We Use
Today our Technical Support is powered by Help Scout for tickets, JIRA for bug tracking and Zapier to help automate some of our support processes. We also use some internally built command line tools for problem diagnosis. 

Although, we mostly interact with each other through Basecamp and Slack and value focused work, weâre not afraid to jump on a Screenhero pairing session or a video call to clarify customer scenarios or share tips on how to troubleshoot issues better.

Weâre the right match for you if
  • You love technical problem solving
  • You enjoy helping others with your technical knowledge and take pride in your work.
  • You see every support ticket as an opportunity to improve the customer experience.
  • You take ownership of delivering results and get satisfaction from getting things done.
  • Youâre passionate about learning new things.
  • Youâre not afraid to ask questions if youâre confused about how something works.
  • You understand written communication is not always perfect and assume the best intentions during interactions with customers and your team. Empathy is one of your strongest attributes.
What we look for:
  • At least 2 years customer support experience.
  • Experience working remotely (itâs not your first time holding a full-time or part-time remote job).
  • Comfortable troubleshooting HTML & CSS
  • Basic programming skills and knowledge of the core concepts (Boolean logic, using APIs, control structures,  etc).If you know Javascript - even better!
  • Experience working with or supporting email marketing/ business communication tools preferred.
  • Located in the United States/ Canada or willing to work US Eastern hours.
Why should you work with Customer.io?
We want to enable you to do the best work of your professional life, and this is how we aim to do that:

Salary: This role has a starting salary of $70,000 per year.
Equity: Youâll own a piece of the company. It's not a get-rich-quick deal, but if you stay around for a while, we're planning to be a long-lasting company, and your piece of it may be a nice bonus.
Big impact: Our team is small, but growing quickly. The work you do will materially impact how successful we are as a company, both with our product and our culture. 

Great tools: Everyone in the company has a budget for a great computer, motorized standing desk, Steelcase Leap office chair, external monitor, and anything else you'd like to get your job done.
Health benefits: We pay 100% of your premiums for medical, dental and vision.
Retreats: We want everyone in our company to connect in person whenever possible, so we get everyone together once a year. We've had retreats in Barcelona, Romania, and Hunter Mountain, NY.
Vacation: Rest and recuperation are important. We offer unlimited paid time off with a two week minimum per year.
Diversity at Customer.io

At Customer.io, weâre committed to building a diverse environment, and encourage minority applicants. So far, we have team members in Scotland, Germany, Canada, and all over the US. Our CEO and CTO grew up in Singapore and Arkansas respectively, but met in New York City. Our company culture is always evolving; people from different backgrounds bring valued perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture we foster.

Customer.io provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Customer.io complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Basically, we follow the law, but also like you for who you are!

Intrigued? Talk to us!

To apply: Apply through our jobs site: http://grnh.se/yn5stv, and make sure you tell us why youâre interested in the position! Weâve added a few questions that will also help us understand how you think.

jobs.title: Full-stack Rails Developer
jobs.content:
TL;DR: W-2 Full-time Rails position developing a product you will be proud of with a team that will help you thrive anywhere you want in the U.S. 

What is Kolau

Kolau is a SaaS that is building the marketing of tomorrow - and itâs doing it today. 

96% of all businesses have 0-9 employees and Kolauâs is their solution to rank in the 1st page of Google. Why? They have no time to do it, knowledge to do it right or money to pay marketing agencies, thus Kolau. Simple, quick, effortless, Kolau.

Weâre a distributed team, working remotely in the United States and overseas. The engineering team works from the U.S.

Our backend tools are fairly standard - Rails, Postgres, Redis, Rspec, Sidekiq, AWS & Heroku.

What you would be working on? 

With Kolau, we are building a platform that makes it easier for anybody with a website and without any time or marketing knowledge to have it ranking on the 1st page of the search results. Kolau is not just software, though. We have an amazing tech support team that is available in case users need some extra assistance and are as much a part of the Kolau product, success and experience as the platform itself.

Whom are we looking for?

  • Rails developer with a strong sense of commitment and reliability
  • Strong background in Ruby on Rails - ideally 3+ years
  • Fast learner who thrives in a fast-paced environment
  • A developer who is passionate about simple and intuitive solutions
  • Exerience with SaaS development and API development preferred
  • Sound knowledge of SQL and relational databases

Kolau Perks

  • Competitive salary: Competitive compensation package based on experience and location.
  • Wellness: Health insurance and gym membership coverage.
  • Opportunity: Ground floor opportunity to shape the direction of the company
  • Getaways: Company retreat around the world 1x year - Barcelona, anyone?
  • Tech: Brand new Mac Pro and $250 stipend for anything that helps you be more productive
  • Continuing Education: $250 for anything youâd like to learn. Also, we ship a new book monthly within your category of interest!

To apply: Please apply here: https://kolau-carrers.workable.com/jobs/334286Impress us with your involvement in the development community, GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, blog, or anything else that shows us who you are and why you want to work in Kolau.

jobs.title: Rails Dev (fight cancer, improve young adult health, integrate everything)
jobs.content:
We are looking for a developer to help us build excellent web-based applications and mobile apps. In return, we want to help you put the right mix of the right work into the Big Picture of your life.

We work with great clients on fun projects. A few examples of current work include:
  • Building an interface for a causal inference model built by leading bioinformatics researchers to provide personalized identification of cancer drivers.
  • Working with a world-class clinical care team to build an app / messaging system to help guide young adults to good health using a machine learning-based recommender system.
  • Launching an e-commerce integration product (flowlink.io) that allows online retailers to easily automate many of their most tedious tasks.
NuRelm provides a wide range of experience, plenty of room for professional growth, a fun workplace, and an environment everyone on the team is valued. We are looking for a smart person who loves the Web, loves to learn, and enjoys working on a variety of technologies and projects.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Very comfortable with Rails, MySQL, Git (2 to 5 years min).
  • Experienced building and consuming RESTful APIs.
  • Experienced working with and on Linux/Unix operating systems.
  • Good understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3/SASS in the Rails environment.
  • Habits that include test-driven development and an agile project approach
  • Experienced assembling projects from the ground up, and the eye for architecture and planning that goes with that.
  • A North American time zone and strong English communication skills (we have a local team in Pittsburgh, but also work with remote developers).
  • Please, no recruiters or firms offering subcontracting.

BONUS POINTS
  • Experienced with Sinatra, MongoDB, React JS, AWS.
  • Familiarity with MVC and prototyping.
  • Experienced with working remotely.
  • Know your way around Docker and typical stacks such as Rails / Unicorn / Nginx.
  • Familiar and willing to do an occasional project with PHP.

A FEW BENEFITS
  • Excellent medical, vision, and dental insurance
  • Retirement plan with employer matching
  • New hires start with 3 weeks of vacation
  • Competitive compensation
  • A fun, compassionate, smart, and diverse team

To apply: Please note that we are firm on the requirements from above that we are not looking for recruiters or firms offering subcontracting, and that we are seeking applicants with a North American time zone.To apply, please submit a brief cover letter and a resume to humanresources at nurelm.com.

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced systems engineer to help us scale our infrastructure for Postmark, Beanstalk, and DeployBot.  It's a big role to fill and requires broad knowledge of software and infrastructure. You'll have direct impact on how we define and build our systems. We consider performance and service availability a primary feature of every product we offer. Your work will ensure that tens of thousands of developers can successfully build on top of our services with confidence and peace of mind. 

Your role on the team

We run a fully managed environment of bare metal hardware and virtualized servers hosted in one of the most advanced data centers in the midwest (with ServerCentral). Our infrastructure is made up of a variety of server configurations (mostly Supermicro and Juniper), including all SSD storage and 10GbE networking.

You will help design and maintain the infrastructure for our products. This includes capacity planning of hardware and network as well as building the infrastructure to bring up new services. This might range from designing faster ways to provision servers to improving shared services like monitoring, logging, DNS, and IPAM. 

Our application developers are heavily involved in running and understanding the systems that our products are built upon. You will work directly with the team to help automate, provision, and scale the services that support our customers. 

For example, we are currently expanding to new data centers. You would help define how we automate provisioning across each data center while keeping network, security, monitoring and services consistent. This expansion is critical to lowering latency and increasing availability for our customers.

As part of the systems team you will be responsible for:

  • Infrastructure design decisions from network, to hardware, to data center vendors. 
  • Improving the automation framework that allows us to provision new services for our products. 
  • Working with the team to automate services and infrastructure (Ansible).
  • Interacting with hardware and data center vendors directly on purchasing decisions for increasing capacity.
  • Coordinating maintenance or updates between developers and operations.
  • Coordinating with data center on new servers or networking changes.
  • Emergency incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts.
  • Writing and updating internal documentation of systems and processes.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years in an operations role
  • Ability to maintain common applications such as nginx, memcached, MySQL, DHCP, NTP, SSH, DNS.
  • Some experience managing Windows servers (Postmark run on C#)
  • Familiar with network design for larger scale projects (IPAM, VLANS). 
  • Ability to drive architectural design decisions, solve technical problems, and make improvements to our processes.
  • Comfortable with database administration (we use MySQL, Elasticsearch, and Redis)
  • Ability to define physical server specs (but not building them).
  • Extensive knowledge of the Linux operating system.
  • Experience working on critical, highly available web applications and APIs (redundancy, load balancing, automation).
  • Familiar with automation tools such as Ansible.

Bonus points:

  • Experience with ZFS
  • Understanding of SMTP and Postfix

Benefits:

  • Full health benefits
  • Company-paid retreats
  • Computer of your choice, renewed every 2 years
  • 25 paid days off per year
  • Quarterly profit sharing
  • Attend conferences
  • Quiet Fridays
  • 40 hour work week with flexible hours

To apply: First, meet the team and learn more about us at http://wildbit.com. We've had a remote culture since we started in 2000 and it is a core part of the company. Our team always comes first, so it's important that our values match. If you think it is good fit, please apply at https://wildbit.workable.com/jobs/253343/candidates/new. We're looking forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Aerospike Architect
jobs.content: Revcontent in currently seeking a Sr. Aerospike Architect to join our team. Revcontent is the fastest growing Native Advertising network in the world serving over 200 BILLION content recommendations a month. This position is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a very talented team and contribute to the development of a world-class organization. As a Sr. Aerospike Architect, you will contribute to the system development and optimization. You will assist deployment and operation of high-availability, high-performance web applications using Aerospike.

jobs.title: Director Of Traffic Operations
jobs.content:
At Twilio our customer’s traffic is our business.  Maintaining the Twilio quality expectation for both voice and messaging takes a lot of work. This role leads the global Traffic Operations team responsible for managing Twilio’s customers traffic to our carrier partners around the globe.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and grow a globally distributed team of passionate people & provide support and guidance that enables the team to self-organize and achieve sustained high velocity and predictability.  

  • Own, operate and maintain Twilio’s traffic operations.  Employ metric-driven data to monitor, operate and scale our global traffic profile ensuring consistent quality & deliverability of our customers’ traffic.

  • Institute distributed systems best practices, automation, and a software-first mindset throughout the team.

  • You will lead the team in incident management and the dialogue with our carriers to build resiliency.

  • Collaborate on roadmaps with other teams and stakeholders to drive direction and priorities, both strategic and tactical.

  • Provide leadership for the team & be a thought leader on traffic management.

  • Define tooling and automation business requirements for metric-based traffic management.

  • Guide employee career development by providing coaching and mentoring to junior members while coaching senior contributors to maximize their potential.  Write performance evaluations, collaborate with employees on their objectives and provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans.  

  • As a member of the Engineering Management team, foster leadership principles and behaviors throughout the organization to groom the next generation of leaders.

jobs.title: Ingénieur DevOps
jobs.content:
Capable de mettre au service de l’automatisation de fonctions opérationnelles une vraie culture de génie logiciel, votre attention pour les détails et votre soif d’apprendre vous permettront de contribuer à l’évolution et à l’industrialisation de l’infrastructure IT d’AdaCore.


Supportée par une ferme de production et de test d’une centaine de machines, localisées dans nos data centers de Paris (France), New York et Lexington (Etats-Unis) celle-ci comprend, autour d’un noyau de machines GNU/Linux, la diversité d’environnements physiques ou virtualisés (Windows, UNIX propriétaires, RTOS comme VxWorks, LynxOS, PikeOS, Android, boards...) nécessaires au support de nos produits.  


Votre rôle sera d’augmenter le degré d’automatisation de cette infrastructure dans une perspective d’industrialisation des process. Vous interviendrez aussi dans la mise en place de  plan de continuité d'activité et de plan de reprise d’activité afin de renforcer la disponibilité des services IT d’AdaCore.


Plus concrètement, vos tâches pourront notamment inclure :



  • La conception et développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités dans l’infrastructure de construction et de validation des produits logiciels (fermes de build, continuous builders, serveurs de test …) ;

  • L’amélioration de l’outillage de gestion de l’infrastructure IT existant (monitoring, alerte, gestion à distance ...) ;

  • La conception et l’implémentation de nouvelles fonctionnalités de déploiement automatique ;

  • La surveillance opérationnelle des systèmes IT ;

  • La gestion de l’infrastructure IT (recherche des besoins des utilisateurs, interactions avec les achats, provisionnement, déploiement et gestion du cycle de vie des éléments de l’infrastructure ...).


Vous serez un membre de l’équipe IT, qui comprend une quinzaine de personnes situées à Paris, New York et Boston. Votre poste sera situé à Paris.

jobs.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
About Muzooka:


Muzooka is a set of web based tools integrated with Facebook for both artists and live music venues. Muzooka has been featured amongst the likes of TechCrunch, Betakit, Billboard and MTV. Muzooka is currently focused on expanding their platform that connects the live music industry.


Muzooka values teamwork, creativity and optimism. We foster a culture of learning and development where we all strive to improve and innovate together. Muzooka offers flexible work schedules, competitive salaries, options pool and the opportunity to work on a product that will change the state of the music industry.


Job Description:


In this role you will lead our backend development and build Muzooka's API to drive the success of our web and mobile applications. You will also get to contribute on the front-end using cutting edge tools. You'll work closely with our front-end development team to ensure we are building a maintainable code base and minimizing technical debt. Our designer and product manager will coordinate with you on a daily basis to plan features for the API. You'll have the opportunity to wear multiple hats and play a key role in product development.


Skills Needed:



  • Foundation in Javascript

  • Familiarity with AWS deployment

  • Proficient with mySQL

  • Experience with Node.js

  • Experience with a JS framework like React or Ember

  • Experience with Git workflow

  • General understanding of front-end development 


What else we are looking for:



  • You're a good programmer and have a drive to create clean, reliable and maintainable software

  • You know what a good API looks like

  • You're a strong communicator; explaining complex technical concepts to designers, support, and other engineers is no problem for you

  • You can pivot directions quickly when needed

  • You have a desire to iterate constantly

  • You have a passion for constant learning

  • You're hands on and like to be involved in all areas of a company

  • You have a positive attitude and are always willing to lend a hand

  • You love working in a fast-paced, start-up environment

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1 bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.

Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Senior Front-End Engineer (f/m)


Do you feel like the work you do makes a difference and moves the business in a meaningful way? Are you interested in building software used by millions of customers? Do you like writing performant, high quality code at a rapid pace? If you answered yes to these questions, you could be just the person we’re looking for to join our team at Home24.

We are looking for a  great Senior Frontend Engineer who is passionate about developing customer-facing front end solutions that will deliver a great user experience - whether you’re on your smartphone, tablet or home computer. In joining our team you will get the opportunity to work on some of the most interesting and challenging problems we can offer. This position is full-time and based in our cool office in Berlin.


Responsibilities



  • Build beautiful, fast,efficient and reusable front-end solutions

  • Build prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate emerging technologies

  • Working with product managers and UX designers to implement the next generation of the Home24 e-commerce experience

  • Use RESTful APIs for communication with our backend services

  • Work in a small agile team collaborating with designers and other engineers

  • Identify and adopt best practices for software and front-end engineering

  • Make demos for the whole company to share achievements


What we can offer you



  • Opportunity to use state of the art front end development tools

  • Become a part of a highly motivated world class team of technology professionals

  • An open culture to learn, share new ideas, solve hard problems and opportunity to demonstrate your creativity to make a real difference

  • Opportunities for advancement, independence and the autonomy to take on responsibility

  • Benefits including relocation support, employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and much more

  • If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, get in touch. Send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, etc.), a code sample as well as your expected salary and possible start date.



Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer
jobs.content:
Home24 is Europe’s largest online destination for home furniture and decor. Being a dynamic, fast-growing market leader, our goal is to consistently provide our customers with the best service and assortment. Backed by well-known investors, we are among the top 20 of Europe’s fastest growing e-commerce companies and with a valuation of USD 1bn one of the most attractive and highly valued opportunities in tech.


Home24 is currently active in 8 countries in Europe and Latin America. We employ more than 1,000 people worldwide and are looking to expand our team with dedicated top talents and experts who are ready to grow with us. Our dynamic and international team works with great passion and enthusiasm towards a great goal: To revolutionize the Home & Living market.


Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:


Senior Network & Monitoring Engineer (f/m)


Responsibilities



  • Ensure our global network infrastructure fulfills our goals of availability, scalability and performance

  • Design, implement, support, maintain and enhance enterprise grade network, Firewall, IPS and monitoring solutions for future growth and projects

  • Proactive monitoring and maintenance of the infrastructure to prevent potential outages (NOC)

  • Analysis and troubleshooting of incidents across the whole stack incl. root cause analysis

  • Automate and improve network configuration deployment and change management

  • Implement robust security measures with well-designed security-concepts

  • Research on new technologies to improve performance and availability of our mission critical infrastructure

  • Create and update network and monitoring documentation


Requirements



  • 5+ years of experience in designing, operating, monitoring and troubleshooting an enterprise grade HA network environment incl. Firewall management (HP, Cisco, WatchGuard)

  • 5+ years of experience in managing monitoring solutions (Nagios, check_MK, OMD)

  • Deep understanding of network protocols, topologies and diagnostics across the whole OSI model

  • Strong experience with VPN protocols and solutions (IPSEC, DMVPN, SSL-VPN, OpenVPN)

  • Hands on experience in managing a Linux server environment

  • Experience with Amazon Web services (esp. VPC, EC2, CloudFormation, CloudWatch) is a plus

  • Proven organization, problem solving, and analytical skills

  • Certifications in Cisco CCNP , Juniper JNCIP/SP , CCISP or other data communication certifications

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, also natural sciences possible


What we offer you



  • High-end computers (tower/laptop) with SSD hard disk, 16G of memory and 4 Xeon 3,X Ghz + 2x 24 inch screens

  • Skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us

  • Opportunities for advancement – independence and the opportunity to take on responsibility

  • A highly motivated team of senior system engineers

  • Openness to new ideas and creativity

  • Benefits as employee discount, team events, free fruit, drinks and more


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date.


Home24 AG | Greifswalder Straße 212-213 | 10405 Berlin | Contact: Sophie Fahning

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Analytics Team at Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a developer. Join our team of engineers and and help us curate the data generated by the world's largest collaborative project: Wikipedia.


Summary


We are the Analytics Team at Wikimedia Foundation - engineers organizing data generated by the world's largest collaborative project and one of the largest websites in the world.  We protect privacy, share data, build APIs for the community, and help our product teams understand what to focus on.


We use open source tools as much as possible, and always open source our own work(https://gerrit.wikimedia.org).  Python, Java, Scala and Javascript make up most of our code, but we value using the right tool for the job.  Our world is vast and can be complicated, so we value communication, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn more than certificates.


We’d like you to do these things:   



  • Work and communicate effectively within a small team of five distributed across 3 time zones

  • Assist developers and community members in identifying and resolving issues with the software and configuration of Wikimedia's analytics infrastructure

  • Work on complete features to be used internally or externally by the foundation or the community

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HLT builds apps using modern web and mobile technologies, such as Objective-C, Swift, Java and Ruby on Rails. We operate as a highly collaborative team organized around an agile framework. As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get the opportunity to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most elegant and valuable educational products to life. You should be comfortable with the above-mentioned technologies and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Designing & developing Objective-C and/or Swift applications

  • Developing and improving all aspects of our applications (development, testing, deployment, architecture)

  • Writing client-side apps that make use of RESTful APIs

  • Writing elegant and maintainable code; a feature isn't done until it's been tested

  • Writing automated unit tests and UI tests

  • Providing technical support of applications when issues occur

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Hey there… we’ve got a spot for someone who can talk to computers. I mean… REALLY and TRULY speak their language(s), and work with them. Thus, further bridging the gap between humankind and computers; so that united we can create amazing, beautiful and well-built user experiences.

If you possess this gift, we’re hoping you’ll join us.

The H&H Way

We work pretty damn hard to be the best . We pride ourselves on our team members who day in and day out develop creative, logical and well designed solutions for our clients. We strive to maintain a great work culture and are always pushing the limits of our work.

  • Got ideas? Let’s hear ‘em!
  • Wanna innovate? Let’s do it together!
  • Want to expand your knowledge? Let’s learn from one another, or learn together!
  • Want to get out of the studio and work remote? Do your thang!

We have a variety of clients with a variety of needs, so you won’t be doing the same thing day in and day out. It’s chill here, even though we get our hustle on. No big “corporate” pressure here. We have a culture and lifestyle that we live by. Design, technology and innovation is all around us, waiting to be shared. We love what we do

Now, let’s get to the point: We’re looking for a developer with full-stack experience, however, strength in front-end web development is expected. A strong grasp and experience withhandling data, problem-solving and modern frameworks is a must.

Personal/Professional Qualities:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Self-motivated and creative with a strong sense of accountability
  • Proven debugging, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • Attention to detail and ability to work within and hit fixed deadlines

Technical Requirements:

  • Experience with building HTML, CSS, JavaScript web experiences
  • Familiar with modern JS frameworks ( jQuery, Backbone, Kraken.js, Ampersand.js etc… ) with a desire and ability to learn new technologies
  • Familiar with CSS preprocessors: Less, Sass
  • Modern front-end workflow using Grunt, NPM and Browserify
  • Experience with some server side technologies ( Node.js/Python )
  • Experience working with GIT, SVN and working in teams
  • Solid understanding of OOP, relational databases, and SQL for implementing database-driven, web-based applications
  • A strong understanding of usability, accessibility, security and privacy within the digital realm i.e. eCommerce
  • Experience translating designs and wireframes into semantically correct templates ( HTML, Jade, Handlebars . Knowledge of responsive and adaptive design.

Bonus:

  • Experience interacting with third-party APIs and Web Services ( REST/SOAP )
  • Strong working knowledge developing cross platform/browser compatibility (IE, Firefox, Safari, Opera, etc.) for dynamic web applications
  • Familiarity with and adherence to web standards and best practices for load time reduction and accessibility
  • Familiarity with other CMS based frameworks such as WordPress

jobs.title: NoSQL Database Engineer
jobs.content:
The way we do business


We build our software incrementally, iteratively, and continuously, so you’ll be able to see new work go live to over four million visitors around the globe every week. Our flavour of agile has been heavily influenced by XP and Kanban, and if something isn’t working, we change it.
Our work delivers value to both the business and our customers, our teams are cross-discipline: business analysts and the user experience team work with stakeholders to coordinate research and understand requirements, whilst our frontend developers and software engineers pair with quality analysts to develop the most robust solutions, and our platform engineers work across the organisation to ensure our infrastructure never lets us down.


We generally follow a mix of agile and lean practices with an overall philosophy towards continuous delivery. We’ll rely on each and everyone´s expertise to adapt and improve these processes to serve the team, project and company as best fits their current contexts.
Although we don’t face the same level of stress you’d find in most projects around scope, schedule and cost, keeping the project on track is still important to us and wherever possible we’ll keep projects small, fast and healthy.


The team supports large number of databases in a rapidly evolving and dynamic environment.
You will have an opportunity to work on the database technologies such as Cassandra, Couchbase, ElasticSearch, Solr, MarkLogic, MongoDB, Redis, Stardog, etc.
You will use existing and create new automation tools, will improve them to manage a large number of servers.
You will be working closely with other Database Engineers who specialise in various other database technologies and database infrastructure management tools and frameworks.


In detail you would be responsible for:



  • Automating management of new and existing databases to ensure that processes are repeatable and scalable.

  • Participating in maintenance, upgrades and migrations.

  • Reviewing and planning hardware capacity to ensure database systems are responsive and stable.

  • Taking an active role in supporting and in finding the root cause of operational issues and prevent them from reoccurring

  • Visiting other offices and collaborate with the platform engineering, development and other teams

jobs.title: Software Engineer (Python and Go)
jobs.content:
The Sensible Code Company design and sell products that turn messy information into valuable data.

Weâre looking for a software engineer who:

  • Wants to build successful, high quality products;
  • Cares about customer experience;
  • Is good at communicating with technical and non-technical people.

The Sensible Code Company makes PDFTables.com which uses AI algorithms to turn PDFs into spreadsheets. We make QuickCode.io which is a Python and R data analysis environment, for people who are new to coding (it used to be called ScraperWiki).

We have customers all over the world (from Costa Rica to China!), and particularly work with governmental organisations like the United Nations, Office for National Statistics and Cabinet Office. We participate in research projects with European Universities.

Youâll be responsible for:

  • Understanding customer needs and designing ways of solving them;
  • Full stack software development;
  • Pushing projects as a whole to reach âdone doneâ;
  • Participating and leading project meetings.

Your skills are:

  • Believe in good software engineeringâââfrom unit tests to pull requests;
  • Comfortable with Unix systems administration and devops;
  • Have strong presenting and writing skills in public and private;
  • Like Agile, but more because of the original manifesto, not the hype;
  • Have delivered projects using Agile methods or would be happy to learn.

Facts about The Sensible Code Company:

  • We use lots of Go, Python, Docker and more
  • You can work remotely, or at our office in Liverpool
  • Weâve a generous 30 days holiday

To apply: To apply, send the following:1) A sample of code youâve written which either scrapes the web or calls an API2) Your CVTo jobs@sensiblecode.io, quoting swjob17 in the subject line (no agencies).

jobs.title: Senior Agile Test Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Agile Test Engineer who will be part of a development organisation where being agile is essential in the process of technological upgrading and building new platforms.   


You will participate in moving the test environment and testing as a discipline from a low to a professional maturity level in our organisation.   


The position we offer


As Senior Agile Test Engineer you will be responsible for the test of IT solutions: initially identifying and subsequently defining the required tests, monitoring the test coverage and evaluating the overall quality experienced.   


Typical tasks will be:   



  • Develop strategies for test area  

  • Building smart and efficient test code  

  • Test strategy framework  

  • Automating test code  

  • Define test scenarios and challenge business on requirements  

  • Test Planning  


You are expected to participate as part of a development team and participating in decomposition, estimating and automation of testing of user stories.   


In FRC IT we are servicing the Middle Office function in the capital Markets value chain. We are in the process of replacing legacy PL SQL based batch jobs with an event driven intraday architecture, using big data tools. We have also started to work agile in the last few years and are still on the journey.   


As part of this transformation it is vital that we build in the right test frameworks and methodology in our future platforms, as well as aggressively automating test.

jobs.title: Test Engineers
jobs.content:
We have two Cyber Innovation Centre's in the UK, Manchester and Gloucester. Gloucester has been open since late 2014 and we are looking to open our Manchester site over the coming months. We have a variety of roles available in both locations so please do not hesitate to get in touch for more information.


Who are we…


We are a prime contractor and major supplier to the UK Ministry of Defence and have developed strong capabilities in mission systems integration in defence, national security and commercial markets.


At Raytheon, innovation means helping to protect people, information and critical resources across the globe. We continue to develop game changing technologies that help make the world a safer place.


About the roles…  



This is a fantastic opportunity to join Raytheon UK in our rapidly growing Cyber Innovation Team based in either Gloucester or Manchester.


We have a number of vacancies at in our rapidly growing Test & Integration Team. We develop software using an Agile/Scrum methodology and you will be involved fully in the software development lifecycle, working closely with the developers in an integrated team environment.


Working for Raytheon you will be part of a growing team, working alongside world class partner organizations. Raytheon supports on-going professional development through both formal and on-the-job training to help you further develop your career and develop your management and leadership potential.



Main duties of the position: 


Basic Objective: Performing activities associated with integration, system and customer acceptance test phases of the system development lifecycle

Key Responsibilities:



  • Apply test skills and experience within the context of an Agile software development team

  • Defining test environment and tool requirements

  • Create and manage automated test scripts

  • Create and perform test manual test scripts

  • Contribute to the production of test strategies and plans

  • Report on status of test execution

  • Record defects/test issues and support the wider development team in their resolution.

  • Support the development team at formal and artifact reviews as necessary



What we are looking for… 


Required: DV Clearance or the ability to gain the clearance 



 Skills in some or all of the following:



  • Understanding of the Systems Engineering lifecycle, and demonstrable application of relevant Test methodologies and toolsets

  • Experience of deploying and configuring complex software under Linux.

  • Requirement verification and validation for software based systems

  • Test specification development

  • Test script preparation

  • Experience of Automated Test Tools such as Selenium, Cucumber



Additional desirable skills or experience:



  • Experience Working in an Agile/SCRUM/DevOps delivery model

  • Knowledge of developing in a high level language such as C++/Java

  • Experience of Continuous Integration

  • Experience of scripting languages; Python, Perl

  • Understanding of virtualization (e.g. VMWare and Hyper-V)

  • Linux system administration skill



Key Behaviours:



  • Good interpersonal skills for customer and partner liaison

  • Good written and oral communication skills

  • Good time management, organization and prioritization skills

  • An inquisitive mind and a desire to promote innovation

  • A desire to learn and constantly expand your horizons

  • Ability to work closely with others in a small team

  • Ability to work under pressure

  • High degree of initiative and flexibility

  • Willingness to travel if required



What we can offer you… 


 On-going development, with formal and on-the-job training, alongside the following benefits:



  • Annual bonus + for this division an additional bonus for maintaining the highest level of government security clearance

  • Early finish on Fridays (37 hour week)

  • 25 days holiday + statutory holidays

  • Contributory Pension Scheme

  • Life Assurance

  • Flexible Benefits; such as buy/sell holiday, childcare vouchers, cycle to work, Gymflex and more

  • Enhanced sick pay scheme

    •  


Diversity: 


Diversity is a core business imperative at Raytheon. We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes inclusiveness and always employs the best professionals for the job. Having a diverse workforce allows Raytheon to draw upon a range of different ideas and experiences which supports growing our business and creates an environment where everyone has an equal opportunity for success. 


Security:


All successful applicants must be eligible & willing to obtain a SC clearance with the view to progressing to DV level which would be sponsored by Raytheon UK. For further information on the criteria to obtain this please visit - https://www.gov.uk/security-vetting-and-clearance

jobs.title: Video Project Manager
jobs.content:
TravelClick offers world-class reservations solutions, business intelligence products and comprehensive media and internet marketing solutions to 38,000 hotel clients in over 160 countries globally, with 1000+ employees operating out of offices in New York, Barcelona, Melbourne, Singapore, Chicago, Atlanta and Orlando. We help our clients generate revenue and build their brands by providing the tools to make better business decisions, generate demand from the right mix of distribution channels and convert more shoppers into high-value guests.

Our award-winning web solutions business provides hosted websites and digital marketing services to thousands of hotels around the world. Our track record of innovation and performance has earned us and our clients over 360 website design awards since 2007 from the IMA, W3, WebAwards, Davey, and the HSMAI Adrian Awards.

Video Project Manager

Location: Orlando, FL
Department: 808 TVS Production
Position Type: Full time

Description

Job Summary

TravelClick Video Solutions (TVS) is the leading online video marketing agency for hotels, leveraging rich video content to drive more direct reservations through the hotelier’s website.

The Video Project Manager is responsible for delivering compelling videos that provide potential hotel guests with a modern media experience that goes beyond basic details and entices more direct reservations in an ever competitive global travel market. The Video Project Manager is responsible for the completion of video projects and delivering the final production to the client’s satisfaction, within budget and on time.

As part of the Production Team, the Video Project Manager is responsible for the entire video production process, from scheduling to video approval. He/she acts independently to deliver high quality videos on time and to the customer’s satisfaction.

Functions

  • Manage client’s expectations and satisfaction at all times.
  • Ensure completion of video production project deliverables: managing schedules, meeting milestones, delivering within budget and ensuring creative and technical success.
  • Be a strong interface with internal departments (sales, marketing, post-production and IT), external suppliers (cameramen, video editors, motion designers, talents, make-up artist, stylist…) and clients.
  • Report on project milestones and provide status.
  • Develop TVS suppliers’ database, looking for new talents worldwide: cameramen, video editors, motion-designers, actors.
  • Negotiate budgets with suppliers.
  • Participate in the evolution of the video product.
  • Assist the Video Production Manager to develop an execution strategy.

Experience and Qualifications

We are looking for a strong performer with excellent communication skills and an appreciable understanding of typical business processes found in small corporations, ideally through prior project management in web and marketing areas.

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field
  • 1+ years of project management and/ or account management
  • Must be a strong performer with excellent communication skills
  • Must be goal oriented, self-driven, organized, and accuracy, with a strong level of autonomy.
  • Passion for customer satisfaction
  • Demonstrated project management skills, with direct responsibility for managing budget and schedule
  • Ability to work under operational pressure and act with sense of urgency
  • Negotiation skills
  • Ability to work with cross functional, international teams
  • Capacity to grasp technical details and learn new technologies
  • Strong sense of ethics and values
  • Possess strong written and oral communication skills
  • Knowledge and relationships within the Hospitality Industry is ideal, but not required
  • Multi-lingual is ideal, but not required
  • Exposure to video production (scheduling, camera settings, etc…) and post-production (editing, color management, encoding, etc…) is ideal, but not required
  • Partner efficiently with TVS professional video suppliers (cameramen, production agencies)

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone doesn’t cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


SOFTWARE ENGINEERING AT IMC:


We trade in the most competitive markets across the globe.  Our software makes millions of trading decisions daily.  We win by making better and faster decisions than our competition. As a software developer you’ll be working alongside traders to implement strategies which will challenge you to be creative with your implementation. You’ll need to timely produce high quality solutions meeting requirements and managing overall complexity of our systems. You’ll be working in a highly motivated team, controlling end-to-end product development.  We work in an environment where slight oversights can be extremely costly, while new features can be extremely profitable.  As a team we aim to balance the race to production with software quality and testability.  You’ll be placed in an environment consisting primarily of C++ and Java.  We have a build chain which has been designed around the concept of daily production releases.  A variety of systems and technologies keeps life interesting.


Upon joining you will be expected to manage your own time and tasks.  We rely on our developers to drive change by taking feedback from traders, and shaping that into an implementation.  Your ownership of the task continues until a working production release.  Our most successful developers comfortably work in any part of our stack.

jobs.title: Network Engineer
jobs.content:
Network Engineer


IMC financial markets – Where Technology drives Trading


Trading nowadays happens in a highly competitive technological landscape; the best trading idea alone does not cut it anymore. Instead, only the best trading ideas that are enabled via robust, scalable and fast technology win. 


Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and iterate and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you?


Role Description:


We are looking for a mid- to senior-level Network Engineer, who is passionate about all aspects of networking and gets a thrill out of designing, implementing and supporting high-performance networks.



You are a highly capable engineer with an appetite for accuracy, and are not afraid to go beyond the standard text-book concepts of networking. You thrive on working with your peers and cross-functional teams and are able to motivate and encourage your colleagues around you. Ability to clearly communicate - both verbally and written - technical concepts and challenges to both technical and non-technical stakeholders is a must.



The Network Engineers in the Trading Infrastructure team at IMC are responsible for designing, implementing and supporting the WAN, LANs and all low-latency connectivity to trading venues. They work closely with our Systems Engineers, other teams and external parties to provide best in class infrastructure solutions supporting our trading business.


Primary responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and support the European networking infrastructure. Key areas include Low-latency networking, Unicast and Multicast routing, OSPF, BGP, PIM SM, as well as things like QoS, STP, NAT, protocol tuning, etc.

  • Monitor, guard and analyze the proper functioning of our network infrastructure. Take adaptive, retentive and corrective measures and perform structural maintenance.

  • Proactively improve our infrastructure by contributing scripts and code to our automation efforts (e.g. Bash, Python).

  • Accurately create and maintain documentation detailing the implemented network components, as well as relevant procedures and other documentation.

  • Responsibility for our IT security related platforms. Key areas include Palo Alto firewalls, Juniper MAG SSL gateways, VPNs, Security policies, etc.

  • Work flexible hours. We are proud of the uptime of the trading environment, so every now and then you will be working outside of regular business hours to apply critical changes. This could be from your desk, your couch at home or also inside of one of our datacenters abroad.

  • Liaise with external vendors, exchanges and providers to explore new technology solutions, implement new services or troubleshoot problems.


WHAT MAKES IT FUN?



  • One of the most fun aspects of the job is that we have a very quick feedback loop.  We release early and often to get incremental benefits as they are implemented.

  • We operate at the bleeding edge of technology.  If something new can potentially bring an advantage we will actively invest in developing and utilizing the solution as quick as we can.

  • We really believe in sharing knowledge and technology between the different offices. Much of our technology stack is shared between all three regions, and we provide opportunities to travel between the regions both for personal growth and to assist where people can have the biggest impact.

  • Working at IMC is also an opportunity to learn about financial markets and how exchanges work. We know from experience that a lot of people really enjoy learning about a field beyond their immediate area of expertise, it’s one of the things that makes this job more interesting than others.

  • We employ a broad range of people with varying backgrounds.  What they have in common is their superior technical expertise, their extraordinary smarts and their collaborative approach. We will not accept less.


OUR CULTURE:


We are at the core a trading firm, however we value trading and technology equally and we believe that cooperation between traders and technologists is one of our great strengths. This is also reflected in our organizational and remuneration policies. We believe in fostering a truly flat environment in which great ideas can be recognized and into practice from anybody within our organization.

jobs.title: Senior Data Architect
jobs.content:
The Data Platform, part of KAI (Knowledge, Analysis and Intelligence), within HMRC has the responsibility for developing and implementing the Department’s strategy for acquisition, management and use of data enabling the Department to achieve its customer-centred, data-driven future by building insight across customers, products and activities. It is part of an ambitious change programme across a broad landscape, of specialist and line of business stakeholders. It draws together over £250m of projects and programmes into a coherent delivery vehicle.

These projects all have a data theme and cover IT, data architecture, business change and modern analytical practices.

The current dossier of projects includes an initiative to build a strategic data store and implement new analytical practices to the organisation. This is then supplemented with activities to draw in additional sources of data, including from 3rd parties. The organisation is progressing strategy to transform itself from product centric practices to customer centric ones, and has other initiatives to join up customer data sources and use data mastering to provide the organisation with a single authoritative view of all customers. Building on these enabling technologies we will recruit additional professional analysis and ensure that systems across HMRC integrate to provide both powerful analytical tools and customer management views to the desktop.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Ruby on Rails
jobs.content:
Why Work at Doximity?

Ensuring your goals and values align with ours is an important step. For us, transparency is very important, take a look what it's like to work at Doximity: https://workat.doximity.com

About the Technical Stack

  • Doximity's web applications are built primarily using Ruby, Rails, Go and Javascript.
  • We like to think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.
  • We also have a suite of mobile applications for iOS and Android.
  • Doximity's applications are used by hundreds of thousands Physicians and Healthcare professional.
  • More details about our engineering stack and engineering blog: https://engineering.doximity.com/pages/engineering-stack

Skills & Requirements

  • Pragmatic: A problem solver with a passion for well implemented solutions
  • Fast Learner: Weâre looking for software engineers who thrive on applying their knowledge, learning new technologies
  • Experience: At least 2 years of professional experience developing software using Ruby, Javascript, Golang and/or any other Object Oriented language, statically- , dynamically- typed or otherwise
  • Ruby on Rails: A lot of your work will involve working with the Rails web framework. We expect that you'll have a strong knowledge of MVC as well as Rails 4+ DSL
  • Automated Tests: Experience writing automated tests in Ruby and Javascript
  • Front-end Development: Our application suite utilized quite a bit of Javascript (CoffeeScript). We expect working knowledge of Backbone.js 
  • We'd love to see your work, preferably open-source contributions on Github, or elsewhere on the web

Here's what you can expect to work on

  • Build workflow tools using Ruby on Rails for Physicians
  • Cache, optimize and develop systems that can handle millions of operations
  • Manage and enhance our content ingestion and verification systems
  • Build isomorphic applications that solve real-time messaging challenges 
  • Develop APIs for our mobile applications as well as dynamic front-end features using Backbone.js/React/Ember
  • Leverage Influxdb for managing time-series events

Perks

  • Competitive pay
  • Full medical, vision, dental for you and your family
  • Stock, pre-IPO stock incentives
  • 3+ weeks of vacation
  • 401K and flexible spending accounts
  • Life insurance and disability insurance coverage
  • Generous equipment budget
  • Fully stocked kitchen
  • Breakfast and lunch daily
  • Fully ergonomic setup (chairs and stand-up desks)
  • All-company retreats in fun places like Beverly Hills, Lake Tahoe, and Puerto Vallarta, Mexico

About Doximity

  • Doximity is the leading online medical network with over 50% of U.S. doctors as members
  • Strong revenues, profits, real market traction
  • Putting a dent in the inefficiencies of our $2.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system
  • Beautiful office located in SoMa San Francisco
  • Launched by Jeff Tangney in 2011; Jeff previously founded healthcare pioneer Epocrates (NASDAQ: EPOC)
  • After the iPhone, Doximity is the fastest adopted product by doctors of all time

Remote employees is completely OK, U.S. residents only please.

To apply: Apply at http://goo.gl/V0OMPm

jobs.title: Freelance Content Writer
jobs.content:
Why weâre hiring a Freelance Content Writer...

Simple: Weâre growing.

The UpTrending team has an immediate need for an exceptional Content Writer who learns fast and is passionate about content marketing, technology and the digital marketing space. Our team specializes in helping startups and high-growth companies build their digital brand, and we need someone who can represent and share that expertise with the world.

What makes this the right role for you?
If you are an amazing storyteller and talented influencer with strong research skills, then read on.
Our ideal candidate understands how to leverage content to engage our customers and enhance our brand through tone, content formatting and proper positioning. They also have a strong understanding of digital marketing and technology trends, particularly within startup environments.
We are looking for someone to concept, research and write blog posts, POVs, white papers and a range of other short-form and long-form content in support of our internal agency marketing efforts. This content will be shared on relevant marketing channels including our blog, social channels, email and leveraged directly by our sales team.

Location
This position is 100% remote -- our writer may work at the U.S.-based location of his or her choosing.

To thrive in this role, you must meet the following qualifications:

  • Exceptional written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail, with the ability to proofread and edit copy with faultless accuracy
  • A strong work ethic, demonstrated by the proven ability to meet or exceed tight deadlines
  • Regular, continuous awareness of digital marketing trends and relevant news
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively
  • Strong understanding of SEO and best practices
  • Strong research skills, logic, and creativity

Previous experience writing digital content for agencies or startups is strongly preferred.

To Apply:

Upload your resume including at least three writing samples or a link to your writing portfolio. Resumes with no writing samples or link will not be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

To apply: To Apply:Upload your resume to https://uptrending.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06n6c/. Please include at least three writing samples or a link to your writing portfolio. Resumes with no writing samples or link will not be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: HRIS & Data Manager
jobs.content:
ProQuest products are a gateway to the world’s knowledge. Our vast collections span six centuries, all disciplines and, the diverse content needed by researchers. We provide the world’s largest collection of dissertations and theses. Researchers find three centuries of newspapers; more than half a billion academic e-books; collections of important scholarly journals and other content they need for primary source materials in their area of study.

HRIS & Data Manager oversees delivery of the daily transactional and operational management of the Human Capital Management system. This is a full-time position based in our Ann Arbor office and reporting to the VP of HR.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Spearheads business rules, polices, and compliance around HR tools, standards, data integrity, data protection, enhancements, security profiles and reporting areas.
  • Responsible for the critical management of the HR Analytics and Data Reporting capabilities.
  • Direct accountability of complete HR systems optimization; ensuring that ProQuest has fully streamlined and optimized HRIS capabilities to provide our employees with a user friendly experience, enable real time information to managers and do so in a fiscally responsible manner.
  • Manages an HR business intelligence function to document, streamline, and automate HR policies, processes and procedures.
  • Evaluates effectiveness of all HR system in order to optimize investments.
  • Close coordination with Global Enterprise Management Systems (GEMS) team, HR Operations and Recruiting for systems optimization and reliability.
  • Creates, maintains, and ensures quality assurance of key human resources data sets, reports, and metrics.
  • Supports the HR Leadership Team in using data to influence changes to client and/or HR operations, processes, or programs, in order to improve business effectiveness.
  • Provides management support to the Human Resource function in the areas of people metrics, reporting, and advanced and predictive analytics.
  • Collaborates with subject matter experts across the HR service areas to promote data governance and stewardship, and to improve overall strategic and operational performance and insight.
  • Responsible for designing and continuously streamlining Company-wide HR data and reporting, using benchmarking and best practices as guiding standards.
  • Defines the system roadmaps for decision making to ensure releases are performant, scalable, meet both functional and non-functional requirements.
  • Provides coaching and training on use and interpretation of metrics.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field, plus at least 7 years of applicable analysis and/or reporting experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Expert with Ultimate Software HCM or an expert with the technical applications design/quality to streamline multiple systems.
  • Strong technical skills with expertise with MS Office Suite including Excel, Access, and Visio.
  • Strong consultative, critical thinking and analytic skills with ability to operate strategically and build effective partnerships across multiple stakeholder groups.
  • Experience working in high-growth, performance focused environments.
  • Ability to lead large scale projects in fast paced matrix organizations.
  • Excellent executive presentation skills: ability to distill and present actionable information from complex research.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate analytics and analytical insights to a non-technical audience.
  • Continuous improvement mindset and a passion for measuring results through data and metrics.
  • Experience working across multiple countries.
  • Strong business and financial acumen, with proven ability in data analysis and interpretation, statistical application, and workforce modeling.
  • Excellent planning, organization, and problem-solving skills with the ability to successfully handle multiple concurrent priorities simultaneously; attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy; ability to thrive in dynamic, fast paced environment.
  • High standards for customer service and the ability to build and maintain effective working relationships across HR, and business groups.
  • Ability to manage ambiguity, risk, and changing direction of projects and strategies spending long periods of time seated in front of a computer screen to meet tight deadlines.
  • HR experience in professional services, business services, or related industry.

Ancillary Qualifications:

Qualifications listed below, while not necessarily a requirement for this position in each circumstance, provide additional depth and value to the role.

  • Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business, or related subject area.
  • Experience with Ultimate Software (UltiPro HCM), Taleo, MS SharePoint, SQL, Oracle Enterprise BI suite a plus
  • Functional and technical experience in relational database, business intelligence, reporting, and/or HRMS systems (e.g., SQL, Oracle BI HCM, Business Objects, Cognos, Crystal Reports and Hyperion).
    *
    While other companies might say they value work/life balance, ProQuest lives it. Our work environment is casual, we have great benefits and working hours are flexible. Based in Ann Arbor, we are within walking distance to Downtown, Briarwood Mall and multiple dining experiences. Join ProQuest today. Live and work in Ann Arbor, a naturally beautiful, vibrant and world-class city.

jobs.title: Ninja UX Digital Product Designer (Freelance / Part-Time)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Raleigh, NC USA
URL: www.gearstream.com

Our Mission:

We are a company revolutionizing digital work-life in large traditional companies. We turn industrial dinosaurs into digital ninja's. We make dilbert companies more like Apple and Google. How? Super powers maybe :-)

Our Challenge to You as a UX Digital Design Ninja

We're seeking a ninja UX digital product designer to help us take our secrets and unleash them in the form of an entirely new agile performance and innovation management system for large Enterprise.

Your experience will include both modern Web/Mobile product design (no boring Enterprise apps here) and, *SOME* early experience and insight into Conversational UI's and ChatBots. The entire application will NOT be Conversational UI, but somje of the most innovative experiences we're designing rely on ths form of interaction. Additoinally CHAT (like Slack) will also play a HUGE role in the app.

The Current State of our Product

We are currently STUCK. That's right STUCK. We have months of conceptual wireframes and fantastic ideas. What we need next is a hard nosed, super creative, genious design problem solver to get us UN-STUCK.

What we've Acomplished So Far

We have a basic set of wireframes and user flows (not very exciting) as well as tons of fantastic, super creative conceptual Wireframes and interactions designed for Mobile.

What we Need

We someone that is uber smart, savvy, and fast at assimilating tons of ideas and previous design work who can then help us knit this all together in a compleeling, comprehensive set of user experiences that kick butt!

The Deliverables

Ultimately what we need (and fast) are both well designed and documented user flows, interactions, and ultimatley HIGH RESOLUTION wireframes / style guides for developers to use in building out our MVP.

Your Portfolio Please

Please include with your email a link to your online portfolio and a description of any recent web/mobile product design projects you're most proud of and why.

To apply: brad.murphy@gearstream.com

Whiplash is empowering next-generation eCommerce entrepreneurs with simple and powerfulwarehousing and fulfillment solutions. Our software translates complex retail requirements into simple,failsafe instructions for warehouse employees across the globe.

Our goal is to make life easier for our customers and partners, and to leave them with the âwowâ feeling ofhaving solved logistics and fulfillment issues with ease, style and class.

Weâre looking for a web developer with strong backend skills to become an experts on the Whiplash platform to help us support, scale, and add to our growing base.

jobs.title: Implementation Engineer
jobs.content:
As an Implementation Engineer in Customer Success at Rocana, you will work directly with our customers to design, deploy and support the Rocana solution in their environment. You should be someone who’s deeply technical, passionate about learning and have people skills as you will be the face of Rocana to many of our customers.


What you will be doing



  • You will work directly with the Customer to design and implement solutions based on business and technical requirements

  • Debug, troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues reported by customers

  • Partner with Sales, Product and Engineering to understand customer challenges, develop and implement creative solutions

  • Proactively work with customers to understand their needs and give them a path to achieving their goals using current versions and transitioning to new versions of the product

  • Onsite visits with customers (travel up to 50%)


All teams at Rocana care about developing customer empathy, people over technology, consensus over competition, team success over personal, allowing failure and supporting success, listening before talking, open decision making, diversity, and inclusiveness.


You:



  • Experience building, managing and troubleshooting Apache Hadoop (HDFS, Hadoop, Kafka, Solr) infrastructure environments

  • Expertise at the linux command line and able to write code and scripts

  • Have shell scripting and high-level language experience (we like java a lot)

  • Support/troubleshooting experience in enterprise storage, databases or high-end server solutions

  • Are a good listener, passionate about puzzles, and not afraid to dive into a customer problem to help solve it

  • Demonstrated time management, written and verbal skills, and are able to communicate complex technical issues effectively

  • Strong organizational skills, setting priorities, and delivering results on time with high quality

  • Ability to function in a results oriented, fast paced technical environment

  • Have a strong passion for quality and attention to detail


Bonus points if you have familiarity with:



  • Domain expertise in IT operations/DevOps, system monitoring, or log management software

  • Expertise in logging systems such as Syslog, Rsyslog, Windows Event Viewer

  • Strong software programming skills in Java or similar language


We:



  • Are a distributed company, and as such require self-driven, high output people

  • Care about creating a company, culture, product we all love

  • Focus on how to help customers be successful and on what we achieve as a team

  • Know that if you are happy and engaged, you’ll be/do your best

  • Want to help you achieve your ambitions, so we can achieve ours

  • Want you to develop skills and grow professionally, but we do not tolerate politics

  • Use titles to reflect responsibility, not status

  • Distribute authority and decisions as much as possible

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Nulab, Inc., we are proud of ourselves for handcrafting tools that bring creativity and fun back to collaborating with others. We are seeking an experienced Software Engineer to help our Backlog product team build the next generation of tools for further collaboration.


Our Backlog app is an online project management tool that lets users promote communication and bring in “fun” to work with its features; to-do management, wiki, file sharing, version control, and charts.


Under the hood, Backlog's software stack is built on Java, JavaScript, Scala, Swift, Kotlin, MySQL and AWS. Since ten years have passed from Backlog's launch, we are planning its major update by improving and reforming software architecture and its user interface.


As a Senior Software Engineer in the Backlog team, you will face interesting and challenging tasks to take our software to the next level of scale and sustainability.


What you will do:



  • Design, implement, and comprehensively test new features in a small, agile team environment. 

  • Assist the operations team with troubleshooting operational issues.

  • Share your passion for technology, lead yourself and others, and constantly seek to improve yourself, the product, and the codebase. 


Qualifications: 



  • Java engineering expert with 3+ years of experience building full-stack web applications

  • Strong communication skills (ability to make the complex into something simple and understandable) 

  • Ability to work effectively, both in person and with a remote, distributed team.

  • Proficient in Scala.

  • You must be able to speak English


Recommended: 



  • Familiarity with modern JavaScript APIs and frameworks (e.g. jQuery,Knockout)

  • Native speaker of Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, or Taiwanese


Bonus:



  • Knowledge of Linux/Unix

  • Experience in building a server infrastructure

  • Experience with JavaScript, Scala, Kotlin, or Swift.

  • Willing to contribute actively to the open source community

  • Ability to present in a technological conference.
