jobs.title: Java Software Engineer - Help Build Smart Cities
jobs.content:
Who we are!
Masabi is the world’s leading provider of mobile ticketing solutions for the transport industry. Our products are used every day by commuters in the UK, Boston, New York, Los Angeles, Athens and other major cities around the world, affecting millions of journeys every year and making waiting in line for tickets a thing of the past.


Our mission is to create stress-free, frictionless journeys for passengers and help streamline operations for transport agencies. We improve daily life around the globe by simplifying the way people move around cities. We strive to make the world a better place – one ride at a time.


The Opportunity


As a member of our Hub team you will have a unique opportunity to interact with most of the systems that make up Masabi’s JustRide platform. Whether that is our retail server that allows customers to purchase tickets, or our validation devices that check if tickets are valid (like gate scanners or handheld devices), the continuous flow of data presents a number of very interesting challenges. How do we store it? How do we search it? How do we visualise it? And how can we help our customers make sense from the data and drive high value, highly visible changes to their transit networks?


If you enjoy being in the thick of it, co-operating with a multitude of very talented engineers and driving a product forward, Hub is the team for you.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Engineer in Berlin
jobs.content:
fromAtoB is looking for an experienced full-time Frontend Engineer headquartered in Berlin or Aachen.


We unite lovers, families and businesses. We bring our customers from A to B. Thanks to our deep understanding of Europe’s traffic networks, we develop unique and intelligent routing algorithms that magically calculate the best path between two places. Traveling has never been easier or more efficient and we do all this without charging any extra fees.


When customers use our products they search, scroll, click, swipe, filter and book. They touch and feel our work; your work. As a Frontend engineer at fromAtoB you'll be directly influencing the happiness of our customers. It will be your mission to implement interfaces that users actually enjoy and love to use.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer in Berlin(m/f)
jobs.content:
fromAtoB is looking for an experienced full-time Backend Engineer headquartered in Berlin or Aachen.


We unite lovers, families and businesses. We bring our customers from A to B. Thanks to our deep understanding of Europe’s traffic networks, we develop unique and intelligent routing algorithms that magically calculate the best path between two places. Traveling has never been easier or more efficient and we do all this without charging any extra fees.


Every search, intelligent routing, booking, payment, email and every other bit of logic we do, allows someone to travel. As a Backend engineer at fromAtoB your ambition and passion is required to convert people into happy travelers. In return, as one of our greatest assets, you will thrive from our exceptional team spirit, great benefits, and a culture where your achievements will always be acknowledged and highly valued.


This is you



  • you have very good experience with Ruby, Rails and Rspec

  • you love proper testing, no questions asked

  • you are a team player and culture is your passion

  • you always keep an eye on the customer

  • for you “it works” is not enough


Icing on the cake



  • you have realized projects in other languages and frameworks

  • you know that Sandi Metz is not a canadian politician

  • you still miss _Why as much as we do

  • you dockerize your cloud


This could be future-you



  • you have a big impact on our product, specification and decision making

  • you grew into technical leadership

  • you finally accepted that this is a never ending journey of learning, experimenting and understanding

  • you went beyond salary, demanding and finding purpose on a daily basis


Sounds like a good fit?  We’d love to talk! Please submit



  • Your complete application with salary expectations

  • Your GitHub ID


to join-our-team@fromatob.com or apply directly via https://fromatob.workable.com/ .


This job probably isn't for you, but maybe you have a friend who is a perfect fit? Send them this link and cc join-our-team@fromatob.com. Once they applied we'll get you a free ride. You happy. We happy. Win-Win!

jobs.title: Software Engineer C# / .NET
jobs.content:
When building the tallest buildings, the longest bridges and the biggest airplanes, people put their trust in the market-leading measurement and surveying solutions from Leica Geosystems. Our employees develop, produce and distribute what our customers count on, day after day: innovation, precision, reliability and efficiency.


To strengthen our Team within Construction Tools Division in Heerbrugg, we are currently looking for a Software Engineer C# / .NET (f/m) whose main tasks include:



  • Establishes concepts, plans, designs and implements client-server application software using .NET framework

  • Designs user-centered graphical interfaces (GUI) in close cooperation with product management
    Develops PC software applications connecting to embedded systems using Visual Studio .NET

  • Prepares requirements for software components and manages external software resources

  • Develops and supports software testing strategies, unit/system tests and ensures high software code quality

  • Conducts concept, design and code reviews with team members

jobs.title: Backend Developer C++
jobs.content:
We are a team of highly motivated software architects and mathematicians from diverse backgrounds - from text mining, routing algorithms, and social networks to compiler technologies and mathematics. We combine our knowledge to improve CeleraOne's technology and products every day. 


We develop our backend mainly in C++ 11 and Python. The frontend is based on modern JavaScript technologies. We strive for high code quality and rigorous testing. Each line of code must pass peer review.


About the Job




  • Enhancement of CeleraOne’s in-memory architecture and JIT compiler technology based on LLVM




  • Development of efficient algorithms and data structures for real-time processing of large data volumes




  • Multi-threading in C++ by using state of the art technologies (C++ 11, Boost, ZeroMQ, Intel TBB)




  • Design of highly scalable distributed architectures

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
HugHub is a FinTech start up backed by a financial services consultancy group based in Mayfair. The development team builds innovative products and is looking for a talented developer to join the team. At the moment they are focusing on a cutting edge insurance site, which has already had a successful launch into the UK market.


 The team is hard working and small, comprised of 5 developers, who work closely together at the consulting firm’s plush office on Savile Row. The new hire will be utilizing the latest technologies, helping to develop and improve the HugHub product, and will get to work on future innovative products, getting involved from the onset of the idea to working directly with clients to implement a finished product.


 The HugHub product has a front-end written entirely in Java/TypeScript, Angular, Node.js and a back end utilising RESTful web services (.NET WebAPI), CQRS, MongoDB. The product eco-system also comprises various satellite systems such as a custom-built rules engine and CMS so the ideal candidate will have the following experience:

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer: World's most widely-used security testing software
jobs.content:
For nearly a decade, we have worked at the cutting edge of the web security industry, and our suite of tools is well established as the de facto standard toolkit used by web security professionals.


Our suite of tools, known as Burp Suite, helps security testers, IT professionals and developers (just like you!) write, deploy and maintain secure web applications. Our product is used by more than 22,000 individuals, in 6,000 organisations, in 100 countries.


The team behind Burp Suite is growing steadily, and we are currently looking for outstanding Java developers to join our core product team.


What will you be doing?


We are looking for developers, who are able to work closely with other high achievers on a highly collaborative team, to help architect and implement new editions of our product suite. We are fanatical about the quality of our software and, therefore, would love to meet candidates who are able to help drive quality and excellence into everything that we build!


Essential attributes:



  • Understanding of Java APIs for networking, threading, reflection, and user interface (Swing / JavaFX).



  • A thorough understanding of Agile/XP/TDD methodologies for collaborative development, with the ability to demonstrate a strong commitment to implementing these practices consistently on a day-to-day basis.



  • Ability to quickly understand a large existing codebase, begin applying incremental changes, and identify opportunities for code refactoring.


Why join PortSwigger?


We are genuinely Agile: we employ rigorous TDD; we pair-program on a daily basis; we work off a single code branch that is always release-ready; we have regular team retrospectives and knowledge-sharing sessions.


We have rapid release cycles with updated versions of our software automatically pushed to our users, so you will quickly see your code deployed to a huge global audience.


We offer a healthy, high-tech working environment. All developers work on the latest Mac Pros, with dual monitors, sitting-standing desks, and (if they are so inclined) walking treadmills!

jobs.title: iOS software developer/integrator
jobs.content:
We need one iOS developer with test experience, to convert and deploy an iOS App and Web App for iPad, iPhone and Web App based on Linux Apache.


It is a contract position, based in Catalunya, Northern Spain.

The employer is a UK company.


The position is available for immediate start subject to comprehensive interview and technical test.


Trustportal is a technology which allows the secure sharing of data between customers and firms. We have moved from the prototyping and proof-of-concept stages with a number of large customers and now need to roll out a production-ready version of our product.


We need a capable front-end developer to help make this happen.


You will be working closely with the existing technical team, including the CTO. You will be in a position to, and be expected to, contribute to technical discussions and decision-making on architecture, implementation, testing and issue management.


We enjoy an egalitarian, collegiate working environment. The only hierarchy is ability.



If you are capable and wish to expand your skills while proving yourself in a delivery-focussed environment, this is the position for you.

All work is conducted in English, so you will be expected to be fairly fluent. However, the CTO is keen to practice his Catalan and Spanish when appropriate.


Position Details


This is a 6-month (with probationary initial period) contract for a UK-based firm.


The remuneration on offer is commensurate with proven ability and experience. It will be competitive and based on UK norms.


Location: Catalunya, Northern Spain.


Initially working at the CTO’s (large) home office in Alt Emporda (15 mins from Vilafant AVE train station).


Later, once an office has been located in Barcelona, the work will be based there.



Once competence and knowledge of the project has been demonstrated there may be opportunities to occasionally work remotely if desired. However, when explicitly asked to attend the office this is a requirement.

jobs.title: Full Stack Architect - Digital Transformation - Financial Markets
jobs.content:
Are you a Full Stack Architect looking to deliver best of breed web technology solutions to the financial sector? Would you like to work with a range of clients? Do you love developing end-user centric solutions?  


Financial institutions are becoming more focused on improving customer interaction through utilizing the best next generation web technology and creative user experience design. At Sapient Global Markets we are taking a lead role in this evolution, and are offering an exciting opportunity for the right individual to help spearhead our projects across our portfolio of capital markets, commercial and retail banking clients.


This is technologically broad opportunity for an accomplished technical architect from the financial services or commodities sector. In this role you will be responsible for designing systems built with next generation interactive web technology tools and frameworks which are underpinned by cloud technology and highly available, high throughput messaging and infrastructure.  


You’ll assume the role of a technical authority within our global markets group and be responsible for end to end solutions design of trading systems and next generation customer engagement platforms, incorporating all associated back end technologies and infrastructure. You’ll be responsible for the technical management of project teams, helping to ensure that our developers have a clear understanding of target architecture and their individual development responsibilities. You’ll also work closely with clients, helping to establish their next generation platform technology strategy from both a technology and a business perspective.


This is an outstanding opportunity for a technical leader to join Sapient Global Markets at a time of digital change in the financial services sector, where businesses are prioritizing customer experience in tandem with best in class technology solutions. You’ll be perfectly positioned to take advantage of our next gen technology development capability and financial services sector pedigree, delivering the best solutions for our customers.

jobs.title: Network Protocol Reverse Engineer
jobs.content:
Curious, motivated software developer wanted


Are you a developer who's hungry to solve unique problems and puzzles, make a difference, and test the potential of your own best ideas?


Kyrus is a small company that works with the big picture in mind, taking on projects with real significance that grow our capacity to tackle even more fascinating development problems.  We've earned a reputation for efficiency, effectiveness, and impact since our founding in 2009, and are recruiting teammates for our northern Virginia-based team.


We're looking for an energetic, highly-engaged DC-area developer who takes pride in their ability to create functional, robust, and intuitive software tailored to the client's needs—whether that's a customer or our internal R&D team. 


Our ideal new colleague is a lifelong learner who balances the drive to crack a puzzle independently with the awareness of when it's time to leverage our team's experience, or contribute their own diverse viewpoint to help build a team solution.  If you incorporate feedback quickly, place a high value on the quality of your work, and are interested in growing with us as we explore new challenges, we'd love to hear from you.


We offer a focused working environment dedicated to seeing every member of our team—and every good idea—reach their maximum potential.  As an employee-owned company, we actively provide the support necessary to develop and fund our staff's very best ideas into novel new capabilities. Kyrus is where products like Carbon Black was created.


Our benefits include ability to work from home, flexible work hours, quarterly professional development off-sites, a fitness budget, and unlimited paid vacation that we will actually make sure you use.


We are seeking applications from strong developers of all backgrounds and orientations but, due to the nature of our work, we require applicants to be US citizens.


Kyrus takes pride in developing innovative software applications and services that impact our customers need. To achieve this, we need team members who can create functional, robust, and intuitive software.


This position is available in either Sterling, VA or Denver, Co.

jobs.title: We are not building a monolithic Enterprise Java app
jobs.content:
Sky Betting and Gaming is a pure online business with a mobile first ethos that brings the excitement of sports betting, casino games, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the leisure betting and gaming market. Close relationships with Sky Sports provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real Sky experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.


We live up to our values: Multi-disciplined teams with local decision-making means you can work without boundaries, we are truly collaborative across the business. Process is kept to a minimum, examples are: no timesheets, project codes, product owners not project managers, no yearly performance review, so you can really focus on delivery. You will be recognised for your contribution and rewarded appropriately. You will be empowered to define your own development through our Tech Ninja fund. Our staff use this to go to conferences or buy additional equipment.


What do we expect from you?


We are expanding our in-house Java capability this year in Bet Tribe, and we are looking to hire top quality, enthusiastic engineers from relevant backgrounds to work in our lean squads.


Join one of the most exciting tech teams in Leeds as a Software Engineer working with the latest front and backend technologies on the Skybet.com sports betting platform. 


No previous experience in sports betting? No problem – we have many experts to learn from, and the technical excellence you’ll bring is what we value. Salary and benefits packages reflect the high standard in our tech teams, with excellent training and development opportunities for all engineers.


You will be self-motivated and willing to contribute to design at all levels, listening and learning from the talented people around you. We believe we have a strong culture and we want you to be a part of it.


Reporting to the Lead Software Engineer, you will:



  • Contribute enthusiastically to our continuous improvement of coding practices, application quality, and agile processes

  • Deliver first-class products, which are secure, well tested, performant, and help provide an engaging customer experience

  • Play a proactive part in owning the technical systems your team works with; taking responsibility for monitoring, measuring performance and addressing technical issues when required, not just in office hours (on-call allowance with this role)

jobs.title: Senior Python Developer
jobs.content:
For our latest project we are building a new government data collection platform using microservices architecture. 


We believe in making data open and reusable, and we put our products go in front of users as early as possible.


We believe and follow the GDS design principles:


1. Start with needs
2. Do less
3. Design with data
4. Do the hard work to make it simple
5. Iterate. Then iterate again.
6. This is for everyone
7. Understand context
8. Build digital services, not websites
9. Be consistent, not uniform
10. Make things open: it makes things better


Our teams build products at a high velocity (Discovery, Alpha, Beta, Live) so we expect you to be comfortable with coding efficiently to meet user need.

The book Re-Work (see chapter titles at bottom of page) is also a great reference tool for the way we like to go about our business.

If you have a knack for producing better results with less code, are humble, and constantly learning new technologies - then you are the kind of person we like to work with.

jobs.title: Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future – for a better working life!



The Data Science Team at XING in Hamburg or Barcelona has an open position for a
 


Dev Ops Engineer (m/f) for Data Science


Our Data Science team is responsible for turning data into services and products for XING. 18 Data scientists, architects and engineers work together to create highly scalable solutions that serve more than 14 million users. We work with the latest technologies in a highly international environment. If you want to get things done rather than sit in meetings, like helping others and learning from them, you will have fun in our team!



A challenging task:



  • Manage and operate a large Hadoop cluster including data ingestion and interfacing with different components of the XING platform

  • Implement services dealing with massive amounts of data and a high number of concurrent users

  • Solve challenging problems related to infrastructure for search and recommender systems using state-of-the-art technologies

  • Work on products that will be used by millions of users on a daily basis

jobs.title: Director
jobs.content:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future – for a better working life!

We currently have an opening at our headquarters in Hamburg, Germany for a


Director (m/f) Software Engineering


Our Marketing Solutions business unit is responsible for selling advertising campaigns and opportunities both on xing.com and in our mobile offerings. To achieve this, the team develops advertising strategies and suitable products, while also putting together individual packages and entering into strategic partnerships [for more information, visit https://advertise.xing.com].


A challenging task:



  • Lead engineering teams totalling 10-15 members who work cross-functionally with a focus on advertising products

  • Communicate with all executive levels (VP Engineering, Business Unit Head, etc.) to ensure alignment between the technology and product departments

  • Be a proactive leader who manages dependencies and helps clear impediments out of your agile teams’ way

  • Motivate your team members as you support them to reach mastery in their skills and give them clear messages about their purpose and team identity

  • Manage and control engineering resources to foster highly motivated teams that produce excellent outcomes

  • Build great services in collaboration with the product team and peer with other engineering leads

jobs.title: Senior Backend or Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Backend or Full-Stack Developer (Ruby on Rails) (m/f)


With our core “premium network” we develop a product that is so valuable to our customers that they are willing to pay for it! We build mobile and web based products which enable our users to connect and communicate with each other. We constantly challenge our existing business models and work on new innovative products. Our unit currently consists of nearly 70 people in 5 agile development teams plus several supporting functional teams - and we’re not done growing yet.

A challenging task:



  • Work as part of a cross-platform agile team, closely with other developers (pair programming), testers, product owner and other team-mates on shaping and improving products in your area of responsibility

  • Focus on developing the backend part of our apps and providing APIs for our web platform and iOS/Android mobile apps

  • Create and enable sophisticated yet pragmatic features for our paying customers, while considering both time-to-market as well as sustainability of the code you develop

  • Solve complex performance problems, architectural and data challenges

  • Help shape our roadmap by providing product ideas and feedback

jobs.title: .Net developer
jobs.content:
.Net developer (C#) bij Kampert Nauta in Oss

Ben jij net begonnen aan je carrière of toe aan een tweede stap? Wil je bij een bedrijf werken met veel vrijheid en slimme oplossingen maken voor tastbare projecten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Jouw functie
Als .Net ontwikkelaar werk je zelfstandig aan projecten in een gezellig team, waarbij je altijd een collega om hulp kunt vragen. We maken nieuwe applicaties en passen applicaties aan naar de wensen van de klant. Je programmeert al onze applicaties in ASP.NET en C# en gebruikt daarnaast Javascript. Je krijgt ook alle vrijheid om nieuwe oplossingen uit te denken of hoe je met een nieuwe code de performance nog meer kan verbeteren.

Je werkt in een mix van zeer ervaren en minder ervaren ontwikkelaars. De complexiteit aan verschillende systemen en koppelingen maakt het werk uitdagend. We hebben natuurlijk te maken met regels, maar het allerbelangrijkst is het dat de applicaties voldoen aan de verwachtingen van onze klant. Je kunt je volledig focussen op je code. Binnen het team vinden we de sfeer heel belangrijk, zo vliegt er wel eens een grapje over en weer en doen we op zijn tijd ook leuke dingen buiten werktijd. Kortom, een werkomgeving die jou zeker zal uitdagen en inspireren.

Als jij wordt uitgedaagd door bovenstaande functieomschrijving, maken we graag kennis met jou!

Jouw profiel



  • ICT-opleiding op hbo- / wo-niveau.

  • Ervaring met C# en ASP.NET (enthousiaste beginners helpen we graag).

  • Ervaring met werken volgens codestandaarden.

  • Kennis van javascript en entity frameworks (andere frameworks als MVC kan ook).

  • Flexibel, oplossingsgericht, communicatief sterk en proactief.

  • Je kunt goed in teamverband werken en bent in staat om zelfstandig je werk te kunnen doen.



Wie zijn wij?
Bij ons kunnen klanten terecht met al hun grafische vraagstukken! We drukken flyers, folders, posters, visitekaartjes en nog veel meer. Daarnaast denken we mee over slimme marketingtools. Deze worden door onze ICT-afdeling geprogrammeerd. Met onze innovatieve aanpak en intelligente oplossingen mogen we werken voor zowel (inter)nationale A-merken, als het kleinere MKB, maar ook voor consumenten bij bijvoorbeeld Hipdesign.nl. Je kunt dan vanuit huis je eigen kaart maken en zonder dat iemand van de drukkerij ook maar iets hoeft te doen belanden, via een geautomatiseerd proces, de kaartjes op hun deurmat. Onze geschiedenis gaat dan wel ruim 120 jaar terug, we blijven koploper op het snijvlak van ICT, print en media. Eigentijdse marketing en communicatie vragen om slimme, snelle en flexibele productieoplossingen.

Wij bieden



  • Flexibele werktijden en vrijheid in je werkwijze.

  • Marktconform salaris en goede secundaire voorwaarden.

  • Leuke collega’s en een werksfeer waarbij je je op je gemak zult voelen.

  • Maar bovenal: een uitdagende functie in een plezierige en unieke werkomgeving.



Solliciteren
Word jij uitgedaagd door deze functie? Solliciteer dan via het online sollicitatieformulier.

Kijk voor meer informatie op onze website kampertnauta.nl. Voor extra informatie kun je contact op nemen met Miranda van Miert, recruiter a.i., telefoon: 06-18446160 of m.vanmiert@kampertnauta.nl. (Gebruik dit e-mailadres alleen voor informatie, sollicitaties ontvangen wij graag via het online sollicitatieformulier.) 

Past de geschetste functie niet bij jou, maar ken je iemand die perfect in het geschetste profiel past? Stuur deze vacature dan door.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced Rails Engineer looking for a new challenge? Have you scaled Rails apps for high traffic in the past and want to further tune your skills? Do you want to work on an elegant 17-microservice codebase adding features and making it even more performant?


We are looking for smart developers to join our team and help scale out a microservice plaftorm for our long-term client. The platform is currently processing over $100m in revenue and the target is to scale this 3-4x over the next 12 months.



What do we offer?



  • Spanish "indefinido" contract with a long term gig

  • Weekly team lunches (which means: company pays)

  • Fridays working from home

  • Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks

  • Competitive salary

  • A cool office to make you feel confortable with kitchen, free fruit, free coffee, futbolin, etc.

  • The best working atmosphere, within a dynamic, informal and international environment, learning from the best skilled people

  • Working as part of a talented, globally distributed, fast moving team

  • A focussed adherance to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it helps getting good work done)

  • A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart people

  • The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc




You'll be:




  • Working with a small, fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time) using our established agile practices.

  • Solving hard business logic with elegant software design

  • Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale

  • Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the system.

  • Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD

  • Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and ensuring quality

  • Bonus: experience in javascript (node/react/backbone) for when you want to go full-stack 


For remote position: http://stackoverflow.com/jobs/123224/sr-rails-engineer-scaling-high-traffic-whitespectre

jobs.title: JUNIOR UTVECKLARE TILL TIETO
jobs.content:
Är du nyutexaminerad dataingenjör eller har upp till två års erfarenhet av programmering? Vill du få chansen att samla på dig ovärderlig erfarenhet genom att praktisera det du lärt dig i skolan på ett mycket attraktiv företag som Tieto?


Academic Work söker för Tietos räkning juniora dataingenjörer. Tieto ärett ledande IT-tjänsteföretag i Norden och tillhandahåller tjänster för hela IT-livscykeln. Teamet i Karlstad som är inriktat mot Telecom och datakom har just nu mycket att göra och mycket erfarenhet att dela med sig av till juniora förmågor. Det är här du kommer in i bilden!


Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Tietos önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work


Uppdraget är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du kommer vara anställd av Academic Work och arbeta som konsult hos Tieto. Tietos intention är att du på sikt ska kunna bli anställd direkt hos dem, förutsatt att alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet.


ARBETSUPPGIFTER


Hos Tieto kommer du arbeta i ett team bestående av av 6-8 personer. Genom ett agilt arbetssätt med Scrum arbetar man i sprintar av 3 veckor som stäms av dagligen i teamet. Du blir tilldelad en fadder på plats hos Tieto för att få en bra stöttning i din roll.


Vi tror att ditt tekniska intresse är mycket stort och att du inspireras av att bryta ned komplexa system och hitta lösningar på problem i systemen. Tieto har många olika typer av kunder och projekten kan variera i storlek men uppdragen handlar främst om abstrakt teknikorienterad programmering i inbyggda system. Du kommer arbeta mycket brett inom området genom att bryta ner problemet, programmera, testa och dokumentera samt redovisa resultatet. Du kommer under din första tid att teamas ihop med en mer erfaren kollega för att komma in i arbetet så bra som möjligt. Här finns chansen att erhålla mängder av erfarenheter genom gott samarbete och ett målinriktat arbete!


Tjänsten passar dig som är tekniskt intresserad och vill anta utmaningen att tillsammans med ett mycket kompetent team lösa de problem som Tietos kunder står inför.


ÖVRIG INFORMATION




  • Start: 1 oktober




  • Omfattning: Heltid 100% under ett år med möjlighet till överrekrytering




  • Placering: Karlstad




  • Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på Ansök nedan. Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.




  • Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten besvaras dessa på lin03@academicwork.se under kontorstid. Skriv annonstiteln i rubriken och kopiera gärna in länken till annonsen i ditt mail. Academic Work är Home of the Young Professionals. Vi vänder oss till dig som är akademiker och fortfarande studerar på högskola/universitet, är nyutexaminerad eller har några års arbetslivserfarenhet.




  • Vårt erbjudande till dig som heltidskonsult hos Academic Work inkluderar utöver kollektivavtalsenliga villkor och dedikerad konsultchef också rabatter och erbjudanden genom vår konsultportal. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande här




SKYDD FÖR DIN PERSONLIGA INTEGRITET När du skickar in din ansökan till Academic Work godkänner och samtycker du till att Academic Work behandlar dina personuppgifter enligt Personuppgiftslagen. Läs mer under vår PuL-sida.

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you know what Additive Manufacturing(AM), high quality 3D printing, will bring about in the next few decades?


At DiManEx we digitize the industrial supply chain, making AM an integral part of it.


Our mission is to print “Any (industrial) part, Anywhere” in the world.


It is about transforming the way Manufacturing is understood around the world and radically innovate the supply chain management bringing it to almost on-demand.


Our solution leads to less scrap material (waste) in the production of parts, having a significant positive impact to our environment.


Imagine the amount of parts in machines, domestic appliances, cars and everything surrounding you. This is our potential market.


By what we do, we bridge two worlds coming together: the old - traditional supply chain and ditto manufacturing; and the new - a digitized, optimized supply chain that has AM as integrated part of it.



To make it happen we need to build a ton of cool features, adopting technologies such as Machine Learning, Blockchain and a strong SOA architecture able to match the highest standards in quality, security and scalability.


What kind of professional are we looking for?


There are a few skills you should master, but don’t be afraid though. We strongly believe it is your character that determines whether you are a good fit for our team or not. Besides your experience and expertise we would like you to bring excitement, speed, creativity and a moonshot attitude to the team. We thrive in a fast-paced, FUN startup environment, taking on many challenges at once. That is what we would like to see with you as well: that passion, the fire within.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an individual who can combine strong web development skills in the context of big data and an interest in genomics. He/she will be involved in all aspects of development of our online platforms and user interfaces, which allow access to large amounts of data and analysis results in order to solve real client needs.


In this role, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, testing and quality assurance of existing and new functionalities of our online platforms. You will interface with the existing development team, as well as our clients, advisors and collaborators.


We offer excellent terms, a flexible work environment and we will provide training as needed. We also consider internships.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
Based in Oxford, you will join our software development team to create tools to enable clients to access our services/data remotely. You will develop innovative applications that are key products of our company.


In particular, you will be responsible for improving and expanding the interface for EOS – Aurora’s leading web-based low-latency data application used by the world’s largest energy companies. You will also develop a web interface for our economic models.


The successful applicant will combine technical strength with a strong track record of performance in team-orientated environments.


The successful candidate will work in a creative, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. They will enjoy autonomy, and the opportunity to develop applications that will influence major decisions in the energy sector.

jobs.title: Software developer  Patient Data Management
jobs.content:
Nowadays, patient treatment involves many different stages. From admitting a patient, to preliminary consultations in offices or meeting rooms through to treatment in the operating theatre, different information is required at the right place at the right time.


In order to cover more and more complex medical scenarios, a software infrastructure on separate systems is required which allows the coordination of separate software components and the processing of necessary steps and calculations in a suitable order. In addition to this, the synchronization and networking of many hospital systems is vital - between Brainlab systems as well as with systems from other manufacturers, for example with PACS or hospital information systems.


As a member of our project team, you are responsible for developing this infrastructure to manage software applications and the increasing amount of data which is part of this complex and broad field. You work as part of our team responsible for "Brainlab Operating System" and thereby create a solid base upon which our other developer teams can run their applications. Through these tasks, we ensure a uniform software environment and user experience for all Brainlab systems, both local and cloud applications.


Together with a team of software developers, project engineers and project managers, you will be making an important contribution to intelligent workflow control, intuitive interfaces and intelligent data management, which optimize the working processes used when treating patients.

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Travis CI is looking for an Enterprise Development and Support Engineer in
US and EU timezones.


Travis CI Enterprise is one of our main products, essentially Travis CI
packaged up as a Docker container. It is being installed and run inside our
customer's private networks.


As a support engineer, you will work closely with our Travis CI Enterprise
customers, helping them to be more successful with Travis CI over time. You'll
learn about their successes and challenges, understand their interests, and
share their feedback.


You will also help to solve support cases, often opened by customer system
administrators, using your technical skills and coordinating responses from
our infrastructure and development teams. Tickets can include investigation of
network or configuration issues, debugging application errors, discussing
feature requests, and others. Doing so you will work with our engineering teams
to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve
customer-facing resources.


As a development engineer, you will work on our applications and integrate
them to work in the context of Travis CI Enterprise. You will add new features,
improve our build tooling and automation, and the overall system.


Benefits


You can work from anywhere you want. You do not have to come to Berlin, but
we're happy to fly you in to meet with the team whenever you want.

You choose your own working hours. We're flexible in how you work and where you
work. We have families, and we encourage you to spend plenty of time with
yours.

You take a minimum of 25 days paid leave per year, plus personal days off.

We chip in for your health insurance. As a German company, we generally split
about 50/50 between employer and employee, no matter where you are.

We offer paid parental leave to all of our employees, no matter if legally
required.

A Kindle book allowance so you can take time off and read.

You visit conferences. We will pay for travel and tickets.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Senior Full-Stack Developer


Bought By Many is a multi-award-winning fintech company revolutionising the insurance industry based in central London; you can read about us http://boughtbymany.com. We have been ‘making insurance social’ for three years now and are growing our team as we expand our platform to sell our own insurance products.


The Tech Team is expanding to develop the first truly customer-centric end-to-end insurance business. We are migrating towards a micro-services and serverless architecture and ES6. We are not afraid to make bold tech stack decisions to stay ahead, so you will too.


The successful candidate will be joining an exceptional team and will play a key role in developing in all areas of our tech stack.


Role Overview



  • Pick up a task, or small project and take it right through to production ready.

  • Drive out detailed requirements where they don’t already exist, with the help of business users and analysts.

  • Work with and guide more junior developers to make them productive and deliver to a high-quality. And work collaboratively with other senior developers.

  • Become the technical authority for one or more key components of our systems infrastructure.

  • Contribute to and influence the overall tech stack and new tech adoption.

  • Work collaboratively with our multi-disciplinary teams.



Skills & Experience Requirements (in rough priority order)



  • Python

  • MongoDB and associated python libraries

  • PostgreSQL

  • Micro-services and REST APIs

  • HTML, CSS & JavaScript

  • AWS devops and APIs

  • AWS: Lambda, Kinesis, API Gateway.

  • Python Web Frameworks (Django, Flask)

  • Agile software development

  • Facebook API/Open Graph



We also like talking to people who enjoy



  • Big Data Analytics

  • Test & Behavioural Driven Development

  • Meta programming

jobs.title: (Senior) Scala Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently looking for well experienced Scala Developers to support our Development Teams. All three of these cross-functional and international teams have many interesting challenges waiting for you: One team is developing a large scale cloud service for fraud prevention, building distributed responsive and resilient solutions which evaluate transactions in real-time. The second team is building on-premise solutions for business customers, ingesting wide varieties of data for automatic classification of events, as well as providing a presentation layer for manual review/classification. The third team is developing a scalable platform for real-time data processing, analysis and prediction, turning insights and models supplied by our Data Science Team into the production code that forms the backbone of our fraud prevention solutions.


Your Tasks:



  • Development and maintenance of our main software components

  • Continuous refactoring of our codebase

  • Bringing in your ideas of how to improve our software by new technologies

  • Code reviews of your fellow developers

  • Supporting the release and deployment process

  • Working together with our Data Science Team to develop and integrate new approaches for fraud detection

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
Wil jij ook werken met Open Data? Be part of the vibe!



Het DataLab is voor het DataPunt op zoek naar een ervaren en gedreven



Frontend Developer


Met een passie voor de stad Amsterdam, voor innovatie, Open Source en voor Open Data.




Werken bij het Datapunt van de Gemeente Amsterdam betekent; “elke dag met veel energie en plezier werken aan data gedreven oplossingen in een inspirerende werkomgeving, met de meest innovatieve technologieën, voor een groeiende en bruisende stad”.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability
jobs.content:
The Westwing mission is to inspire and make every home a beautiful home. We are on a quest to bring the wonders of eCommerce for home & living to our more than 26 million members in 14 countries on three continents. In less than 5 years on the market, we have grown to more than 219 million Euros in annual sales, and the opportunity ahead of us is massive.


The Westwing team is the secret to our success. Our more than 1,500 team members balance creativity and style with innovative technology and strong business fundamentals. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious, and looking for the challenge to transform an industry and take it into the future.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer - Site Reliability (m/f) to join our Site Reliability Group. In this position you will work with a team of skilled people ensuring that our applications fit all the technical requirements to run in the cloud under high standards of availability, stability and performance.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
You are passionate about software, laser-focused and self-motivated. In this position, you will work together with our lead Front End Developer and Core Platform Engineers through numerous stages of the product development cycle.


Are you the perfect fit for Appway?



  • JavaScript is your passion and creating code with a strong focus on architecture is what you like most

  • You like to work as part of a scrum team, you are a problem solver and you will apply your skills to support Appway’s customer needs

  • You enjoy finding ways to feed intelligence back into the products and tasks you work on, as well as with your colleagues


Main Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate closely with Appway’s user interaction and graphic designers, as well as other programmers.

  • Transform Photoshop mockups into a living breathing web applications

  • Writing clear, obvious, and maintainable code.

  • Help us to take Appway to the next level by improving its desktop quality user interface using standards-based HTML, JavaScript and CSS.


Skills & Requirements



  • Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.

  • 5+ years of experience and demonstrable proficiency in JavaScript, CSS and HTML5

  • Strong computer science fundamentals: object oriented programming, design patterns and algorithms.

  • Experience in the following:

  • The Java programming language

  • Medium to large-scale standards-based web applications

  • Conceptual design, and implementation, of modern software architectures

  • Fluency in English is a must

  • You are excited about mobile and fearless about picking up new technologies.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.content:
Product Marketing Manager (Remote) 

Weâre looking for a product focused marketer, who cares deeply about understanding our customers, our product and our business and can expertly communicate our (big!) vision to the world.

QWILR
At Qwilr, we make it easy for anyone to create their documents as stunning web pages.

By combining the best of the web with the familiar ease of document creation tools, we have created a better way for businesses to communicate. Qwilr Pages are beautiful, intelligent, interactive, data rich, & secure - and they are also incredibly quick and easy to create.

Qwilr lets the world to move from the archaic 1980s paradigm of PDF, Powerpoint & Word to the power & beauty of the web - because the web can do so much more than a file can.

PRODUCT MARKETING AT QWILR

  • Work with the founders to develop positioning and messaging that helps potential customers understand the benefits and vision of Qwilr.
  • Formulate and execute go-to-market activities ranging from feature launches, case studies, templates, onboarding guides, educational materials and more to help our users & customers get the most out of Qwilr.
  • Work directly with product management, sales and engineering to increase adoption of our features; help shape demos and videos that showcase Qwilrâs capabilities.
  • Produce articles and content for our blog, and other related content opportunities.
  • Influence product development, based on market demand as well as customer feedback.
  • Manage our marketing site.

OUR TEAM ALL

  • Move fast and execute every day.
  • Love developing creative solutions in a team, as much as going solo on a challenging project from beginning to end.
  • Are eager to understand and work with our users.
  • Are across both the big picture and the devilish details.
  • Know in their bones that software and the web can make the ways that businesses build, use, share & reuse documents at least 10x better.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 2+ years of experience in marketing SaaS products, platforms, or services.
  • Extremely clear communicator with great copy writing and editing skills.  

BONUS POINTS

  • You have done your own thing before - be it a blog, an adventure or a startup
  • Design skills
  • Technical Skills - especially around HTML & CSS
  • Video Skills
  • Deep knowledge of Sales & Marketing Collateral (Proposals, Quotes, Pitch Decks, etc)
  • Understand how SaaS works - CAC, LTV, Churn, ARPU, etc

PERKS

  • Competitive salary with meaningful equity
  • Work directly with the founders in a role that will impact the future of our company
  • Budget for continued learning and A+ office supplies
  • Four weeks paid leave
  • Contributions to your 401(k) or equivalent 
  • An annual trip out to Sydney, Australia to meet the team
  • An excellent team environment in a fast growing company

To apply: Send a thoughtful cover letter and your CV (or LinkedIn) to careers@qwilr.com

jobs.title: Customer Support Specialist
jobs.content:
ShopStorm is looking for a Customer Success Specialist to join our fully distributed team. Youâll be responsible for supporting a growing set of Shopify apps which help power thousands of online stores.

The Role

Youâll be the primary point of contact for our customers, helping them with problems, and answering questions. As part of a small team, you'll likely get your hands dirty with a little bit of everything. Here are some things you may do on a given day:

  • Serve as the key point person for ShopStormâs customers
  • Help customers by troubleshooting problems and answering questions
  • Install and modify code on customersâ Shopify stores
  • Author technical documentation and blog posts to help our customers help themselves
  • Help our engineering/product leads identify existing pain points and prioritize feature releases
  • Implement processes to improve support and customer satisfaction
  • Monitor social media channels and online forums for opportunities to enhance our brand
  • Assist with marketing and partnership efforts

About You

You have that unique combination of technical aptitude and empathy for the user. Youâre comfortable with code but prefer to be customer-facing. Youâre self-driven with a sense of urgency and draw satisfaction from going above and beyond to provide solutions. Youâre an excellent communicator and have the ability to thrive in a distributed environment. Perhaps most importantly, you have a willingness to learn.

About Us

ShopStorm is a small team focused on creating high-quality Shopify apps with exceptional customer service. All types and size of merchants, from the smallest 1-person online shop to large, multinational eCommerce powerhouses rely on our apps to help their businesses.

Our team is part of SkyVerge, an eCommerce software company that builds tools for tens of thousands of merchants across many different platforms. Weâre a distributed company with an even gender split that spans 4 US states and 5 countries. We believe in open communication, respect each otherâs diversity of thought, and often find that a well-timed GIF or emoji is the best way to communicate. ðµ

The Requirements

To succeed in this position you will have:

  • Solid understanding of HTML / CSS
  • Native-level fluency in English
  • Fantastic written communication and interpersonal skills
  • An endless curiosity for our products and our users
  • Ability to thrive in a remote environment (along with a reliable internet connection)
  • Availability for 1-2 team trips / year

The Bootcamp

This is a full-time, salaried position, but hours are flexible. We know your work will speak for itself through delighted customers and well-written documentation and blog posts. However, fit with our team and culture is important.

Every new team member completes a 60-day Bootcamp as a contractor before becoming a salaried employee. Already have a full-time position? Donât worry. Weâre flexible with hours and schedule during the bootcamp period.

The Benefits

Some of the benefits we're excited to offer to our team members:

  • Competitive salary with performance incentives
  • 15 days of paid time-off per year
  • Generous holiday policy including two company holidays: SkyVerge Day in March, Founders Day in June ð
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance (reimbursements for comparable care for non-US/Canadian residents)
  • Retirement plan with company match
  • Home office or co-working allowance
  • Hardware and software allowance (we'll set you up with the tools you need to be productive)
  • Personal development allowance to help you learn and grow (e.g. books, courses, conferences)
  • A Kindle to help you keep learning!

TL, DR: Join our team and influence thousands of online stores. Excited? Us too. Apply now!

SkyVerge believes and supports workplace diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

To apply: Apply here: https://skyverge.workable.com/jobs/330658

jobs.title: WebGL 3D JavaScript
jobs.content:
Samasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.


In this role, you'll build a web-based 3D tool that ingests LiDAR point cloud files, and allows users to draw cuboids around objects within those point clouds. Agents will be able to navigate around clouds (rotate, pan, zoom) and assign labels to the cuboids they make.


Cuboid coordinates & associated labels should be easily importable & exportable via JSON. The solution will integrate with our existing workspace tools. While you'll be the sole developer on the 3D project, you'll be able to lean on an engineering team of 6 full-time engineers for help with platform integration. Expansion of existing open source or proprietary tools is welcome - you'll need to decide & make a case for any tools before starting.


This position is ideal for a senior developer with experience in JavaScript, WebGL, (ideally) point cloud manipulation, and an interest in social good. Samasource has elevated over 30,000 underprivileged workers & their dependents out of poverty. With your help, this tool will allow us to help many more.


While we're based in San Francisco, we're very happy to consider remote applications from anyone willing to work on (roughly) US Pacific timezones.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Python Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview:
If you are a Software Engineer and are looking to make an impact in the Healthcare Industry, we have the job for you! Hatch is currently working with a Healthcare IT startup based in Bethesda, MD that provides everything a doctor needs to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO) - from business practice transformation services to upfront capital and cutting-edge technology platform. They are currently looking to add multiple Sr. Software Engineers to the team, with the opportunity to work remotely, to help enhance their data driven platform. You would be working on their core platform that is built with Angular/Python/Flask and is utilized to help make a doctors life easier and a patients healthcare cost lower.  Outside of developing on the core platform, they offer a number of different opportunities for back-end focused engineers that love working with data. They have been around for just over 2 years now and have quickly grown to about 100 employees, with about 8 currently working on the Dev team.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
ABOUT BIT ZESTY

We are an innovation agency specialising in making digital experiences that create real value for users and organisations. We make digital products for clients across a variety of industries â including startups, large enterprises, charities and government bodies â as well as building and maintaining our own SaaS products.

We believe in creating a workplace where employees are given the opportunity to grow and better themselves, have their opinions heard, socialise with colleagues and genuinely enjoy the work they do every day. Our whole team is committed to working together to achieve industry-leading results.

BEING A RUBY ON RAILS DEVELOPER AT BIT ZESTY

As a Senior Ruby on Rails Developer at Bit Zesty you will be working alongside the product management and UX design teams to make the products we build rock-solid and scalable.

It is the perfect opportunity for someone who is experienced in creating dynamic web applications and passionate about clean code.

Design
  • Take wireframes/mockups and user stories and design systems that meet the requirements
  • Create user friendly web app interfaces by working closely with UX designers and frontend developers

Develop
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.
  • Devops: improve automation of the software development process.
  • Identify performance issues and bugs, and provide solutions to these problems.

Collaborate
  • Work with other team members to ensure we are building the right product
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Pair-program with other developers or discuss possible technical architectures
  • Contribute to creating a culture of writing excellent software

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • 4+ years experience developing applications with Ruby on Rails
  • Expert in HTML, CSS & JS
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL)
  • Passion for good user experience
  • Passion for technology
  • Superb organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to take initiative and work with minimal supervision
  • University degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related subject

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Friendly, open-minded and collaborative team
  • Challenging environment - you will be working on new complex projects every 2-3 months
  • Remote working (full-time contractor)
  • Day rate dependent on experience

To apply: Visit: https://bit-zesty.workable.com/jobs/271893/candidates/new

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The past 12 months has been a big year for our small team at Float. Were looking to expand our engineering group to meet the needs of our growing global customer base, and are hiring a DevOps Engineer to play a key role in this.

Primary responsibilities include database maintenance, optimizations and managing the update of our internal tools, dashboards and API.


Benefits


Initially well start with a contract project of a few weeks to see how we each like working together. All going well well transition this to a full-time capacity. All our roles offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible Location: The only requirement is two hours of crossover with our team 5 - 7pm EST
  • Flexible time-off




ABOUT FLOAT

Were a New York-based startup, with a global team delivering one of the worlds leading SaaS-based resource scheduling apps. Some of the best brands on the planet rely on us daily for their team scheduling including NASA, Google and Vice.

We have a small, growing, international team that includes members in New York, Australia, Portugal and Ukraine. Were looking for the best and so location is not important. We encourage people of different backgrounds and perspectives to join our team and deliver their best work.

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
jobs.content:
Your impact

As a dedicated Site Reliability Engineer you will help us define the best practices, tools and automation to ensure our fast growing SaaS provides best in class high availability while increasing engineering velocity. Your work will empower more than 7,000 businesses around the world to deliver a great customer support experience. This is a critical role that will influence every engineer in the company and directly impact our customer's satisfaction. No matter how elegant our product is, it means little if customers can't always access our site with great performance.

ABOUT THE ROLE
  • We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to build sophisticated continuous delivery and test automation to keep our AWS-based services highly available and fast while increasing the engineering team's velocity.
  • Help Scout engineering is 24 full time engineers organized into 6 teams. You will be a member of a small team with one engineer focused on continuous delivery (CD) pipelines, and 3 engineers focused on our AWS infrastructure and operations. Working with your team, you will partner with our feature delivery teams to build any automation they need to improve site reliability and velocity.
  • You will be responsible for working on our three biggest site reliability priorities: four 9s high availability, continuous delivery and test automation. You will own the implementation and roadmap planning for improvements to our automation, tools and tests to support these priorities. The majority of your time will be spent building or implementing continuous delivery, test and self-healing automation and supporting tools. You will be a key internal champion for any and all changes to make our production environments more resilient, scalable, and performant.
  • Your potential projects will include expanding our CI pipeline across all teams, testing and implementing auto-scaling groups, expanding our test automation (smoke, stress, chaos monkey, etc), and enhancing the velocity of our CI pipeline (parallel tasks, containers, etc).
  • This is not a primary on-call position. However you should expect to be called upon if services you own such as CD pipelines or test automation fail and primary on-call team members can't resolve the issue.
  • Our 100% remote engineering team spends most of their time in Slack and Github. Engineers can focus for long stretches with typically only 2 scheduled meetings a week (one with your team and one with your manager). Engineers write their own automated unit and integration tests, and use our CI pipeline to release code to production several times a day. You can read more about our culture and how our remote team stays agile at https://www.helpscout.net/blog/agile-remote-teams/

REQUIREMENTS

About You
  • You love building test automation that finds site reliability problems before they hit production while allowing software engineering teams to continuously deliver new capabilities.
  • You have worked extensively with a wide range of Amazon Web Services (EC2, ELB, EBS, RDS, VPCs, CloudFormation, etc) and are familiar with the benefits and challenges of their offerings. You know how to design systems for failure and how to autoscale and recover systems on AWS to ensure high availability.
  • You are well-versed in modern system orchestration, configuration management, and application deployment tooling and practices.
  • You have designed continuous delivery and test automation for SaaS projects supporting tens of thousands of simultaneous active users, so you have a good sense of what the road ahead looks like and what we could be doing better.
  • You have a deep understanding of what it takes to run web services at scale and have a solid understanding of Linux systems internals and networking; from kernel to shell, system libraries, file systems and client-server protocols.
  • You love to dig into the details and automate manual processes whenever possible. You're comfortable with tools providing operational insights, log searching, and stats analysis.
  • A big part of being great at your job revolves around being very organized and communicative. Itâs clear from your experience that you have those characteristics.
  • Youâve got a strong engineering background and have done a little of everything. Itâs clear you are a curious person that prefers to get stuff done rather than delegate.

ABOUT US

  • Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video conferencing.
  • Weâre a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the customer experience, no exceptions.
  • Our company is growing quickly and has aspirations of helping millions of people around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and require you to excel in every aspect of the position. Itâs hard work, but the people weâre looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
  • This is not the typical startup ârocket shipâ. Weâll never compromise customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life balance is an important priority.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. Weâll even buy your home office furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider.
  • International Benefit Stipend - If youâre based outside the US, youâll receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
  • 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and International Employees
  • Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent). Weâll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: https://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/171036

You will lead the implementation and roadmap planning for improvements to our automation, tools and tests to support these priorities.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
jobs.content:
Established in 1984 and headquartered in Henderson, Nevada, Aldec is an industry leader in Electronic Design Verification.  

We are seeking a remote, contract Digital Marketing Specialist to join our fast-moving marketing team to implement online marketing activities as directed by the Marketing Manager and Technical Marketing team to achieve business goals.  The right candidate will posses the ability to take initiative, anticipate needs and complete projects with minimal supervision.

Duties:
* Website Content: Leverage knowledge of current SEO and web design practices to update website content (pages, press releases, events, articles, etc.) as directed.  Must have proven experience maintaining visually appealing websites that attract and convert. 
* Email Campaigns: Implement email campaigns as directed by the Marketing Manager and Technical Marketing team and provide insight to management through analytics and reporting.
* Adwords: Implement and monitor Google Adwords and remarketing campaigns.
* Graphics: Ability to create and resize graphics as required. 
* Misc: Joining a small marketing team requires flexibility. Daily tasks might also include research, preparing materials for events, etc.

Experience and Requirements:
* 3+ years Digital Content Marketing experience.
* Intermediate HTML/CSS skills with knowledge of best SEO practices.
* Strong written communication skills.
* Proven project management abilities.
* Experience with Google Adwords and Google Analytics.
* Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator/InDesign skills
* Marketing Automation experience a plus.

Compensation: $30-35 per hour DOE. Additional bonus package after 90 days. 

Candidate to work remotely an average of 30 hours per week and must be available by phone or email for at least 4 hours during the US office workday (8am-5pm Pacific Time Zone). This is a contract position that does not include 401K, health benefits, or sick/vacation pay. 

To apply: Please email resume to jobs@aldec.com. Please include cover letter with links to previously managed sites.

jobs.title: Senior C# Developer
jobs.content:
RPS is transforming its business model to emphasize online capabilities.  We are looking for a senior developer experienced with extreme programming and other agile methodologies.  The candidate will help us transform manual processes and monolithic applications into modular and distributed components.  We will use these to provide self service and business intelligence to wholesale and retail insurance brokers.


It is important for this candidate to hold the highest level of commitment to unit testing and agile methodologies to help guide the team as it continues to grow.


RPS technical executives have a high level of commitment to developer training, tooling and resources to empower contributors to grow and perform at their highest levels.  We provide subscriptions to Pluralsight and Safari books online. We have a yearly team get together usually around a VSLive or some other training opportunity.

jobs.title: Director of Engineering - Software
jobs.content:
About us:
At Siempo we believe technology should be simple and mindful. We realized that we were constantly distracted and feeling over-connected by our smartphones. We couldnât find solutions we believed in, so we decided to build something new.

Siempo is a mindful phone with a focused feature-set of calling, texting, notes, calendar and Wi-Fi tethering. The natural language UX is designed to help minimize distractions and the focus feature helps you shield against distractions and do more of what you love.

Previously known as Minium(http://minium.co), we have iterated on the product direction over the past year and are thrilled to launch our new brand and a crowdfunding campaign this fall.

Weâre now looking for someone to drive our software team and deliver a beautiful, inspiring experience; someone excited about reshaping the way we interact with technology and playing a significant role in the early stages of a hardware-enabled software startup. We hope this person is you.

Weâre a small team based in Oakland and Chicago who are passionate about mindfulness, work-life balance and technology. Weâre focused on getting things done. Both as a company and as co-workers we value transparency and collaboration. We believe work should be fun and care as much about the culture as the product.

About you:
You speak Android OS fluently and are experienced with hardware projects. Youâve worked with independent design houses and/or ODMs, ideally in Asia. We imagine that you have brought up an OS on a new device, or developed a hardware/software product from scratch and taken it to mass market production. You know what it takes to work in a startup, youâre self-motivated and know how to lead a distributed team.

To apply: If this sounds like a fun challenge, please apply at http://siempo.co/apply.htmlYou may submit any supporting files that speak to who you are as a person and why you would be a good fit for this position. Resumes/CVs are great, but weâre also interested in anything that goes beyond such as past work or projects, GitHub account, or your personal blog.We read every application and look forward to hearing from you!
